31 #include "elements.h"

38 namespace oomph
39 {
40 
41 /// Static boolean to suppress warnings about repeated internal
42 /// data. Defaults to false
43 bool GeneralisedElement::Suppress_warning_about_repeated_internal_data=false;
44 
45 
46 /// Static boolean to suppress warnings about repeated external
47 /// data. Defaults to true
48 bool GeneralisedElement::Suppress_warning_about_repeated_external_data=true;
49 
50 
51 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
52 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
53 // Functions for generalised elements
54 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
55 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
56 
57 //=======================================================================
58 /// Add a (pointer to an) internal data object to the element and
59 /// return the index required to obtain it from the access
60 /// function \c internal_data_pt()
61 //=======================================================================
62  unsigned GeneralisedElement::add_internal_data(Data* const &data_pt,
63  const bool &fd)
64  {
65  //Local cache of numbers of internal and external data
66  const unsigned n_internal_data = Ninternal_data;
67  const unsigned n_external_data = Nexternal_data;
68 
69  //Find out whether the data is already stored in the array
70 
71  //Loop over the number of internals
72  //The internal data are stored at the beginning of the array
73  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_internal_data;i++)
74  {
75  //If the passed pointer is stored in the array
76  if(internal_data_pt(i) == data_pt)
77  {
78 #ifdef PARANOID
79  if (!Suppress_warning_about_repeated_internal_data)
80  {
81  oomph_info << std::endl << std::endl;
82  oomph_info
83  << "-----------------------------------------------------------------"
84  << std::endl
85  << "Info: Data is already included in this element's internal storage."
86  << std::endl
87  << "It's stored as entry " << i << " and I'm not adding it again."
88  << std::endl<< std::endl
89  << "Note: You can suppress this message by recompiling without"
90  << "\n PARANOID or setting the boolean \n"
91  << "\n GeneralisedElement::Suppress_warning_about_repeated_internal_data"
92  << "\n\n to true."
93  << std::endl
94  << "-----------------------------------------------------------------"
95  << std::endl << std::endl;
96  }
97 #endif
98  //Return the index to the data object
99  return i;
100  }
101  }
102 
103  //Allocate new storage for the pointers to data
104  Data** new_data_pt = new Data*[n_internal_data + n_external_data + 1];
105 
106  //Copy the old internal values across to the beginning of the array
107  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_internal_data;i++) {new_data_pt[i] = Data_pt[i];}
108 
109  //Now add the new value to the end of the internal data
110  new_data_pt[n_internal_data] = data_pt;
111 
112  //Copy the external values across
113  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_external_data;i++)
114  {new_data_pt[n_internal_data + 1 + i] = Data_pt[n_internal_data + i];}
115 
116  //Delete the storage associated with the previous values
117  delete[] Data_pt;
118 
119  //Set the pointer to the new storage
120  Data_pt = new_data_pt;
121 
122  //Resize the array of boolean flags
123  Data_fd.resize(n_internal_data + n_external_data + 1);
124  //Shuffle the flags for the external data to the end of the array
125  for(unsigned i=n_external_data;i>0;i--)
126  {
127  Data_fd[n_internal_data + i] = Data_fd[n_internal_data + i-1];
128  }
129  //Now add the new flag to the end of the internal data
130  Data_fd[n_internal_data] = fd;
131 
132  //Increase the number of internals
133  ++Ninternal_data;
134 
135  //Return the final index to the new internal data
136  return n_internal_data;
137  }
138 
139 //=======================================================================
140 /// Add the contents of the queue global_eqn_numbers to
141 /// the local storage for the equation numbers, which represents the
142 /// local-to-global translation scheme. It is essential that the entries
143 /// are added in order, i.e. from the front.
144 //=======================================================================
145  void GeneralisedElement::add_global_eqn_numbers(
146  std::deque<unsigned long> const &global_eqn_numbers,
147  std::deque<double*> const &global_dof_pt)
148  {
149  //Find the number of dofs
150  const unsigned n_dof = Ndof;
151  //Find the number of additional dofs
152  const unsigned n_additional_dof = global_eqn_numbers.size();
153  //If there are none, return immediately
154  if(n_additional_dof==0) {return;}
155 
156  //Find the new total number of equation numbers
157  const unsigned new_n_dof = n_dof + n_additional_dof;
158  //Create storage for all equations, initialised to NULL
159  unsigned long *new_eqn_number = new unsigned long[new_n_dof];
160 
161  //Copy over the existing values to the start new storage
162  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dof;i++) {new_eqn_number[i] = Eqn_number[i];}
163 
164  //Set an index to the next position in the new storage
165  unsigned index = n_dof;
166  //Loop over the queue and add it's entries to our new storage
167  for(std::deque<unsigned long>::const_iterator it=global_eqn_numbers.begin();
168  it!=global_eqn_numbers.end();++it)
169  {
170  //Add the value to the storage
171  new_eqn_number[index] = *it;
172  //Increase the array index
173  ++index;
174  }
175 
176 
177  //If a non-empty dof deque has been passed then do stuff
178  const unsigned n_additional_dof_pt = global_dof_pt.size();
179  if(n_additional_dof_pt > 0)
180  {
181 //If it's size is not the same as the equation numbers complain
182 #ifdef PARANOID
183  if(n_additional_dof_pt != n_additional_dof)
184  {
185  std::ostringstream error_stream;
186  error_stream
187  <<
188  "global_dof_pt is non-empty, yet it does not have the same size\n"
189  <<
190  "as global_eqn_numbers.\n"
191  <<
192  "There are " << n_additional_dof << " equation numbers,\n"
193  <<
194  "but " << n_additional_dof_pt << std::endl;
195 
196  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
197  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
198  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
199  }
200 #endif
201 
202  //Create storge for all dofs initialised to NULL
203  double **new_dof_pt = new double*[new_n_dof];
204  //Copy over the exisiting values to the start of new storage
205  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dof;i++) {new_dof_pt[i] = Dof_pt[i];}
206 
207  //Set an index to the next position in the new storage
208  unsigned index = n_dof;
209  //Loop over the queue and add it's entries to our new storage
210  for(std::deque<double*>::const_iterator it=global_dof_pt.begin();
211  it!=global_dof_pt.end();++it)
212  {
213  //Add the value to the storage
214  new_dof_pt[index] = *it;
215  //Increase the array index
216  ++index;
217  }
218 
219  //Now delete the old storage
220  delete[] Dof_pt;
221  //Set the pointer to address the new storage
222  Dof_pt = new_dof_pt;
223  }
224 
225  //Now delete the old for the equation numbers storage
226  delete[] Eqn_number;
227  //Set the pointer to address the new storage
228  Eqn_number = new_eqn_number;
229  //Finally update the number of degrees of freedom
230  Ndof = new_n_dof;
231  }
232 
233 //========================================================================
234 /// Empty dense matrix used as a dummy argument to combined
235 /// residual and jacobian functions in the case when only the residuals
236 /// are being assembled
237 //========================================================================
238 DenseMatrix<double> GeneralisedElement::Dummy_matrix;
239 
240 //========================================================================
241 /// Static storage used when pointers to the dofs are being assembled by
242 /// add_global_eqn_numbers()
243 //========================================================================
244 std::deque<double*> GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque;
245 
246 
247 //=========================================================================
248 /// Default value used as the increment for finite difference calculations
249 /// of the jacobian matrices
250 //=========================================================================
251  double GeneralisedElement::Default_fd_jacobian_step=1.0e-8;
252 
253 //==========================================================================
254 /// Destructor for generalised elements: Wipe internal data. Pointers
255 /// to external data get NULLed but are not deleted because they
256 /// are (generally) shared by lots of elements.
257 //==========================================================================
258  GeneralisedElement::~GeneralisedElement()
259  {
260  //Delete each of the objects stored as internal data
261  for(unsigned i=Ninternal_data;i>0;i--)
262  {
263  //The objects are stored at the beginning of the Data_pt array
264  delete Data_pt[i-1];
265  Data_pt[i-1] = 0;
266  }
267 
268  //Now delete the storage for internal and external data
269  delete[] Data_pt;
270 
271  //Now if we have allocated storage for the local equation for
272  //the internal and external data, delete it.
273  if(Data_local_eqn)
274  {
275  delete[] Data_local_eqn[0];
276  delete[] Data_local_eqn;
277  }
278 
279  //Delete the storage for the global equation numbers
280  delete[] Eqn_number;
281  }
282 
283 
284 //=======================================================================
285 /// Add a (pointer to an) external data object to the element and
286 /// return the index required to obtain it from the access
287 /// function \c external_data_pt()
288 //=======================================================================
289  unsigned GeneralisedElement::add_external_data(Data* const &data_pt,
290  const bool &fd)
291  {
292  //Find the numbers of internal and external data
293  const unsigned n_internal_data = Ninternal_data;
294  const unsigned n_external_data = Nexternal_data;
295  //Find out whether the data is already stored in the array
296 
297  //Loop over the number of externals
298  //The external data are stored at the end of the array Data_pt
299  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_external_data;i++)
300  {
301  //If the passed pointer is stored in the array
302  if(external_data_pt(i) == data_pt)
303  {
304 #ifdef PARANOID
305  if (!Suppress_warning_about_repeated_external_data)
306  {
307  oomph_info << std::endl << std::endl;
308  oomph_info
309  << "-----------------------------------------------------------------"
310  << std::endl
311  << "Info: Data is already included in this element's external storage."
312  << std::endl
313  << "It's stored as entry " << i << " and I'm not adding it again"
314  << std::endl << std::endl
315  << "Note: You can suppress this message by recompiling without"
316  << "\n PARANOID or setting the boolean \n"
317  << "\n GeneralisedElement::Suppress_warning_about_repeated_external_data"
318  << "\n\n to true."
319  << std::endl
320  << "-----------------------------------------------------------------"
321  << std::endl << std::endl;
322  }
323 #endif
324  //Return the index to the data object
325  return i;
326  }
327  }
328 
329  //Allocate new storage for the pointers to data
330  Data** new_data_pt = new Data*[n_internal_data + n_external_data + 1];
331 
332  //Copy the old internal and external values across to the new array
333  for(unsigned i=0;i<(n_internal_data + n_external_data);i++)
334  {new_data_pt[i] = Data_pt[i];}
335 
336  //Add the new data pointer to the end of the array
337  new_data_pt[n_internal_data + n_external_data] = data_pt;
338 
339  //Delete the storage associated with the previous values
340  delete[] Data_pt;
341 
342  //Set the pointer to the new storage
343  Data_pt = new_data_pt;
344 
345  //Resize the array of boolean flags
346  Data_fd.resize(n_internal_data + n_external_data + 1);
347  //Now add the new flag to the end of the external data
348  Data_fd[n_internal_data + n_external_data] = fd;
349 
350  //Increase the number of externals
351  ++Nexternal_data;
352 
353  //Return the final index to the new external data
354  return n_external_data;
355  }
356 
357 //========================================================================
358 /// Flush all the external data, i.e. clear the pointers to external
359 /// data from the internal storage.
360 //========================================================================
361  void GeneralisedElement::flush_external_data()
362  {
363  //Get the numbers of internal and external data
364  const unsigned n_external_data = Nexternal_data;
365  //If there is external data
366  if(n_external_data>0)
367  {
368  //Storage for new data, initialised to NULL
369  Data** new_data_pt=0;
370 
371  //Find the number of internal data
372  const unsigned n_internal_data = Ninternal_data;
373  //If there is internal data resize Data_pt and copy over
374  //the pointers
375  if(n_internal_data > 0)
376  {
377  //The new data pointer should only be the size of the internal data
378  new_data_pt = new Data*[n_internal_data];
379  //Copy over the internal data only
380  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_internal_data;i++) {new_data_pt[i] = Data_pt[i];}
381  }
382 
383  //Delete the old storage
384  delete[] Data_pt;
385  //Set the new storage, this will be NULL if there is no internal data
386  Data_pt = new_data_pt;
387  //Set the number of externals to zero
388  Nexternal_data = 0;
389 
390  //Resize the array of boolean flags to the number of internals
391  Data_fd.resize(n_internal_data);
392  }
393  }
394 
395 
396 
397 //=========================================================================
398 /// Remove the object addressed by data_pt from the external data array
399 /// Note that this could mess up the numbering of other external data
400 //========================================================================
401  void GeneralisedElement::flush_external_data(Data* const &data_pt)
402  {
403  //Get the current numbers of external data
404  const unsigned n_external_data = Nexternal_data;
405  //Index of the data to be removed
406  //We initialise this to be n_external_data, and it will be smaller than
407  //n_external_data if the data pointer is found in the array
408  unsigned index = n_external_data;
409  //Loop over the external data and find the argument
410  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_external_data;i++)
411  {
412  //If we have found the data pointer, set the index and break
413  if(external_data_pt(i) == data_pt)
414  {
415  index=i;
416  break;
417  }
418  }
419 
420  //If we have found an index less than Nexternal_data, then we have found
421  //the data in the array
422  if(index < n_external_data)
423  {
424  //Initialise a new array to NULL
425  Data** new_data_pt = 0;
426 
427  //Find the number of internals
428  const unsigned n_internal_data = Ninternal_data;
429 
430  //Find the new number of total data items (one fewer)
431  const unsigned n_total_data = n_internal_data + n_external_data - 1;
432 
433  //Create a new array containing the data items, if we have any
434  if(n_total_data > 0) {new_data_pt = new Data*[n_total_data];}
435 
436  //Copy over all the internal data
437  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_internal_data;i++) {new_data_pt[i] = Data_pt[i];}
438 
439  //Now copy over the un-flushed data
440  unsigned counter=0;
441  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_external_data;i++)
442  {
443  //If we are not at the deleted index
444  if(i!=index)
445  {
446  //Copy the undeleted entry into the next entry in our new
447  //array of pointers to Data
448  new_data_pt[n_internal_data + counter] = Data_pt[i];
449  //Increase the counter
450  ++counter;
451  }
452  }
453 
454  //Delete the storage associated with the previous values
455  delete[] Data_pt;
456 
457  //Set pointers to the new storage, will be NULL if no data left
458  Data_pt = new_data_pt;
459 
460  //Remove the entry from the array of boolean flags
461  Data_fd.erase(Data_fd.begin()+n_internal_data+index);
462 
463  //Decrease the number of externals
464  --Nexternal_data;
465 
466  //Issue a warning if there will be external data remaining
467  if(Nexternal_data > 1)
468  {
469  std::ostringstream warning_stream;
470  warning_stream << "Data removed from element's external data "
471  << std::endl
472  << "You may have to update the indices for remaining data "
473  << std::endl
474  << "This can be achieved by using add_external_data() "
475  << std::endl;
476  OomphLibWarning(warning_stream.str(),
477  "GeneralisedElement::flush_external_data()",
478  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
479  }
480  }
481  }
482 
483 
484 
485 //==========================================================================
486 /// This function loops over the internal data of the element and assigns
487 /// GLOBAL equation numbers to the data objects.
488 ///
489 /// Pass:
490 /// - the current total number of dofs, global_number, which gets
491 /// incremented.
492 /// - Dof_pt, the Vector of pointers to the global dofs
493 /// (to which any internal dofs are added).
494 /// .
495 //==========================================================================
496  void GeneralisedElement::
497  assign_internal_eqn_numbers(unsigned long &global_number,
498  Vector<double *> &Dof_pt)
499  {
500  //Loop over the internal data and assign the equation numbers
501  //The internal data are stored at the beginning of the Data_pt array
502  for(unsigned i=0;i<Ninternal_data;i++)
503  {internal_data_pt(i)->assign_eqn_numbers(global_number,Dof_pt);}
504  }
505 
506 
507 
508 //==========================================================================
509 /// \short Function to describe the dofs of the Element. The ostream
510 /// specifies the output stream to which the description
511 /// is written; the string stores the currently
512 /// assembled output that is ultimately written to the
513 /// output stream by Data::describe_dofs(...); it is typically
514 /// built up incrementally as we descend through the
515 /// call hierarchy of this function when called from
516 /// Problem::describe_dofs(...)
517 //==========================================================================
518  void GeneralisedElement::describe_dofs(std::ostream& out,
519  const std::string& current_string) const
520  {
521  for(unsigned i=0;i<Ninternal_data;i++)
522  {
523  std::stringstream conversion;
524  conversion <<" of Internal Data "<<i<<current_string;
525  std::string in(conversion.str());
526  internal_data_pt(i)->describe_dofs(out,in);
527  }
528  }
529 
530 //==========================================================================
531 /// \short Function to describe the local dofs of the element. The ostream
532 /// specifies the output stream to which the description
533 /// is written; the string stores the currently
534 /// assembled output that is ultimately written to the
535 /// output stream by Data::describe_dofs(...); it is typically
536 /// built up incrementally as we descend through the
537 /// call hierarchy of this function when called from
538 /// Problem::describe_dofs(...)
539 //==========================================================================
540 void GeneralisedElement::
541 describe_local_dofs(std::ostream& out,const std::string& current_string) const
542  {
543  // Find the number of internal and external data
544  const unsigned n_internal_data = Ninternal_data;
545  const unsigned n_external_data = Nexternal_data;
546 
547  // Now loop over the internal data and describe local equation numbers
548  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_internal_data;i++)
549  {
550  // Pointer to the internal data
551  Data* const data_pt = internal_data_pt(i);
552 
553  std::stringstream conversion;
554  conversion <<" of Internal Data "<<i<<current_string;
555  std::string in(conversion.str());
556  data_pt->describe_dofs(out,in);
557  }
558 
559 
560  // Now loop over the external data and assign local equation numbers
561  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_external_data;i++)
562  {
563  // Pointer to the external data
564  Data* const data_pt = external_data_pt(i);
565 
566  std::stringstream conversion;
567  conversion<<" of External Data "<<i<<current_string;
568  std::string in(conversion.str());
569  data_pt->describe_dofs(out,in);
570  }
571 
572  }
573 
574  //==========================================================================
575  /// This function loops over the internal data of the element and add
576  /// pointers to their unconstrained values to a map indexed by the global
577  /// equation number.
578  //==========================================================================
579  void GeneralisedElement:: add_internal_value_pt_to_map(
580  std::map<unsigned,double*> &map_of_value_pt)
581  {
582  //Loop over the internal data and add their data to the map
583  //The internal data are stored at the beginning of the Data_pt array
584  for(unsigned i=0;i<Ninternal_data;i++)
585  {internal_data_pt(i)->add_value_pt_to_map(map_of_value_pt);}
586  }
587 
588 
589 
590 
591 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
592  //=========================================================================
593  /// Add all internal data and time history values to the vector in
594  /// the internal storage order
595  //=========================================================================
596  void GeneralisedElement::add_internal_data_values_to_vector(
597  Vector<double> &vector_of_values)
598  {
599  for(unsigned i=0;i<Ninternal_data;i++)
600  {internal_data_pt(i)->add_values_to_vector(vector_of_values);}
601  }
602 
603  //========================================================================
604  /// Read all internal data and time history values from the vector
605  /// starting from index. On return the index will be
606  /// set to the value at the end of the data that has been read in
607  //========================================================================
608  void GeneralisedElement::read_internal_data_values_from_vector(
609  const Vector<double> &vector_of_values,
610  unsigned &index)
611  {
612  for(unsigned i=0;i<Ninternal_data;i++)
613  {internal_data_pt(i)->read_values_from_vector(vector_of_values,index);}
614  }
615 
616  //=========================================================================
617  /// Add all equation numbers associated with internal data
618  /// to the vector in the internal storage order
619  //=========================================================================
620  void GeneralisedElement::add_internal_eqn_numbers_to_vector(
621  Vector<long> &vector_of_eqn_numbers)
622  {
623  for(unsigned i=0;i<Ninternal_data;i++)
624  {internal_data_pt(i)->add_eqn_numbers_to_vector(vector_of_eqn_numbers);}
625  }
626 
627  //=========================================================================
628  /// Read all equation numbers associated with internal data
629  /// from the vector
630  /// starting from index. On return the index will be
631  /// set to the value at the end of the data that has been read in
632  //=========================================================================
633  void GeneralisedElement::read_internal_eqn_numbers_from_vector(
634  const Vector<long> & vector_of_eqn_numbers, unsigned &index)
635  {
636  for(unsigned i=0;i<Ninternal_data;i++)
637  {internal_data_pt(i)->read_eqn_numbers_from_vector(vector_of_eqn_numbers,
638  index);}
639  }
640 
641 #endif
642 
643 
644  //====================================================================
645  /// Setup the arrays of local equation numbers for the element.
646  /// In general, this function should not need to be overloaded. Instead
647  /// the function assign_all_generic_local_eqn_numbers() will be overloaded
648  /// by different types of Element.
649  /// That said, the function is virtual so that it
650  /// may be overloaded by the user if they *really* know what they are doing.
651  //==========================================================================
652  void GeneralisedElement::assign_local_eqn_numbers(
653  const bool &store_local_dof_pt)
654  {
655  clear_global_eqn_numbers();
656  assign_all_generic_local_eqn_numbers(store_local_dof_pt);
657  assign_additional_local_eqn_numbers();
658 
659  //Check that no global equation numbers are repeated
660 #ifdef PARANOID
661 
662  std::ostringstream error_stream;
663 
664  //Loop over the array of equation numbers and add to set to assess
665  //uniqueness
666  std::map<unsigned,bool> is_repeated;
667  std::set<unsigned long> set_of_global_eqn_numbers;
668  unsigned old_ndof=0;
669  for(unsigned n=0;n<Ndof;++n)
670  {
671  set_of_global_eqn_numbers.insert(Eqn_number[n]);
672  if (set_of_global_eqn_numbers.size()==old_ndof)
673  {
674  error_stream << "Repeated global eqn: " << Eqn_number[n] << std::endl;
675  is_repeated[Eqn_number[n]]=true;
676  }
677  old_ndof=set_of_global_eqn_numbers.size();
678  }
679 
680  //If the sizes do not match we have a repeat, throw an error
681  if(set_of_global_eqn_numbers.size() != Ndof)
682  {
683 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
684  error_stream << "Element is ";
685  if (!is_halo()) error_stream << "not ";
686  error_stream << "a halo element\n\n";
687 #endif
688  error_stream << "\nLocal/lobal equation numbers: " << std::endl;
689  for(unsigned n=0;n<Ndof;++n)
690  {
691  error_stream << " " << n << " " << Eqn_number[n] << std::endl;
692  }
693 
694  // It's helpful for debugging purposes to output more about this element
695  error_stream << std::endl << " element address is " << this << std::endl;
696 
697  // Check if the repeated dofs are among the internal Data values
698  unsigned nint=this->ninternal_data();
699  error_stream << "Number of internal data " << nint << std::endl;
700  for (unsigned i=0;i<nint;i++)
701  {
702  Data* data_pt=this->internal_data_pt(i);
703  unsigned nval=data_pt->nvalue();
704  for (unsigned j=0;j<nval;j++)
705  {
706  int eqn_no=data_pt->eqn_number(j);
707  error_stream << "Internal dof: " << eqn_no << std::endl;
708  if (is_repeated[unsigned(eqn_no)])
709  {
710  error_stream << "Repeated internal dof: " << eqn_no << std::endl;
711  }
712  }
713  }
714 
715  // Check if the repeated dofs are among the external Data values
716  unsigned next=this->nexternal_data();
717  error_stream << "Number of external data " << next << std::endl;
718  for (unsigned i=0;i<next;i++)
719  {
720  Data* data_pt=this->external_data_pt(i);
721  unsigned nval=data_pt->nvalue();
722  for (unsigned j=0;j<nval;j++)
723  {
724  int eqn_no=data_pt->eqn_number(j);
725  error_stream << "External dof: " << eqn_no << std::endl;
726  if (is_repeated[unsigned(eqn_no)])
727  {
728  error_stream << "Repeated external dof: " << eqn_no;
729  Node* nod_pt=dynamic_cast<Node*>(data_pt);
730  if (nod_pt!=0)
731  {
732  error_stream << " (is a node at: ";
733  unsigned ndim=nod_pt->ndim();
734  for (unsigned ii=0;ii<ndim;ii++)
735  {
736  error_stream << nod_pt->x(ii) << " ";
737  }
738  }
739  error_stream << ")\n";
740  }
741  }
742  }
743 
744 
745  // If it's an element with external element check the associated
746  // Data
747  ElementWithExternalElement* e_el_pt=
748  dynamic_cast<ElementWithExternalElement*>(this);
749  if (e_el_pt!=0)
750  {
751  // Check if the repeated dofs are among the external Data values
752  {
753  unsigned next=e_el_pt->nexternal_interaction_field_data();
754  error_stream << "Number of external element data " << next << std::endl;
755  Vector<Data*> data_pt(e_el_pt->external_interaction_field_data_pt());
756  for (unsigned i=0;i<next;i++)
757  {
758  unsigned nval=data_pt[i]->nvalue();
759  for (unsigned j=0;j<nval;j++)
760  {
761  int eqn_no=data_pt[i]->eqn_number(j);
762  error_stream << "External element dof: " << eqn_no << std::endl;
763  if (is_repeated[unsigned(eqn_no)])
764  {
765  error_stream << "Repeated external element dof: "
766  << eqn_no;
767  Node* nod_pt=dynamic_cast<Node*>(data_pt[i]);
768  if (nod_pt!=0)
769  {
770  error_stream << " (is a node at: ";
771  unsigned ndim=nod_pt->ndim();
772  for (unsigned ii=0;ii<ndim;ii++)
773  {
774  error_stream << nod_pt->x(ii) << " ";
775  }
776  }
777  error_stream << ")\n";
778  }
779  }
780  }
781  }
782 
783 
784  // Check if the repeated dofs are among the external geom Data values
785  {
786  unsigned next=e_el_pt->nexternal_interaction_geometric_data();
787  error_stream << "Number of external element geom data "
788  << next << std::endl;
789  Vector<Data*> data_pt(e_el_pt->
790  external_interaction_geometric_data_pt());
791  for (unsigned i=0;i<next;i++)
792  {
793  unsigned nval=data_pt[i]->nvalue();
794  for (unsigned j=0;j<nval;j++)
795  {
796  int eqn_no=data_pt[i]->eqn_number(j);
797  error_stream << "External element geometric dof: "
798  << eqn_no << std::endl;
799  if (is_repeated[unsigned(eqn_no)])
800  {
801  error_stream << "Repeated external element geometric dof: "
802  << eqn_no << " "
803  << data_pt[i]->value(j);
804  Node* nod_pt=dynamic_cast<Node*>(data_pt[i]);
805  if (nod_pt!=0)
806  {
807  error_stream << " (is a node at: ";
808  unsigned ndim=nod_pt->ndim();
809  for (unsigned ii=0;ii<ndim;ii++)
810  {
811  error_stream << nod_pt->x(i) << " ";
812  }
813  error_stream << ")";
814  }
815  error_stream << "\n";
816  }
817  }
818  }
819  }
820 
821  }
822 
823  // If it's a FiniteElement then output its nodes
824  FiniteElement* f_el_pt=dynamic_cast<FiniteElement*>(this);
825  if (f_el_pt!=0)
826  {
827  unsigned n_node=f_el_pt->nnode();
828  for (unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
829  {
830  Node* nod_pt=f_el_pt->node_pt(n);
831  unsigned nval=nod_pt->nvalue();
832  for (unsigned j=0;j<nval;j++)
833  {
834  int eqn_no=nod_pt->eqn_number(j);
835  error_stream << "Node " << n
836  << ": Nodal dof: "
837  << eqn_no;
838  if (eqn_no>=0)
839  {
840  if (is_repeated[unsigned(eqn_no)])
841  {
842  error_stream << "Node " << n
843  << ": Repeated nodal dof: "
844  << eqn_no;
845  if (j>=f_el_pt->required_nvalue(n))
846  {
847  error_stream << " (resized)";
848  }
849  error_stream << std::endl;
850  }
851  }
852  }
853  SolidNode* solid_nod_pt=dynamic_cast<SolidNode*>(nod_pt);
854  if (solid_nod_pt!=0)
855  {
856  Data* data_pt=solid_nod_pt->variable_position_pt();
857  unsigned nval=data_pt->nvalue();
858  for (unsigned j=0;j<nval;j++)
859  {
860  int eqn_no=data_pt->eqn_number(j);
861  error_stream << "Node " << n << ": Positional dof: "
862  << eqn_no << std::endl;
863  if (is_repeated[unsigned(eqn_no)])
864  {
865  error_stream << "Repeated positional dof: "
866  << eqn_no << " " << data_pt->value(j) << std::endl;
867  }
868  }
869  }
870  }
871 
872  // Output nodal coordinates of element
873  n_node=f_el_pt->nnode();
874  for (unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
875  {
876  Node* nod_pt=f_el_pt->node_pt(n);
877  unsigned n_dim=nod_pt->ndim();
878  error_stream << "Node " << n << " at ( ";
879  for (unsigned i=0;i<n_dim;i++)
880  {
881  error_stream << nod_pt->x(i) << " ";
882  }
883  error_stream << ")" << std::endl;
884  }
885 
886  }
887 
888 
889  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
890  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
891  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
892  }
893 #endif
894  }
895 
896 
897 //==========================================================================
898 /// This function loops over the internal and external data of the element,
899 /// adds the GLOBAL equation numbers to the local-to-global look-up scheme and
900 /// fills in the look-up schemes for the local equation
901 /// numbers.
902 /// If the boolean argument is true then pointers to the dofs will be
903 /// stored in Dof_pt
904 //==========================================================================
905  void GeneralisedElement::assign_internal_and_external_local_eqn_numbers(
906  const bool &store_local_dof_pt)
907  {
908  //Find the number of internal and external data
909  const unsigned n_internal_data = Ninternal_data;
910  const unsigned n_external_data = Nexternal_data;
911  //Find the total number of data
912  const unsigned n_total_data = n_internal_data + n_external_data;
913 
914  //If there is data
915  if(n_total_data > 0)
916  {
917  //Find the number of local equations assigned so far
918  unsigned local_eqn_number = ndof();
919 
920  //We need to find the total number of values stored in all the
921  //internal and external data
922  //Initialise to the number stored in the first data object
923  unsigned n_total_values = Data_pt[0]->nvalue();
924  //Loop over the other data and add the number of values stored
925  for(unsigned i=1;i<n_total_data;++i)
926  {n_total_values += Data_pt[i]->nvalue();}
927 
928  //If allocated delete the old storage
929  if(Data_local_eqn)
930  {
931  delete[] Data_local_eqn[0];
932  delete[] Data_local_eqn;
933  }
934 
935  //If there are no values then we are done, null out the storage and
936  //return
937  if(n_total_values==0) {Data_local_eqn=0; return;}
938 
939  //Allocate the storage for the local equation numbers
940  //The idea is that we store internal equation numbers followed by
941  //external equation numbers
942 
943  //Firstly allocate pointers to the rows for each data item
944  Data_local_eqn = new int*[n_total_data];
945  //Now allocate storage for all the equation numbers
946  Data_local_eqn[0] = new int[n_total_values];
947  //Set all values to be unclassified
948  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_total_values;++i)
949  {Data_local_eqn[0][i] = Data::Is_unclassified;}
950 
951  //Loop over the remaining rows and set their pointers
952  for(unsigned i=1;i<n_total_data;++i)
953  {
954  //Initially set the pointer to the i-th row to the pointer
955  //to the i-1th row
956  Data_local_eqn[i] = Data_local_eqn[i-1];
957  //Now increase the row pointer by the number of values
958  //stored at the i-1th data object
959  Data_local_eqn[i] += Data_pt[i-1]->nvalue();
960  }
961 
962  //A local queue to store the global equation numbers
963  std::deque<unsigned long> global_eqn_number_queue;
964 
965  //Now loop over the internal data and assign local equation numbers
966  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_internal_data;i++)
967  {
968  //Pointer to the internal data
969  Data* const data_pt = internal_data_pt(i);
970  //Find the number of values stored at the internal data
971  unsigned n_value = data_pt->nvalue();
972 
973  //Loop over the number of values
974  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_value;j++)
975  {
976  //Get the GLOBAL equation number
977  long eqn_number = data_pt->eqn_number(j);
978  //If the GLOBAL equation number is positive (a free variable)
979  if(eqn_number >= 0)
980  {
981  //Add the GLOBAL equation number to the queue
982  global_eqn_number_queue.push_back(eqn_number);
983  //Add pointer to the dof to the queue if required
984  if(store_local_dof_pt)
985  {
986  GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque.push_back(data_pt->value_pt(j));
987  }
988  //Add the local equation number to the storage scheme
989  Data_local_eqn[i][j] = local_eqn_number;
990  //Increase the local number
991  local_eqn_number++;
992  }
993  else
994  {
995  //Set the local scheme to be pinned
996  Data_local_eqn[i][j] = Data::Is_pinned;
997  }
998  }
999  } //End of loop over internal data
1000 
1001 
1002  //Now loop over the external data and assign local equation numbers
1003  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_external_data;i++)
1004  {
1005  //Pointer to the external data
1006  Data* const data_pt = external_data_pt(i);
1007  //Find the number of values stored at the external data
1008  unsigned n_value = data_pt->nvalue();
1009 
1010  //Loop over the number of values
1011  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_value;j++)
1012  {
1013  //Get the GLOBAL equation number
1014  long eqn_number = data_pt->eqn_number(j);
1015  //If the GLOBAL equation number is positive (a free variable)
1016  if(eqn_number >= 0)
1017  {
1018  //Add the GLOBAL equation number to the queue
1019  global_eqn_number_queue.push_back(eqn_number);
1020  //Add pointer to the dof to the queue if required
1021  if(store_local_dof_pt)
1022  {
1023  GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque.push_back(data_pt->value_pt(j));
1024  }
1025  //Add the local equation number to the local scheme
1026  Data_local_eqn[n_internal_data + i][j] = local_eqn_number;
1027  //Increase the local number
1028  local_eqn_number++;
1029  }
1030  else
1031  {
1032  //Set the local scheme to be pinned
1033  Data_local_eqn[n_internal_data + i][j] = Data::Is_pinned;
1034  }
1035  }
1036  }
1037 
1038  //Now add our global equations numbers to the internal element storage
1039  add_global_eqn_numbers(global_eqn_number_queue,
1040  GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque);
1041  //Clear the memory used in the deque
1042  if(store_local_dof_pt)
1043  {std::deque<double*>().swap(GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque);}
1044  }
1045  }
1046 
1047 
1048 //============================================================================
1049 /// This function calculates the entries of Jacobian matrix, used in
1050 /// the Newton method, associated with the internal degrees of freedom.
1051 /// It does this using finite differences,
1052 /// rather than an analytical formulation, so can be done in total generality.
1053 /// If the boolean argument is true, the finite
1054 /// differencing will be performed for all internal data, irrespective of
1055 /// the information in Data_fd. The default value (false)
1056 /// uses the information in Data_fd to selectively difference only
1057 /// certain data.
1058 //==========================================================================
1059  void GeneralisedElement::
1060  fill_in_jacobian_from_internal_by_fd(Vector<double> &residuals,
1061  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
1062  const bool &fd_all_data)
1063  {
1064  //Locally cache the number of internal data
1065  const unsigned n_internal_data = Ninternal_data;
1066 
1067  //If there aren't any internal data, then return straight away
1068  if(n_internal_data == 0) {return;}
1069 
1070  //Call the update function to ensure that the element is in
1071  //a consistent state before finite differencing starts
1072  update_before_internal_fd();
1073 
1074  //Find the number of dofs in the element
1075  const unsigned n_dof = ndof();
1076 
1077  //Create newres vector
1078  Vector<double> newres(n_dof);
1079 
1080  //Integer storage for local unknown
1081  int local_unknown=0;
1082 
1083  //Use the default finite difference step
1084  const double fd_step = Default_fd_jacobian_step;
1085 
1086  //Loop over the internal data
1087  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_internal_data;i++)
1088  {
1089  //If we are doing all finite differences or
1090  //the variable is included in the finite difference loop, do it
1091  if(fd_all_data || internal_data_fd(i))
1092  {
1093  //Get the number of value at the internal data
1094  const unsigned n_value = internal_data_pt(i)->nvalue();
1095 
1096  //Loop over the number of values
1097  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_value;j++)
1098  {
1099  //Get the local equation number
1100  local_unknown = internal_local_eqn(i,j);
1101  //If it's not pinned
1102  if(local_unknown >= 0)
1103  {
1104  //Get a pointer to the value of the internal data
1105  double* const value_pt = internal_data_pt(i)->value_pt(j);
1106 
1107  //Save the old value of the Internal data
1108  const double old_var = *value_pt;
1109 
1110  //Increment the value of the Internal data
1111  *value_pt += fd_step;
1112 
1113  //Now update any dependent variables
1114  update_in_internal_fd(i);
1115 
1116  //Calculate the new residuals
1117  get_residuals(newres);
1118 
1119  //Do finite differences
1120  for(unsigned m=0;m<n_dof;m++)
1121  {
1122  double sum = (newres[m] - residuals[m])/fd_step;
1123  //Stick the entry into the Jacobian matrix
1124  jacobian(m,local_unknown) = sum;
1125  }
1126 
1127  //Reset the Internal data
1128  *value_pt = old_var;
1129 
1130  //Reset any dependent variables
1131  reset_in_internal_fd(i);
1132  }
1133  }
1134  } //End of finite-differencing for datum (if block)
1135  }
1136 
1137  //End of finite difference loop
1138  //Final reset of any dependent data
1139  reset_after_internal_fd();
1140  }
1141 
1142 //============================================================================
1143 /// This function calculates the entries of Jacobian matrix, used in
1144 /// the Newton method, associated with the external degrees of freedom.
1145 /// It does this using finite differences,
1146 /// rather than an analytical formulation, so can be done in total generality.
1147 /// If the boolean argument is true, the finite
1148 /// differencing will be performed for all internal data, irrespective of
1149 /// the information in Data_fd. The default value (false)
1150 /// uses the information in Data_fd to selectively difference only
1151 /// certain data.
1152 //==========================================================================
1153  void GeneralisedElement::
1154  fill_in_jacobian_from_external_by_fd(Vector<double> &residuals,
1155  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
1156  const bool &fd_all_data)
1157  {
1158  //Locally cache the number of external data
1159  const unsigned n_external_data = Nexternal_data;
1160  //If there aren't any external data, then return straight away
1161  if(n_external_data == 0) {return;}
1162 
1163  //Call the update function to ensure that the element is in
1164  //a consistent state before finite differencing starts
1165  update_before_external_fd();
1166 
1167  //Find the number of dofs in the element
1168  const unsigned n_dof = ndof();
1169 
1170  //Create newres vector
1171  Vector<double> newres(n_dof);
1172 
1173  //Integer storage for local unknown
1174  int local_unknown=0;
1175 
1176  //Use the default finite difference step
1177  const double fd_step = Default_fd_jacobian_step;
1178 
1179  //Loop over the external data
1180  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_external_data;i++)
1181  {
1182  //If we are doing all finite differences or
1183  //the variable is included in the finite difference loop, do it
1184  if(fd_all_data || external_data_fd(i))
1185  {
1186  //Get the number of value at the external data
1187  const unsigned n_value = external_data_pt(i)->nvalue();
1188 
1189  //Loop over the number of values
1190  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_value;j++)
1191  {
1192  //Get the local equation number
1193  local_unknown = external_local_eqn(i,j);
1194  //If it's not pinned
1195  if(local_unknown >= 0)
1196  {
1197  //Get a pointer to the External data value
1198  double* const value_pt = external_data_pt(i)->value_pt(j);
1199 
1200  //Save the old value of the External data
1201  const double old_var = *value_pt;
1202 
1203  //Increment the value of the External data
1204  *value_pt += fd_step;
1205 
1206  //Now update any dependent variables
1207  update_in_external_fd(i);
1208 
1209  //Calculate the new residuals
1210  get_residuals(newres);
1211 
1212  //Do finite differences
1213  for(unsigned m=0;m<n_dof;m++)
1214  {
1215  double sum = (newres[m] - residuals[m])/fd_step;
1216  //Stick the entry into the Jacobian matrix
1217  jacobian(m,local_unknown) = sum;
1218  }
1219 
1220  //Reset the External data
1221  *value_pt = old_var;
1222 
1223  //Reset any dependent variables
1224  reset_in_external_fd(i);
1225  }
1226  }
1227  } //End of finite differencing for datum (if block)
1228  }
1229 
1230  //End of finite difference loop
1231  //Final reset of any dependent data
1232  reset_after_external_fd();
1233  }
1234 
1235  //=====================================================================
1236  /// \short Add the elemental contribution to the mass matrix
1237  /// and the residuals vector. Note that
1238  /// this function will NOT initialise the residuals vector or the mass
1239  /// matrix. It must be called after the residuals vector and
1240  /// jacobian matrix have been initialised to zero. The default
1241  /// is deliberately broken.
1242  //=====================================================================
1243  void GeneralisedElement::
1244  fill_in_contribution_to_mass_matrix(Vector<double> &residuals,
1245  DenseMatrix<double> &mass_matrix)
1246  {
1247  std::string error_message =
1248  "Empty fill_in_contribution_to_mass_matrix() has been called.\n";
1249  error_message +=
1250  "This function is called from the default implementation of\n";
1251  error_message += "get_mass_matrix();\n";
1252  error_message +=
1253  "and must calculate the residuals vector and mass matrix ";
1254  error_message += "without initialising any of their entries.\n\n";
1255 
1256  error_message +=
1257  "If you do not wish to use these defaults, you must overload\n";
1258  error_message +=
1259  "get_mass_matrix(), which must initialise the entries\n";
1260  error_message +=
1261  "of the residuals vector and mass matrix to zero.\n";
1262 
1263  throw
1264  OomphLibError(error_message,
1265  "GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_mass_matrix()",
1266  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1267  }
1268 
1269  //=====================================================================
1270  /// \short Add the elemental contribution to the jacobian matrix,
1271  /// mass matrix and the residuals vector. Note that
1272  /// this function should NOT initialise any entries.
1273  /// It must be called after the residuals vector and
1274  /// matrices have been initialised to zero. The default is deliberately
1275  /// broken.
1276  //=====================================================================
1277  void GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_jacobian_and_mass_matrix(
1278  Vector<double> &residuals,
1279  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian, DenseMatrix<double> &mass_matrix)
1280  {
1281  std::string error_message =
1282  "Empty fill_in_contribution_to_jacobian_and_mass_matrix() has been ";
1283  error_message += "called.\n";
1284  error_message +=
1285  "This function is called from the default implementation of\n";
1286  error_message += "get_jacobian_and_mass_matrix();\n";
1287  error_message +=
1288  "and must calculate the residuals vector and mass and jacobian matrices ";
1289  error_message += "without initialising any of their entries.\n\n";
1290 
1291  error_message +=
1292  "If you do not wish to use these defaults, you must overload\n";
1293  error_message +=
1294  "get_jacobian_and_mass_matrix(), which must initialise the entries\n";
1295  error_message +=
1296  "of the residuals vector, jacobian and mass matrix to zero.\n";
1297 
1298  throw
1299  OomphLibError(
1300  error_message,
1301  "GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_jacobian_and_mass_matrix()",
1302  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1303  }
1304 
1305 
1306  //=====================================================================
1307  /// Add the elemental contribution to the derivatives of
1308  /// the residuals with respect to a parameter. This function should
1309  /// NOT initialise any entries and must be called after the entries
1310  /// have been initialised to zero
1311  /// The default implementation is deliberately broken
1312  //========================================================================
1313  void GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_dresiduals_dparameter(
1314  double* const &parameter_pt, Vector<double> &dres_dparam)
1315  {
1316  std::string error_message =
1317  "Empty fill_in_contribution_to_dresiduals_dparameter() has been ";
1318  error_message += "called.\n";
1319  error_message +=
1320  "This function is called from the default implementation of\n";
1321  error_message += "get_dresiduals_dparameter();\n";
1322  error_message +=
1323  "and must calculate the derivatives of the residuals vector with respect\n";
1324  error_message += "to the passed parameter ";
1325  error_message += "without initialising any values.\n\n";
1326 
1327  error_message +=
1328  "If you do not wish to use these defaults, you must overload\n";
1329  error_message +=
1330  "get_dresiduals_dparameter(), which must initialise the entries\n";
1331  error_message +=
1332  "of the returned vector to zero.\n";
1333 
1334  error_message +=
1335  "This function is intended for use instead of the default (global) \n";
1336  error_message +=
1337  "finite-difference routine when analytic expressions are to be used\n";
1338  error_message += "in continuation and bifurcation tracking problems.\n\n";
1339  error_message += "This function is only called when the function\n";
1340  error_message +=
1341  "Problem::set_analytic_dparameter() has been called in the driver code\n";
1342 
1343  throw
1344  OomphLibError(
1345  error_message,
1346  "GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_dresiduals_dparameter()",
1347  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1348  }
1349 
1350  //======================================================================
1351  /// Add the elemental contribution to the derivatives of
1352  /// the elemental Jacobian matrix
1353  /// and residuals with respect to a parameter. This function should
1354  /// NOT initialise any entries and must be called after the entries
1355  /// have been initialised to zero
1356  /// The default implementation is to use finite differences to calculate
1357  /// the derivatives.
1358  //========================================================================
1359  void GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_djacobian_dparameter(
1360  double* const &parameter_pt,
1361  Vector<double> &dres_dparam,
1362  DenseMatrix<double> &djac_dparam)
1363  {
1364  std::string error_message =
1365  "Empty fill_in_contribution_to_djacobian_dparameter() has been ";
1366  error_message += "called.\n";
1367  error_message +=
1368  "This function is called from the default implementation of\n";
1369  error_message += "get_djacobian_dparameter();\n";
1370  error_message +=
1371  "and must calculate the derivatives of residuals vector and jacobian ";
1372  error_message += "matrix\n";
1373  error_message += "with respect to the passed parameter ";
1374  error_message += "without initialising any values.\n\n";
1375 
1376  error_message +=
1377  "If you do not wish to use these defaults, you must overload\n";
1378  error_message +=
1379  "get_djacobian_dparameter(), which must initialise the entries\n";
1380  error_message +=
1381  "of the returned vector and matrix to zero.\n\n";
1382 
1383  error_message +=
1384  "This function is intended for use instead of the default (global) \n";
1385  error_message +=
1386  "finite-difference routine when analytic expressions are to be used\n";
1387  error_message += "in continuation and bifurcation tracking problems.\n\n";
1388  error_message += "This function is only called when the function\n";
1389  error_message +=
1390  "Problem::set_analytic_dparameter() has been called in the driver code\n";
1391 
1392 
1393  throw
1394  OomphLibError(
1395  error_message,
1396  "GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_djacobian_dparameter()",
1397  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1398  }
1399 
1400 
1401  //=====================================================================
1402  /// \short Add the elemental contribution to the derivative of the
1403  /// jacobian matrix,
1404  /// mass matrix and the residuals vector with respect to a parameter.
1405  /// Note that
1406  /// this function should NOT initialise any entries.
1407  /// It must be called after the residuals vector and
1408  /// matrices have been initialised to zero. The default is deliberately
1409  /// broken.
1410  //=====================================================================
1411  void GeneralisedElement::
1412  fill_in_contribution_to_djacobian_and_dmass_matrix_dparameter(
1413  double* const &parameter_pt,
1414  Vector<double> &dres_dparam,
1415  DenseMatrix<double> &djac_dparam,
1416  DenseMatrix<double> &dmass_matrix_dparam)
1417  {
1418  std::string error_message =
1419  "Empty fill_in_contribution_to_djacobian_and_dmass_matrix_dparameter() has";
1420  error_message += " been called.\n";
1421  error_message +=
1422  "This function is called from the default implementation of\n";
1423  error_message += "get_djacobian_and_dmass_matrix_dparameter();\n";
1424  error_message +=
1425  "and must calculate the residuals vector and mass and jacobian matrices ";
1426  error_message += "without initialising any of their entries.\n\n";
1427 
1428  error_message +=
1429  "If you do not wish to use these defaults, you must overload\n";
1430  error_message +=
1431  "get_djacobian_and_dmass_matrix_dparameter(), which must initialise the\n";
1432  error_message +=
1433  "entries of the returned vector and matrices to zero.\n";
1434 
1435 
1436  error_message +=
1437  "This function is intended for use instead of the default (global) \n";
1438  error_message +=
1439  "finite-difference routine when analytic expressions are to be used\n";
1440  error_message += "in continuation and bifurcation tracking problems.\n\n";
1441  error_message += "This function is only called when the function\n";
1442  error_message +=
1443  "Problem::set_analytic_dparameter() has been called in the driver code\n";
1444 
1445 
1446 
1447  throw
1448  OomphLibError(
1449  error_message,
1450  "GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_djacobian_and_dmass_matrix_dparameter()",
1451  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1452  }
1453 
1454 
1455 
1456  //========================================================================
1457  /// Fill in contribution to the product of the Hessian
1458  /// (derivative of Jacobian with
1459  /// respect to all variables) an eigenvector, Y, and
1460  /// other specified vectors, C
1461  /// (d(J_{ij})/d u_{k}) Y_{j} C_{k}
1462  /// At the moment the dof pointer is passed in to enable
1463  /// easy calculation of finite difference default
1464 //==========================================================================
1465  void GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_hessian_vector_products(
1466  Vector<double> const &Y,
1467  DenseMatrix<double> const &C,
1468  DenseMatrix<double> &product)
1469  {
1470  std::string error_message =
1471  "Empty fill_in_contribution_to_hessian_vector_products() has been ";
1472  error_message += "called.\n";
1473  error_message +=
1474  "This function is called from the default implementation of\n";
1475  error_message += "get_hessian_vector_products(); ";
1476  error_message += " and must calculate the products \n";
1477  error_message += "of the hessian matrix with the (global) ";
1478  error_message += "vectors Y and C\n";
1479  error_message += "without initialising any values.\n\n";
1480 
1481  error_message +=
1482  "If you do not wish to use these defaults, you must overload\n";
1483  error_message +=
1484  "get_hessian_vector_products(), which must initialise the entries\n";
1485  error_message +=
1486  "of the returned vector to zero.\n\n";
1487 
1488  error_message +=
1489  "This function is intended for use instead of the default (global) \n";
1490  error_message +=
1491  "finite-difference routine when analytic expressions are to be used.\n";
1492  error_message += "This function is only called when the function\n";
1493  error_message +=
1494  "Problem::set_analytic_hessian_products() has been called in the driver code\n";
1495 
1496  throw
1497  OomphLibError(
1498  error_message,
1499  "GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_hessian_vector_product()",
1500  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1501  }
1502 
1503  //========================================================================
1504  /// Fill in the contribution to the inner products between given
1505  /// pairs of history values
1506  //==========================================================================
1507  void GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_inner_products(
1508  Vector<std::pair<unsigned,unsigned> > const &history_index,
1509  Vector<double> &inner_product)
1510  {
1511  std::string error_message =
1512  "Empty fill_in_contribution_to_inner_products() has been called.\n";
1513  error_message +=
1514  "This function is called from the default implementation of\n";
1515  error_message += "get_inner_products();\n ";
1516  error_message += "It must calculate the inner products over the element\n";
1517  error_message += "of given pairs of history values\n";
1518  error_message += "without initialision of the output vector.\n\n";
1519 
1520  error_message +=
1521  "If you do not wish to use these defaults, you must overload\n";
1522  error_message +=
1523  "get_inner_products(), which must initialise the entries\n";
1524  error_message +=
1525  "of the returned vector to zero.\n\n";
1526 
1527  throw
1528  OomphLibError(
1529  error_message,
1530  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1531  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1532  }
1533 
1534  //========================================================================
1535  /// \short Fill in the contributions to the vectors that when taken
1536  /// as dot product with other history values give the inner product
1537  /// over the element
1538  //==========================================================================
1539  void GeneralisedElement::fill_in_contribution_to_inner_product_vectors(
1540  Vector<unsigned> const &history_index,
1541  Vector<Vector<double> > &inner_product_vector)
1542  {
1543  std::string error_message =
1544  "Empty fill_in_contribution_to_inner_product_vectors() has been called.\n";
1545  error_message +=
1546  "This function is called from the default implementation of\n";
1547  error_message += "get_inner_product_vectors(); ";
1548  error_message += " and must calculate the vectors \n";
1549  error_message += "corresponding to the input history values\n ";
1550  error_message += "that when multiplied by other vectors of history values\n";
1551  error_message += "return the appropriate dot products.\n\n";
1552  error_message += "The output vectors must not be initialised.\n\n";
1553 
1554  error_message +=
1555  "If you do not wish to use these defaults, you must overload\n";
1556  error_message +=
1557  "get_inner_products(), which must initialise the entries\n";
1558  error_message +=
1559  "of the returned vector to zero.\n\n";
1560 
1561  throw
1562  OomphLibError(
1563  error_message,
1564  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1565  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1566  }
1567 
1568 
1569 
1570 
1571 
1572 //==========================================================================
1573 /// Self-test: Have all internal values been classified as
1574 /// pinned/unpinned? Return 0 if OK.
1575 //==========================================================================
1576  unsigned GeneralisedElement::self_test()
1577  {
1578  // Initialise
1579  bool passed=true;
1580 
1581  //Loop over internal Data
1582  for(unsigned i=0;i<Ninternal_data;i++)
1583  {
1584  if(internal_data_pt(i)->self_test()!=0)
1585  {
1586  passed=false;
1587  oomph_info
1588  << "\n ERROR: Failed GeneralisedElement::self_test()!" << std::endl;
1589  oomph_info
1590  << "for internal data object number: " << i << std::endl;
1591  }
1592  }
1593 
1594  //Loop over external Data
1595  for(unsigned i=0;i<Nexternal_data;i++)
1596  {
1597  if(external_data_pt(i)->self_test()!=0)
1598  {
1599  passed=false;
1600  oomph_info
1601  << "\n ERROR: Failed GeneralisedElement::self_test()!" << std::endl;
1602  oomph_info
1603  << "for external data object number: " << i << std::endl;
1604  }
1605  }
1606 
1607  // Return verdict
1608  if (passed) {return 0;}
1609  else {return 1;}
1610  }
1611 
1612 
1613 //======================================================================
1614 /// Helper namespace for tolerances, number of iterations, etc
1615 /// used in the locate_zeta function in FiniteElement
1616 //======================================================================
1617 namespace Locate_zeta_helpers
1618 {
1619  /// Convergence tolerance for the newton solver
1620  double Newton_tolerance = 1.0e-7;
1621 
1622  /// Maximum number of newton iterations
1623  unsigned Max_newton_iterations = 10;
1624 
1625  /// \short Multiplier for (zeta-based) outer radius of element used for
1626  /// deciding that point is outside element. Set to negative value
1627  /// to suppress test.
1628  double Radius_multiplier_for_fast_exit_from_locate_zeta=1.5;
1629 
1630  /// Number of points along one dimension of each element used
1631  /// to create coordinates within the element in order to see
1632  /// which has the smallest initial residual (and is therefore used
1633  /// as the initial guess in the Newton method when locating coordinate)
1634  unsigned N_local_points = 5;
1635 }
1636 
1637 
1638 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1639 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1640 // Functions for finite elements
1641 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1642 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1643 
1644 //======================================================================
1645  /// Return the i-th coordinate at local node n. Do not use
1646  /// the hanging node representation.
1647  /// NOTE: Moved to cc file because of a possible compiler bug
1648  /// in gcc (yes, really!). The move to the cc file avoids inlining
1649  /// which appears to cause problems (only) when compiled with gcc
1650  /// and -O3; offensive "illegal read" is in optimised-out section
1651  /// of code and data that is allegedly illegal is readily readable
1652  /// (by other means) just before this function is called so I can't
1653  /// really see how we could possibly be responsible for this...
1654 //======================================================================
1655  double FiniteElement::raw_nodal_position(const unsigned &n, const unsigned &i) const
1656  {
1657  /* oomph_info << "n: "<< n << std::endl; */
1658  /* oomph_info << "i: "<< i << std::endl; */
1659  /* oomph_info << "node_pt(n): "<< node_pt(n) << std::endl; */
1660  /* oomph_info << "node_pt(n)->x(i): "<< node_pt(n)->x(i) << std::endl; */
1661  //double tmp=node_pt(n)->x(i);
1662  //oomph_info << "tmp: "<< tmp << std::endl;
1663  return node_pt(n)->x(i);
1664  }
1665 
1666 
1667 
1668 //======================================================================
1669 /// \short Function to describe the local dofs of the element. The ostream
1670 /// specifies the output stream to which the description
1671 /// is written; the string stores the currently
1672 /// assembled output that is ultimately written to the
1673 /// output stream by Data::describe_dofs(...); it is typically
1674 /// built up incrementally as we descend through the
1675 /// call hierarchy of this function when called from
1676 /// Problem::describe_dofs(...)
1677 //======================================================================
1678 void FiniteElement::describe_local_dofs(std::ostream& out,
1679  const std::string& current_string) const
1680 {
1681  // Call the standard finite element classification.
1682  GeneralisedElement::describe_local_dofs(out,current_string);
1683  describe_nodal_local_dofs(out,current_string);
1684 }
1685 
1686 //======================================================================
1687 // \short Function to describe the local dofs of the element. The ostream
1688 /// specifies the output stream to which the description
1689 /// is written; the string stores the currently
1690 /// assembled output that is ultimately written to the
1691 /// output stream by Data::describe_dofs(...); it is typically
1692 /// built up incrementally as we descend through the
1693 /// call hierarchy of this function when called from
1694 /// Problem::describe_dofs(...)
1695 //======================================================================
1696 void FiniteElement::
1697 describe_nodal_local_dofs(std::ostream& out,
1698  const std::string& current_string) const
1699 {
1700  //Find the number of nodes
1701  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
1702  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
1703  {
1704  //Pointer to node
1705  Node* const nod_pt = node_pt(n);
1706 
1707  std::stringstream conversion;
1708  conversion<<" of Node "<<n<<current_string;
1709  std::string in(conversion.str());
1710  nod_pt->describe_dofs(out,in);
1711  }// End if for n_node
1712 }// End describe_nodal_local_dofs
1713 
1714 //========================================================================
1715 /// \short Internal function used to check for singular or negative values
1716 /// of the determinant of the Jacobian of the mapping between local and
1717 /// global or lagrangian coordinates. Negative jacobians are allowed if the
1718 /// Accept_negative_jacobian flag is set to true.
1719 //========================================================================
1720  void FiniteElement::check_jacobian(const double &jacobian) const
1721  {
1722  //First check for a zero jacobian
1723  if(std::fabs(jacobian) < Tolerance_for_singular_jacobian)
1724  {
1725  if (FiniteElement::Suppress_output_while_checking_for_inverted_elements)
1726  {
1727  throw OomphLibQuietException();
1728  }
1729  else
1730  {
1731  std::ostringstream error_stream;
1732  error_stream
1733  << "Determinant of Jacobian matrix is zero --- "
1734  << "singular mapping!\nThe determinant of the "
1735  << "jacobian is " << std::fabs(jacobian)
1736  << " which is smaller than the treshold "
1737  << Tolerance_for_singular_jacobian <<"\n"
1738  << "You can change this treshold, by specifying "
1739  << "FiniteElement::Tolerance_for_singular_jacobian \n"
1740  << "Here are the nodal coordinates of the inverted element\n"
1741  << "in the form \n\n x,y[,z], hang_status\n\n"
1742  << "where hang_status = 1 or 2 for non-hanging or hanging\n"
1743  << "nodes respectively (useful for automatic sizing of\n"
1744  << "tecplot markers to identify the hanging nodes). \n\n" ;
1745  unsigned n_dim_nod=node_pt(0)->ndim();
1746  unsigned n_nod=nnode();
1747  unsigned hang_count=0;
1748  for (unsigned j=0;j<n_nod;j++)
1749  {
1750  for (unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_nod;i++)
1751  {
1752  error_stream << node_pt(j)->x(i) << " ";
1753  }
1754  if (node_pt(j)->is_hanging())
1755  {
1756  error_stream << " 2";
1757  hang_count++;
1758  }
1759  else
1760  {
1761  error_stream << " 1";
1762  }
1763  error_stream << std::endl;
1764  }
1765  error_stream << std::endl << std::endl;
1766  if ((Macro_elem_pt!=0)&&(0!=hang_count))
1767  {
1768  error_stream
1769  << "NOTE: Offending element is associated with a MacroElement\n"
1770  << " AND the element has hanging nodes! \n"
1771  << " If an element is thin and highly curved, the \n"
1772  << " constraints imposed by\n \n"
1773  << " (1) inter-element continuity (imposed by the hanging\n"
1774  << " node constraints) and \n\n"
1775  << " (2) the need to respect curvilinear domain boundaries\n"
1776  << " during mesh refinement (imposed by the element's\n"
1777  << " macro element mapping)\n\n"
1778  << " may be irreconcilable! \n \n"
1779  << " You may have to re-design your base mesh to avoid \n"
1780  << " the creation of thin, highly curved elements during\n"
1781  << " the refinement process.\n"
1782  << std::endl;
1783  }
1784  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
1785  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1786  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1787  }
1788  }
1789 
1790 
1791  //Now check for negative jacobians, if we're not allowing them (default)
1792  if((Accept_negative_jacobian==false) && (jacobian < 0.0))
1793  {
1794 
1795  if (FiniteElement::Suppress_output_while_checking_for_inverted_elements)
1796  {
1797  throw OomphLibQuietException();
1798  }
1799  else
1800  {
1801  std::ostringstream error_stream;
1802  error_stream
1803  << "Negative Jacobian in transform from "
1804  << "local to global coordinates"
1805  << std::endl
1806  << " You have an inverted coordinate system!"
1807  << std::endl << std::endl;
1808  error_stream
1809  << "Here are the nodal coordinates of the inverted element\n"
1810  << "in the form \n\n x,y[,z], hang_status\n\n"
1811  << "where hang_status = 1 or 2 for non-hanging or hanging\n"
1812  << "nodes respectively (useful for automatic sizing of\n"
1813  << "tecplot markers to identify the hanging nodes). \n\n" ;
1814  unsigned n_dim_nod=node_pt(0)->ndim();
1815  unsigned n_nod=nnode();
1816  unsigned hang_count=0;
1817  for (unsigned j=0;j<n_nod;j++)
1818  {
1819  for (unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_nod;i++)
1820  {
1821  error_stream << node_pt(j)->x(i) << " ";
1822  }
1823  if (node_pt(j)->is_hanging())
1824  {
1825  error_stream << " 2";
1826  hang_count++;
1827  }
1828  else
1829  {
1830  error_stream << " 1";
1831  }
1832  error_stream << std::endl;
1833  }
1834  error_stream << std::endl << std::endl;
1835  if ((Macro_elem_pt!=0)&&(0!=hang_count))
1836  {
1837  error_stream
1838  << "NOTE: The inverted element is associated with a MacroElement\n"
1839  << " AND the element has hanging nodes! \n"
1840  << " If an element is thin and highly curved, the \n"
1841  << " constraints imposed by\n \n"
1842  << " (1) inter-element continuity (imposed by the hanging\n"
1843  << " node constraints) and \n\n"
1844  << " (2) the need to respect curvilinear domain boundaries\n"
1845  << " during mesh refinement (imposed by the element's\n"
1846  << " macro element mapping)\n\n"
1847  << " may be irreconcilable! \n \n"
1848  << " You may have to re-design your base mesh to avoid \n"
1849  << " the creation of thin, highly curved elements during\n"
1850  << " the refinement process.\n"
1851  << std::endl;
1852  }
1853 
1854  error_stream
1855  << std::endl << std::endl
1856  << "If you believe that inverted elements do not cause any\n"
1857  << "problems in your specific application you can \n "
1858  << "suppress this test by: " << std::endl
1859  << " i) setting the (static) flag "
1860  << "FiniteElement::Accept_negative_jacobian to be true" << std::endl;
1861  error_stream << " ii) switching OFF the PARANOID flag"
1862  << std::endl << std::endl;
1863 
1864  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
1865  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1866  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1867  }
1868  }
1869  }
1870 
1871 //=========================================================================
1872 /// Internal function that is used to assemble the jacobian of the mapping
1873 /// from local coordinates (s) to the eulerian coordinates (x), given the
1874 /// derivatives of the shape functions. The entire jacobian matrix is
1875 /// constructed and this function will only work if there are the same number
1876 /// of local coordinates as global coordinates (i.e. for "bulk" elements).
1877 //=========================================================================
1878 void FiniteElement::
1879 assemble_local_to_eulerian_jacobian(const DShape &dpsids,
1880  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian) const
1881 {
1882  //Locally cache the elemental dimension
1883  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
1884  //The number of shape functions must be equal to the number
1885  //of nodes (by definition)
1886  const unsigned n_shape = nnode();
1887  //The number of shape function types must be equal to the number
1888  //of nodal position types (by definition)
1889  const unsigned n_shape_type = nnodal_position_type();
1890 
1891 #ifdef PARANOID
1892  //Check for dimensional compatibility
1893  if(Elemental_dimension != Nodal_dimension)
1894  {
1895  std::ostringstream error_message;
1896  error_message << "Dimension mismatch" << std::endl;
1897  error_message << "The elemental dimension: " << Elemental_dimension
1898  << " must equal the nodal dimension: "
1899  << Nodal_dimension
1900  << " for the jacobian of the mapping to be well-defined"
1901  << std::endl;
1902  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
1903  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
1904  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
1905  }
1906 #endif
1907 
1908 
1909  //Loop over the rows of the jacobian
1910  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++)
1911  {
1912  //Loop over the columns of the jacobian
1913  for(unsigned j=0;j<el_dim;j++)
1914  {
1915  //Zero the entry
1916  jacobian(i,j) = 0.0;
1917  //Loop over the shape functions
1918  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_shape;l++)
1919  {
1920  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_shape_type;k++)
1921  {
1922  //Jacobian is dx_j/ds_i, which is represented by the sum
1923  //over the dpsi/ds_i of the nodal points X j
1924  //Call the Non-hanging version of positions
1925  //This is overloaded in refineable elements
1926  jacobian(i,j) += raw_nodal_position_gen(l,k,j)*dpsids(l,k,i);
1927  }
1928  }
1929  }
1930  }
1931 }
1932 
1933 //=========================================================================
1934 /// Internal function that is used to assemble the jacobian of second
1935 /// derivatives of the mapping from local coordinates (s) to the
1936 /// eulerian coordinates (x), given the second derivatives of the
1937 /// shape functions.
1938 //=========================================================================
1939  void FiniteElement::
1940  assemble_local_to_eulerian_jacobian2(const DShape &d2psids,
1941  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian2) const
1942  {
1943  //Find the dimension of the element
1944  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
1945  //Find the number of shape functions and shape functions types
1946  //Must be equal to the number of nodes and their position types
1947  //by the definition of the shape function.
1948  const unsigned n_shape = nnode();
1949  const unsigned n_shape_type = nnodal_position_type();
1950  //Find the number of second derivatives
1951  const unsigned n_row = N2deriv[el_dim];
1952 
1953  //Assemble the "jacobian" (d^2 x_j/ds_i^2) for second derivatives of
1954  //shape functions
1955  //Loop over the rows (number of second derivatives)
1956  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_row;i++)
1957  {
1958  //Loop over the columns (element dimension
1959  for(unsigned j=0;j<el_dim;j++)
1960  {
1961  //Zero the entry
1962  jacobian2(i,j) = 0.0;
1963  //Loop over the shape functions
1964  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_shape;l++)
1965  {
1966  //Loop over the shape function types
1967  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_shape_type;k++)
1968  {
1969  //Add the terms to the jacobian entry
1970  //Call the Non-hanging version of positions
1971  //This is overloaded in refineable elements
1972  jacobian2(i,j) += raw_nodal_position_gen(l,k,j)*d2psids(l,k,i);
1973  }
1974  }
1975  }
1976  }
1977  }
1978 
1979  //=====================================================================
1980  /// Assemble the covariant Eulerian base vectors and return them in the
1981  /// matrix interpolated_G. The derivatives of the shape functions with
1982  /// respect to the local coordinate should already have been calculated
1983  /// before calling this function
1984  //=====================================================================
1985  void FiniteElement::assemble_eulerian_base_vectors(
1986  const DShape &dpsids, DenseMatrix<double> &interpolated_G) const
1987  {
1988  //Find the number of nodes and position types
1989  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
1990  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
1991  //Find the dimension of the node and element
1992  const unsigned n_dim_node = nodal_dimension();
1993  const unsigned n_dim_element = dim();
1994 
1995  //Loop over the dimensions and compute the entries of the
1996  //base vector matrix
1997  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_element;i++)
1998  {
1999  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim_node;j++)
2000  {
2001  //Initialise the j-th component of the i-th base vector to zero
2002  interpolated_G(i,j) = 0.0;
2003  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
2004  {
2005  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
2006  {
2007  interpolated_G(i,j) += raw_nodal_position_gen(l,k,j)*dpsids(l,k,i);
2008  }
2009  }
2010  }
2011  }
2012  }
2013 
2014 
2015 //============================================================================
2016 /// Zero-d specialisation of function to calculate inverse of jacobian mapping
2017 //============================================================================
2018  template<>
2019  double FiniteElement::
2020  invert_jacobian<0>(const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2021  DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian) const
2022  {
2023  //Issue a warning
2024  oomph_info << "\nWarning: You are trying to invert the jacobian for "
2025  << "a 'point' element" << std::endl
2026  << "This makes no sense and is almost certainly an error"
2027  << std::endl << std::endl;
2028 
2029  //Dummy return
2030  return(1.0);
2031  }
2032 
2033 
2034 //===========================================================================
2035 /// One-d specialisation of function to calculate inverse of jacobian mapping
2036 //===========================================================================
2037  template<>
2038  double FiniteElement::
2039  invert_jacobian<1>(const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2040  DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian) const
2041  {
2042  //Calculate the determinant of the matrix
2043  const double det = jacobian(0,0);
2044 
2045 //Report if Matrix is singular or negative
2046 #ifdef PARANOID
2047  check_jacobian(det);
2048 #endif
2049 
2050  //Calculate the inverse --- trivial in 1D
2051  inverse_jacobian(0,0) = 1.0/jacobian(0,0);
2052 
2053  //Return the determinant
2054  return(det);
2055  }
2056 
2057 //===========================================================================
2058 /// Two-d specialisation of function to calculate inverse of jacobian mapping
2059 //===========================================================================
2060  template<>
2061  double FiniteElement::
2062  invert_jacobian<2>(const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2063  DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian) const
2064  {
2065  //Calculate the determinant of the matrix
2066  const double det = jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(1,1) - jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(1,0);
2067 
2068 //Report if Matrix is singular or negative
2069 #ifdef PARANOID
2070  check_jacobian(det);
2071 #endif
2072 
2073  //Calculate the inverset of the 2x2 matrix
2074  inverse_jacobian(0,0) = jacobian(1,1)/det;
2075  inverse_jacobian(0,1) = -jacobian(0,1)/det;
2076  inverse_jacobian(1,0) = -jacobian(1,0)/det;
2077  inverse_jacobian(1,1) = jacobian(0,0)/det;
2078 
2079  //Return the jacobian
2080  return(det);
2081  }
2082 
2083 //=============================================================================
2084 /// Three-d specialisation of function to calculate inverse of jacobian mapping
2085 //=============================================================================
2086  template<>
2087  double FiniteElement::
2088  invert_jacobian<3>(const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2089  DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian) const
2090  {
2091  //Calculate the determinant of the matrix
2092  const double det = jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(1,1)*jacobian(2,2)
2093  + jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(1,2)*jacobian(2,0)
2094  + jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(1,0)*jacobian(2,1)
2095  - jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(1,2)*jacobian(2,1)
2096  - jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(1,0)*jacobian(2,2)
2097  - jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(1,1)*jacobian(2,0);
2098 
2099  //Report if Matrix is singular or negative
2100 #ifdef PARANOID
2101  check_jacobian(det);
2102 #endif
2103 
2104  //Calculate the inverse of the 3x3 matrix
2105  inverse_jacobian(0,0) = (jacobian(1,1)*jacobian(2,2)
2106  - jacobian(1,2)*jacobian(2,1))/det;
2107  inverse_jacobian(0,1) = -(jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(2,2)
2108  - jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(2,1))/det;
2109  inverse_jacobian(0,2) = (jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(1,2)
2110  - jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(1,1))/det;
2111  inverse_jacobian(1,0) = -(jacobian(1,0)*jacobian(2,2)
2112  - jacobian(1,2)*jacobian(2,0))/det;
2113  inverse_jacobian(1,1) = (jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(2,2)
2114  - jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(2,0))/det;
2115  inverse_jacobian(1,2) = -(jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(1,2)
2116  - jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(1,0))/det;
2117  inverse_jacobian(2,0) = (jacobian(1,0)*jacobian(2,1)
2118  - jacobian(1,1)*jacobian(2,0))/det;
2119  inverse_jacobian(2,1) = -(jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(2,1)
2120  - jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(2,0))/det;
2121  inverse_jacobian(2,2) = (jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(1,1)
2122  - jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(1,0))/det;
2123 
2124  //Return the determinant
2125  return(det);
2126  }
2127 
2128 //========================================================================
2129 /// Template-free interface for inversion of the jacobian of a mapping.
