2130 /// This is slightly inefficient, given that it uses a switch statement.
2131 /// It can always be overloaded in specific geometric elements,
2132 /// for efficiency reasons.
2133 //========================================================================
2134  double FiniteElement::
2135  invert_jacobian_mapping(const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2136  DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian) const
2137  {
2138  //Find the spatial dimension of the element
2139  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
2140  //Call the appropriate templated function, depending on the
2141  //element dimension
2142  switch(el_dim)
2143  {
2144  case 0:
2145  return invert_jacobian<0>(jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
2146  break;
2147  case 1:
2148  return invert_jacobian<1>(jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
2149  break;
2150  case 2:
2151  return invert_jacobian<2>(jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
2152  break;
2153  case 3:
2154  return invert_jacobian<3>(jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
2155  break;
2156  //Catch-all default case: issue warning and die
2157  default:
2158  std::ostringstream error_stream;
2159  error_stream
2160  << "Dimension of the element must be 0,1,2 or 3, not " << el_dim
2161  << std::endl;
2162 
2163  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
2164  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2165  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2166  }
2167  //Dummy return for Intel compiler
2168  return 1.0;
2169  }
2170 
2171 //============================================================================
2172 /// Zero-d specialisation of function to calculate the derivative of the
2173 /// jacobian of a mapping with respect to the nodal coordinates X_ij.
2174 //============================================================================
2175  template<>
2176  void FiniteElement::dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<0>(
2177  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,const DShape &dpsids,
2178  DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX) const
2179  {
2180  // Issue a warning
2181  oomph_info << "\nWarning: You are trying to calculate derivatives of "
2182  << "a jacobian w.r.t. nodal coordinates for a 'point' "
2183  << "element." << std::endl
2184  << "This makes no sense and is almost certainly an error."
2185  << std::endl << std::endl;
2186  }
2187 
2188 //===========================================================================
2189 /// One-d specialisation of function to calculate the derivative of the
2190 /// jacobian of a mapping with respect to the nodal coordinates X_ij.
2191 //===========================================================================
2192  template<>
2193  void FiniteElement::dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<1>(
2194  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,const DShape &dpsids,
2195  DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX) const
2196  {
2197  // Determine the number of nodes in the element
2198  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
2199 
2200  // Loop over nodes
2201  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_node;j++)
2202  {
2203  djacobian_dX(0,j) = dpsids(j,0);
2204  }
2205  }
2206 
2207 //===========================================================================
2208 /// Two-d specialisation of function to calculate the derivative of the
2209 /// jacobian of a mapping with respect to the nodal coordinates X_ij.
2210 //===========================================================================
2211  template<>
2212  void FiniteElement::dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<2>(
2213  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,const DShape &dpsids,
2214  DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX) const
2215  {
2216  // Determine the number of nodes in the element
2217  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
2218 
2219  // Loop over nodes
2220  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_node;j++)
2221  {
2222  // i=0
2223  djacobian_dX(0,j) = dpsids(j,0)*jacobian(1,1) - dpsids(j,1)*jacobian(0,1);
2224 
2225  // i=1
2226  djacobian_dX(1,j) = dpsids(j,1)*jacobian(0,0) - dpsids(j,0)*jacobian(1,0);
2227  }
2228  }
2229 
2230 //=============================================================================
2231 /// Three-d specialisation of function to calculate the derivative of the
2232 /// jacobian of a mapping with respect to the nodal coordinates X_ij.
2233 //=============================================================================
2234  template<>
2235  void FiniteElement::dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<3>(
2236  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,const DShape &dpsids,
2237  DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX) const
2238  {
2239  // Determine the number of nodes in the element
2240  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
2241 
2242  // Loop over nodes
2243  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_node;j++)
2244  {
2245  // i=0
2246  djacobian_dX(0,j)
2247  = dpsids(j,0)*(jacobian(1,1)*jacobian(2,2)
2248  - jacobian(1,2)*jacobian(2,1))
2249  + dpsids(j,1)*(jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(2,1)
2250  - jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(2,2))
2251  + dpsids(j,2)*(jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(1,2)
2252  - jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(1,1));
2253 
2254  // i=1
2255  djacobian_dX(1,j)
2256  = dpsids(j,0)*(jacobian(1,2)*jacobian(2,0)
2257  - jacobian(1,0)*jacobian(2,2))
2258  + dpsids(j,1)*(jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(2,2)
2259  - jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(2,0))
2260  + dpsids(j,2)*(jacobian(0,2)*jacobian(1,0)
2261  - jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(1,2));
2262 
2263  // i=2
2264  djacobian_dX(2,j)
2265  = dpsids(j,0)*(jacobian(1,0)*jacobian(2,1)
2266  - jacobian(1,1)*jacobian(2,0))
2267  + dpsids(j,1)*(jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(2,0)
2268  - jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(2,1))
2269  + dpsids(j,2)*(jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(1,1)
2270  - jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(1,0));
2271  }
2272  }
2273 
2274 //============================================================================
2275 /// Zero-d specialisation of function to calculate the derivative w.r.t. the
2276 /// nodal coordinates \f$ X_{pq} \f$ of the derivative of the shape functions
2277 /// w.r.t. the global eulerian coordinates \f$ x_i \f$.
2278 //============================================================================
2279  template<>
2280  void FiniteElement::d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<0>(
2281  const double &det_jacobian,
2282  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2283  const DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX,
2284  const DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian,
2285  const DShape &dpsids,
2286  RankFourTensor<double> &d_dpsidx_dX) const
2287  {
2288  // Issue a warning
2289  oomph_info << "\nWarning: You are trying to calculate derivatives of "
2290  << "eulerian derivatives of shape functions w.r.t. nodal "
2291  << "coordinates for a 'point' element." << std::endl
2292  << "This makes no sense and is almost certainly an error."
2293  << std::endl << std::endl;
2294  }
2295 
2296 //===========================================================================
2297 /// One-d specialisation of function to calculate the derivative w.r.t. the
2298 /// nodal coordinates \f$ X_{pq} \f$ of the derivative of the shape functions
2299 /// w.r.t. the global eulerian coordinates \f$ x_i \f$.
2300 //===========================================================================
2301  template<>
2302  void FiniteElement::d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<1>(
2303  const double &det_jacobian,
2304  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2305  const DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX,
2306  const DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian,
2307  const DShape &dpsids,
2308  RankFourTensor<double> &d_dpsidx_dX) const
2309  {
2310  // Find inverse of determinant of jacobian of mapping
2311  const double inv_det_jac = 1.0/det_jacobian;
2312 
2313  // Determine the number of nodes in the element
2314  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
2315 
2316  // Loop over the shape functions
2317  for(unsigned q=0;q<n_node;q++)
2318  {
2319  // Loop over the shape functions
2320  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_node;j++)
2321  {
2322  d_dpsidx_dX(0,q,j,0)
2323  = - djacobian_dX(0,q)*dpsids(j,0)*inv_det_jac*inv_det_jac;
2324  }
2325  }
2326  }
2327 
2328 //===========================================================================
2329 /// Two-d specialisation of function to calculate the derivative w.r.t. the
2330 /// nodal coordinates \f$ X_{pq} \f$ of the derivative of the shape functions
2331 /// w.r.t. the global eulerian coordinates \f$ x_i \f$.
2332 //===========================================================================
2333  template<>
2334  void FiniteElement::d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<2>(
2335  const double &det_jacobian,
2336  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2337  const DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX,
2338  const DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian,
2339  const DShape &dpsids,
2340  RankFourTensor<double> &d_dpsidx_dX) const
2341  {
2342  // Find inverse of determinant of jacobian of mapping
2343  const double inv_det_jac = 1.0/det_jacobian;
2344 
2345  // Determine the number of nodes in the element
2346  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
2347 
2348  // Loop over the spatial dimension (this must be 2)
2349  for(unsigned p=0;p<2;p++)
2350  {
2351  // Loop over the shape functions
2352  for(unsigned q=0;q<n_node;q++)
2353  {
2354  // Loop over the shape functions
2355  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_node;j++)
2356  {
2357  // i=0
2358  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,0) = - djacobian_dX(p,q)*
2359  (inverse_jacobian(0,0)*dpsids(j,0)
2360  + inverse_jacobian(0,1)*dpsids(j,1));
2361 
2362  if(p==1)
2363  {
2364  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,0)
2365  += dpsids(j,0)*dpsids(q,1) - dpsids(j,1)*dpsids(q,0);
2366  }
2367  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,0) *= inv_det_jac;
2368 
2369  // i=1
2370  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,1) = - djacobian_dX(p,q)*
2371  (inverse_jacobian(1,1)*dpsids(j,1)
2372  + inverse_jacobian(1,0)*dpsids(j,0));
2373 
2374  if(p==0)
2375  {
2376  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,1)
2377  += dpsids(j,1)*dpsids(q,0) - dpsids(j,0)*dpsids(q,1);
2378  }
2379  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,1) *= inv_det_jac;
2380  }
2381  }
2382  }
2383  }
2384 
2385 //=============================================================================
2386 /// Three-d specialisation of function to calculate the derivative w.r.t. the
2387 /// nodal coordinates \f$ X_{pq} \f$ of the derivative of the shape functions
2388 /// w.r.t. the global eulerian coordinates \f$ x_i \f$.
2389 //=============================================================================
2390  template<>
2391  void FiniteElement::d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<3>(
2392  const double &det_jacobian,
2393  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2394  const DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX,
2395  const DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian,
2396  const DShape &dpsids,
2397  RankFourTensor<double> &d_dpsidx_dX) const
2398  {
2399  // Find inverse of determinant of jacobian of mapping
2400  const double inv_det_jac = 1.0/det_jacobian;
2401 
2402  // Determine the number of nodes in the element
2403  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
2404 
2405  // Loop over the spatial dimension (this must be 3)
2406  for(unsigned p=0;p<3;p++)
2407  {
2408  // Loop over the shape functions
2409  for(unsigned q=0;q<n_node;q++)
2410  {
2411  // Loop over the shape functions
2412  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_node;j++)
2413  {
2414  // Terms not multiplied by delta function
2415  for(unsigned i=0;i<3;i++)
2416  {
2417  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,i)
2418  = - djacobian_dX(p,q)*(inverse_jacobian(i,0)*dpsids(j,0)
2419  + inverse_jacobian(i,1)*dpsids(j,1)
2420  + inverse_jacobian(i,2)*dpsids(j,2));
2421  }
2422 
2423  // Delta function terms
2424  switch(p)
2425  {
2426  case 0:
2427  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,1)+=((dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(1,2)
2428  - dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(2,2))*dpsids(j,0)
2429  + (dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(2,2)
2430  - dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(0,2))*dpsids(j,1)
2431  + (dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(0,2)
2432  - dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(1,2))*dpsids(j,2));
2433 
2434  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,2)+=((dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(2,1)
2435  - dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(1,1))*dpsids(j,0)
2436  + (dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(0,1)
2437  - dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(2,1))*dpsids(j,1)
2438  + (dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(1,1)
2439  - dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(0,1))*dpsids(j,2));
2440  break;
2441 
2442  case 1:
2443 
2444  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,0)+=((dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(2,2)
2445  - dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(1,2))*dpsids(j,0)
2446  + (dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(0,2)
2447  - dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(2,2))*dpsids(j,1)
2448  + (dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(1,2)
2449  - dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(0,2))*dpsids(j,2));
2450 
2451  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,2)+=((dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(1,0)
2452  - dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(2,0))*dpsids(j,0)
2453  + (dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(2,0)
2454  - dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(0,0))*dpsids(j,1)
2455  + (dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(0,0)
2456  - dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(1,0))*dpsids(j,2));
2457  break;
2458 
2459  case 2:
2460 
2461  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,0)+=((dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(1,1)
2462  - dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(2,1))*dpsids(j,0)
2463  + (dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(2,1)
2464  - dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(0,1))*dpsids(j,1)
2465  + (dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(0,1)
2466  - dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(1,1))*dpsids(j,2));
2467 
2468  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,1)+=((dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(2,0)
2469  - dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(1,0))*dpsids(j,0)
2470  + (dpsids(q,2)*jacobian(0,0)
2471  - dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(2,0))*dpsids(j,1)
2472  + (dpsids(q,0)*jacobian(1,0)
2473  - dpsids(q,1)*jacobian(0,0))*dpsids(j,2));
2474  break;
2475  }
2476 
2477  // Divide through by the determinant of the Jacobian mapping
2478  for(unsigned i=0;i<3;i++)
2479  {
2480  d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,i) *= inv_det_jac;
2481  }
2482  }
2483  }
2484  }
2485  }
2486 
2487 //=======================================================================
2488 /// Default value for the number of values at a node
2489 //=======================================================================
2490  const unsigned FiniteElement::Default_Initial_Nvalue = 0;
2491 
2492 //======================================================================
2493 /// \short Default value that is used for the tolerance required when
2494 /// locating nodes via local coordinates
2495  const double FiniteElement::Node_location_tolerance = 1.0e-14;
2496 
2497 //=======================================================================
2498 /// Set the default tolerance for a singular jacobian
2499 //=======================================================================
2500  double FiniteElement::Tolerance_for_singular_jacobian = 1.0e-16;
2501 
2502 //======================================================================
2503 /// Set the default value of the Accept_negative_jacobian flag to be
2504 /// false
2505 //======================================================================
2506  bool FiniteElement::Accept_negative_jacobian = false;
2507 
2508 
2509 //======================================================================
2510 /// Set default for static boolean to suppress output while checking
2511 /// for inverted elements
2512 //======================================================================
2513 bool FiniteElement::Suppress_output_while_checking_for_inverted_elements=false;
2514 
2515 //========================================================================
2516 /// Static array that holds the number of rows in the second derivative
2517 /// matrix as a function of spatial dimension. In one-dimension, there is
2518 /// only one possible second derivative. In two-dimensions, there are three,
2519 /// the two second derivatives and the mixed derivatives. In three
2520 /// dimensions there are six.
2521 //=========================================================================
2522  const unsigned FiniteElement::N2deriv[4]={0,1,3,6};
2523 
2524 //==========================================================================
2525 /// Calculate the mapping from local to eulerian coordinates
2526 /// assuming that the coordinates are aligned in the direction of the local
2527 /// coordinates, i.e. there are no cross terms and the jacobian is diagonal.
2528 /// The local derivatives are passed as dpsids and the jacobian and
2529 /// inverse jacobian are returned.
2530 //==========================================================================
2531  double FiniteElement::
2532  local_to_eulerian_mapping_diagonal(const DShape &dpsids,
2533  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2534  DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian)
2535  const
2536  {
2537  //Find the dimension of the element
2538  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
2539  //Find the number of shape functions and shape functions types
2540  //Equal to the number of nodes and their position types by definition
2541  const unsigned n_shape = nnode();
2542  const unsigned n_shape_type = nnodal_position_type();
2543 
2544 #ifdef PARANOID
2545  //Check for dimension compatibility
2546  if(Elemental_dimension != Nodal_dimension)
2547  {
2548  std::ostringstream error_message;
2549  error_message << "Dimension mismatch" << std::endl;
2550  error_message << "The elemental dimension: " << Elemental_dimension
2551  << " must equal the nodal dimension: "
2552  << Nodal_dimension
2553  << " for the jacobian of the mapping to be well-defined"
2554  << std::endl;
2555  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
2556  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2557  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2558  }
2559 #endif
2560 
2561  //In this case we assume that there are no cross terms, that is
2562  //global coordinate 0 is always in the direction of local coordinate 0
2563 
2564  //Loop over the coordinates
2565  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++)
2566  {
2567  //Zero the jacobian and inverse jacobian entries
2568  for(unsigned j=0;j<el_dim;j++)
2569  {jacobian(i,j) = 0.0; inverse_jacobian(i,j) = 0.0;}
2570 
2571  //Loop over the shape functions
2572  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_shape;l++)
2573  {
2574  //Loop over the types of dof
2575  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_shape_type;k++)
2576  {
2577  //Derivatives are always dx_{i}/ds_{i}
2578  jacobian(i,i) += raw_nodal_position_gen(l,k,i)*dpsids(l,k,i);
2579  }
2580  }
2581  }
2582 
2583  //Now calculate the determinant of the matrix
2584  double det = 1.0;
2585  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++) {det *= jacobian(i,i);}
2586 
2587 //Report if Matrix is singular, or negative
2588 #ifdef PARANOID
2589  check_jacobian(det);
2590 #endif
2591 
2592  //Calculate the inverse mapping (trivial in this case)
2593  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++)
2594  {inverse_jacobian(i,i) = 1.0/jacobian(i,i);}
2595 
2596  //Return the value of the Jacobian
2597  return(det);
2598  }
2599 
2600 //========================================================================
2601 /// Template-free interface calculating the derivative of the jacobian
2602 /// of a mapping with respect to the nodal coordinates X_ij. This is
2603 /// slightly inefficient, given that it uses a switch statement. It can
2604 /// always be overloaded in specific geometric elements, for efficiency
2605 /// reasons.
2606 //========================================================================
2607 void FiniteElement::dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates(
2608  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,const DShape &dpsids,
2609  DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX) const
2610 {
2611  // Determine the spatial dimension of the element
2612  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
2613 
2614 #ifdef PARANOID
2615  // Determine the number of nodes in the element
2616  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
2617 
2618  // Check that djacobian_dX has the correct number of rows (= el_dim)
2619  if(djacobian_dX.nrow()!=el_dim)
2620  {
2621  std::ostringstream error_message;
2622  error_message << "djacobian_dX must have the same number of rows as the"
2623  << "\nspatial dimension of the element.";
2624  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
2625  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2626  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2627  }
2628  // Check that djacobian_dX has the correct number of columns (= n_node)
2629  if(djacobian_dX.ncol()!=n_node)
2630  {
2631  std::ostringstream error_message;
2632  error_message << "djacobian_dX must have the same number of columns as the"
2633  << "\nnumber of nodes in the element.";
2634  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
2635  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2636  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2637  }
2638 #endif
2639 
2640  // Call the appropriate templated function, depending on the
2641  // element dimension
2642  switch(el_dim)
2643  {
2644  case 0:
2645  dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<0>(jacobian,dpsids,
2646  djacobian_dX);
2647  break;
2648  case 1:
2649  dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<1>(jacobian,dpsids,
2650  djacobian_dX);
2651  break;
2652  case 2:
2653  dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<2>(jacobian,dpsids,
2654  djacobian_dX);
2655  break;
2656  case 3:
2657  dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<3>(jacobian,dpsids,
2658  djacobian_dX);
2659  break;
2660  // Catch-all default case: issue warning and die
2661  default:
2662  std::ostringstream error_stream;
2663  error_stream
2664  << "Dimension of the element must be 0,1,2 or 3, not " << el_dim
2665  << std::endl;
2666 
2667  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
2668  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2669  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2670  }
2671 }
2672 
2673 //========================================================================
2674 /// Template-free interface calculating the derivative w.r.t. the nodal
2675 /// coordinates \f$ X_{pq} \f$ of the derivative of the shape functions
2676 /// \f$ \psi_j \f$ w.r.t. the global eulerian coordinates \f$ x_i \f$.
2677 /// I.e. this function calculates
2678 /// \f[
2679 /// \frac{\partial}{\partial X_{pq}}
2680 /// \left( \frac{\partial \psi_j}{\partial x_i} \right).
2681 /// \f]
2682 /// To do this it requires the determinant of the jacobian mapping, its
2683 /// derivative w.r.t. the nodal coordinates \f$ X_{pq} \f$, the inverse
2684 /// jacobian and the derivatives of the shape functions w.r.t. the local
2685 /// coordinates. The result is returned as a tensor of rank four.
2686 /// Numbering:
2687 /// d_dpsidx_dX(p,q,j,i) = \f$ \frac{\partial}{\partial X_{pq}}
2688 /// \left( \frac{\partial \psi_j}{\partial x_i} \right) \f$
2689 /// This function is slightly inefficient, given that it uses a switch
2690 /// statement. It can always be overloaded in specific geometric elements,
2691 /// for efficiency reasons.
2692 //========================================================================
2693 void FiniteElement::d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates(
2694  const double &det_jacobian,
2695  const DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
2696  const DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX,
2697  const DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian,
2698  const DShape &dpsids,
2699  RankFourTensor<double> &d_dpsidx_dX) const
2700 {
2701  // Determine the spatial dimension of the element
2702  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
2703 
2704 #ifdef PARANOID
2705  // Determine the number of nodes in the element
2706  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
2707 
2708  // Check that d_dpsidx_dX is of the correct size
2709  if(d_dpsidx_dX.nindex1()!=el_dim || d_dpsidx_dX.nindex2()!=n_node
2710  || d_dpsidx_dX.nindex3()!=n_node || d_dpsidx_dX.nindex4()!=el_dim)
2711  {
2712  std::ostringstream error_message;
2713  error_message << "d_dpsidx_dX must be of the following dimensions:"
2714  << "\nd_dpsidx_dX(el_dim,n_node,n_node,el_dim)";
2715  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
2716  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2717  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2718  }
2719 #endif
2720 
2721  // Call the appropriate templated function, depending on the
2722  // element dimension
2723  switch(el_dim)
2724  {
2725  case 0:
2726  d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<0>(
2727  det_jacobian,jacobian,djacobian_dX,inverse_jacobian,dpsids,d_dpsidx_dX);
2728  break;
2729  case 1:
2730  d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<1>(
2731  det_jacobian,jacobian,djacobian_dX,inverse_jacobian,dpsids,d_dpsidx_dX);
2732  break;
2733  case 2:
2734  d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<2>(
2735  det_jacobian,jacobian,djacobian_dX,inverse_jacobian,dpsids,d_dpsidx_dX);
2736  break;
2737  case 3:
2738  d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates_templated_helper<3>(
2739  det_jacobian,jacobian,djacobian_dX,inverse_jacobian,dpsids,d_dpsidx_dX);
2740  break;
2741  // Catch-all default case: issue warning and die
2742  default:
2743  std::ostringstream error_stream;
2744  error_stream
2745  << "Dimension of the element must be 0,1,2 or 3, not " << el_dim
2746  << std::endl;
2747 
2748  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
2749  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
2750  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
2751  }
2752 }
2753 
2754 //=====================================================================
2755 /// Convert derivatives w.r.t local coordinates to derivatives w.r.t the
2756 /// coordinates used to assemble the inverse jacobian mapping passed as
2757 /// inverse_jacobian. The derivatives passed in dbasis will be
2758 /// modified in this function from dbasisds to dbasisdX.
2759 //======================================================================
2760  void FiniteElement::transform_derivatives(const DenseMatrix<double>
2761  &inverse_jacobian,
2762  DShape &dbasis) const
2763  {
2764  //Find the number of basis functions and basis function types
2765  const unsigned n_basis = dbasis.nindex1();
2766  const unsigned n_basis_type = dbasis.nindex2();
2767  //Find the dimension of the array (Must be the elemental dimension)
2768  const unsigned n_dim = dim();
2769 
2770  //Allocate temporary (stack) storage of the dimension of the element
2771  double new_derivatives[n_dim];
2772 
2773  //Loop over the number of basis functions
2774  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_basis;l++)
2775  {
2776  //Loop over type of basis functions
2777  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_basis_type;k++)
2778  {
2779  //Loop over the coordinates
2780  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim;j++)
2781  {
2782  //Zero the new transformed derivatives
2783  new_derivatives[j] = 0.0;
2784  //Do premultiplication by inverse jacobian
2785  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim;i++)
2786  {
2787  new_derivatives[j] += inverse_jacobian(j,i)*dbasis(l,k,i);
2788  }
2789  }
2790  //We now copy the new derivatives into the shape functions
2791  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim;j++) {dbasis(l,k,j) = new_derivatives[j];}
2792  }
2793  }
2794  }
2795 
2796 //=====================================================================
2797 /// Convert derivatives w.r.t local coordinates to derivatives w.r.t the
2798 /// coordinates used to assemble the inverse jacobian mapping passed as
2799 /// inverse_jacobian, assuming that the mapping is diagonal. This merely
2800 /// saves a few loops, but is probably worth it.
2801 //======================================================================
2802  void FiniteElement::transform_derivatives_diagonal(const DenseMatrix<double>
2803  &inverse_jacobian,
2804  DShape &dbasis) const
2805  {
2806  //Find the number of basis functions and basis function types
2807  const unsigned n_basis = dbasis.nindex1();
2808  const unsigned n_basis_type = dbasis.nindex2();
2809  //Find the dimension of the array (must be the elemental dimension)
2810  const unsigned n_dim = dim();
2811 
2812  //Loop over the number of basis functions
2813  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_basis;l++)
2814  {
2815  //Loop over type of basis functions
2816  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_basis_type;k++)
2817  {
2818  //Loop over the coordinates
2819  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim;j++)
2820  {
2821  dbasis(l,k,j) *= inverse_jacobian(j,j);
2822  }
2823  }
2824  }
2825  }
2826 
2827 //=======================================================================
2828 /// Convert derivatives and second derivatives w.r.t local coordinates to
2829 /// derivatives w.r.t. the coordinates used to assemble the jacobian,
2830 /// inverse_jacobian and jacobian 2 passed. This must be specialised
2831 /// for each dimension, otherwise it gets very ugly
2832 /// Specialisation to one dimension.
2833 //=======================================================================
2834  template<>
2835  void FiniteElement::
2836  transform_second_derivatives_template<1>(const DenseMatrix<double>
2837  &jacobian,
2838  const DenseMatrix<double>
2839  &inverse_jacobian,
2840  const DenseMatrix<double>
2841  &jacobian2,
2842  DShape &dbasis,
2843  DShape &d2basis) const
2844  {
2845  //Find the number of basis functions and basis function types
2846  const unsigned n_basis = dbasis.nindex1();
2847  const unsigned n_basis_type = dbasis.nindex2();
2848 
2849  //The second derivatives are easy, because there can be no mixed terms
2850  //Loop over number of basis functions
2851  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_basis;l++)
2852  {
2853  //Loop over number of basis function types
2854  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_basis_type;k++)
2855  {
2856  d2basis(l,k,0) = d2basis(l,k,0)/(jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(0,0))
2857  //Second term comes from taking d/dx of (dpsi/ds / dx/ds)
2858  - dbasis(l,k,0)*jacobian2(0,0)/
2859  (jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(0,0));
2860  }
2861  }
2862 
2863  //Assemble the first derivatives (do this last so that we don't
2864  //overwrite the dphids before we use it in the above)
2865  transform_derivatives(inverse_jacobian,dbasis);
2866 
2867  }
2868 
2869 //=======================================================================
2870 /// Convert derivatives and second derivatives w.r.t local coordinates to
2871 /// derivatives w.r.t. the coordinates used to assemble the jacobian,
2872 /// inverse_jacobian and jacobian 2 passed. This must be specialised
2873 /// for each dimension, otherwise it gets very ugly.
2874 /// Specialisation to two spatial dimensions
2875 //=======================================================================
2876  template<>
2877  void FiniteElement::
2878  transform_second_derivatives_template<2>(const DenseMatrix<double>
2879  &jacobian,
2880  const DenseMatrix<double>
2881  &inverse_jacobian,
2882  const DenseMatrix<double>
2883  &jacobian2,
2884  DShape &dbasis,
2885  DShape &d2basis) const
2886  {
2887  //Find the number of basis functions and basis function types
2888  const unsigned n_basis = dbasis.nindex1();
2889  const unsigned n_basis_type = dbasis.nindex2();
2890 
2891  //Calculate the determinant
2892  const double det = jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(1,1) - jacobian(0,1)*jacobian(1,0);
2893 
2894  //Second derivatives ... the approach taken here is to construct
2895  //dphidX/ds which can then be used to calculate the second derivatives
2896  //using the relationship d/dX = inverse_jacobian*d/ds
2897 
2898  double ddetds[2];
2899 
2900  ddetds[0] = jacobian2(0,0)*jacobian(1,1) + jacobian(0,0)*jacobian2(2,1)
2901  - jacobian2(0,1)*jacobian(1,0) - jacobian(0,1)*jacobian2(2,0);
2902  ddetds[1] = jacobian2(2,0)*jacobian(1,1) + jacobian(0,0)*jacobian2(1,1)
2903  - jacobian2(2,1)*jacobian(1,0) - jacobian(0,1)*jacobian2(1,0);
2904 
2905  //Calculate the derivatives of the inverse jacobian wrt the local coordinates
2906  double dinverse_jacobiands[2][2][2];
2907 
2908  dinverse_jacobiands[0][0][0] = jacobian2(2,1)/det -
2909  jacobian(1,1)*ddetds[0]/(det*det);
2910  dinverse_jacobiands[0][1][0] = -jacobian2(0,1)/det +
2911  jacobian(0,1)*ddetds[0]/(det*det);
2912  dinverse_jacobiands[1][0][0] = -jacobian2(2,0)/det +
2913  jacobian(1,0)*ddetds[0]/(det*det);
2914  dinverse_jacobiands[1][1][0] = jacobian2(0,0)/det -
2915  jacobian(0,0)*ddetds[0]/(det*det);
2916 
2917  dinverse_jacobiands[0][0][1] = jacobian2(1,1)/det -
2918  jacobian(1,1)*ddetds[1]/(det*det);
2919  dinverse_jacobiands[0][1][1] = -jacobian2(2,1)/det +
2920  jacobian(0,1)*ddetds[1]/(det*det);
2921  dinverse_jacobiands[1][0][1] = -jacobian2(1,0)/det +
2922  jacobian(1,0)*ddetds[1]/(det*det);
2923  dinverse_jacobiands[1][1][1] = jacobian2(2,0)/det -
2924  jacobian(0,0)*ddetds[1]/(det*det);
2925 
2926  //Set up derivatives of dpsidx wrt local coordinates
2927  DShape dphidXds0(n_basis,n_basis_type,2), dphidXds1(n_basis,n_basis_type,2);
2928 
2929  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_basis;l++)
2930  {
2931  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_basis_type;k++)
2932  {
2933  for(unsigned j=0;j<2;j++)
2934  {
2935  //Note that we can't have an inner loop because of the
2936  //convention I've chosen for the mixed derivatives!
2937  dphidXds0(l,k,j) = dinverse_jacobiands[j][0][0]*dbasis(l,k,0)
2938  + dinverse_jacobiands[j][1][0]*dbasis(l,k,1)
2939  + inverse_jacobian(j,0)*d2basis(l,k,0)
2940  + inverse_jacobian(j,1)*d2basis(l,k,2);
2941 
2942  dphidXds1(l,k,j) = dinverse_jacobiands[j][0][1]*dbasis(l,k,0)
2943  + dinverse_jacobiands[j][1][1]*dbasis(l,k,1)
2944  + inverse_jacobian(j,0)*d2basis(l,k,2)
2945  + inverse_jacobian(j,1)*d2basis(l,k,1);
2946  }
2947  }
2948  }
2949 
2950  //Now calculate the DShape d2phidX
2951  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_basis;l++)
2952  {
2953  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_basis_type;k++)
2954  {
2955  //Zero dpsidx
2956  for(unsigned j=0;j<3;j++) {d2basis(l,k,j) = 0.0;}
2957 
2958  //Do premultiplication by inverse jacobian
2959  for(unsigned i=0;i<2;i++)
2960  {
2961  d2basis(l,k,i) = inverse_jacobian(i,0)*dphidXds0(l,k,i)+
2962  inverse_jacobian(i,1)*dphidXds1(l,k,i);
2963  }
2964  //Calculate mixed derivative term
2965  d2basis(l,k,2) += inverse_jacobian(0,0)*dphidXds0(l,k,1)
2966  + inverse_jacobian(0,1)*dphidXds1(l,k,1);
2967  }
2968  }
2969 
2970  //Assemble the first derivatives second, so that we don't
2971  //overwrite dphids
2972  transform_derivatives(inverse_jacobian,dbasis);
2973  }
2974 
2975 
2976 //=======================================================================
2977 /// Convert derivatives and second derivatives w.r.t local coordinates to
2978 /// derivatives w.r.t. the coordinates used to assemble the jacobian,
2979 /// inverse_jacobian and jacobian 2 passed. This must be specialised
2980 /// for each dimension, otherwise it gets very ugly
2981 /// Specialisation to one dimension.
2982 //=======================================================================
2983  template<>
2984  void FiniteElement::
2985  transform_second_derivatives_diagonal<1>(const DenseMatrix<double>
2986  &jacobian,
2987  const DenseMatrix<double>
2988  &inverse_jacobian,
2989  const DenseMatrix<double>
2990  &jacobian2,
2991  DShape &dbasis,
2992  DShape &d2basis) const
2993  {
2994  FiniteElement::
2995  transform_second_derivatives_template<1>(jacobian,
2996  inverse_jacobian,
2997  jacobian2,dbasis,d2basis);
2998  }
2999 
3000 
3001 //=========================================================================
3002 /// Convert second derivatives w.r.t. local coordinates to
3003 /// second derivatives w.r.t. the coordinates passed in the tensor
3004 /// coordinate. Specialised to two spatial dimension
3005 //=========================================================================
3006  template<>
3007  void FiniteElement::
3008  transform_second_derivatives_diagonal<2>(const DenseMatrix<double>
3009  &jacobian,
3010  const DenseMatrix<double>
3011  &inverse_jacobian,
3012  const DenseMatrix<double>
3013  &jacobian2,
3014  DShape &dbasis,
3015  DShape &d2basis) const
3016  {
3017  //Find the number of basis functions and basis function types
3018  const unsigned n_basis = dbasis.nindex1();
3019  const unsigned n_basis_type = dbasis.nindex2();
3020 
3021  //Again we assume that there are no cross terms and that coordinate
3022  //i depends only upon local coordinate i
3023 
3024  //Now calculate the DShape d2phidx
3025  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_basis;l++)
3026  {
3027  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_basis_type;k++)
3028  {
3029  //Second derivatives
3030  d2basis(l,k,0) = d2basis(l,k,0)/(jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(0,0))
3031  - dbasis(l,k,0)*jacobian2(0,0)/
3032  (jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(0,0));
3033 
3034  d2basis(l,k,1) = d2basis(l,k,1)/(jacobian(1,1)*jacobian(1,1))
3035  - dbasis(l,k,1)*jacobian2(1,1)/
3036  (jacobian(1,1)*jacobian(1,1)*jacobian(1,1));
3037 
3038  d2basis(l,k,2) = d2basis(l,k,2)/(jacobian(0,0)*jacobian(1,1));
3039  }
3040  }
3041 
3042 
3043  //Assemble the first derivatives
3044  transform_derivatives_diagonal(inverse_jacobian,dbasis);
3045  }
3046 
3047 
3048 //=============================================================================
3049 /// \short Convert derivatives and second derivatives w.r.t. local coordiantes
3050 /// to derivatives and second derivatives w.r.t. the coordinates used to
3051 /// assemble the jacobian, inverse jacobian and jacobian2 passed to the
3052 /// function. This is a template-free general interface, that should be
3053 /// overloaded for efficiency
3054 //============================================================================
3055  void FiniteElement::transform_second_derivatives(const DenseMatrix<double>
3056  &jacobian,
3057  const DenseMatrix<double>
3058  &inverse_jacobian,
3059  const DenseMatrix<double>
3060  &jacobian2,
3061  DShape &dbasis,
3062  DShape &d2basis) const
3063  {
3064  //Find the dimension of the element
3065  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3066  //Choose the appropriate function based on the dimension of the element
3067  switch(el_dim)
3068  {
3069  case 1:
3070  transform_second_derivatives_template<1>(jacobian,
3071  inverse_jacobian,jacobian2,
3072  dbasis,d2basis);
3073  break;
3074  case 2:
3075  transform_second_derivatives_template<2>(jacobian,
3076  inverse_jacobian,jacobian2,
3077  dbasis,d2basis);
3078  break;
3079 
3080  case 3:
3081  throw OomphLibError("Not implemented yet ... maybe one day",
3082  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3083  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3084 
3085  //transform_second_derivatives_template<3>(dphids,d2phids,jacobian,
3086  // inverse_jacobian,jacobian2,
3087  // dphidX,d2phidX);
3088  break;
3089  //Catch-all default case: issue warning and die
3090  default:
3091  std::ostringstream error_stream;
3092  error_stream
3093  << "Dimension of the element must be 1,2 or 3, not " << el_dim
3094  << std::endl;
3095 
3096  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
3097  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3098  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3099  }
3100  }
3101 
3102 
3103 //======================================================================
3104 /// \short The destructor cleans up the memory allocated
3105 /// for storage of pointers to nodes. Internal and external data get
3106 /// wiped by the GeneralisedElement destructor; nodes get
3107 /// killed in mesh destructor.
3108 //=======================================================================
3109  FiniteElement::~FiniteElement()
3110  {
3111  //Delete the storage allocated for the pointers to the loca nodes
3112  delete[] Node_pt;
3113 
3114  //Delete the storage allocated for the nodal numbering schemes
3115  if(Nodal_local_eqn)
3116  {
3117  delete[] Nodal_local_eqn[0];
3118  delete[] Nodal_local_eqn;
3119  }
3120  }
3121 
3122 
3123  //==============================================================
3124  /// Get the local fraction of the node j in the element;
3125  /// vector sets its own size
3126  //==============================================================
3127  void FiniteElement::local_fraction_of_node(const unsigned &j,
3128  Vector<double> &s_fraction)
3129  {
3130  //Default implementation is rather dumb
3131  //Get the local coordinate and scale by local coordinate range
3132  local_coordinate_of_node(j,s_fraction);
3133  unsigned n_coordinates = s_fraction.size();
3134  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_coordinates;i++)
3135  {
3136  s_fraction[i] = (s_fraction[i] - s_min())/(s_max() - s_min());
3137  }
3138  }
3139 
3140 //=======================================================================
3141 /// Set the spatial integration scheme and also calculate the values of the
3142 /// shape functions and their derivatives w.r.t. the local coordinates,
3143 /// placing the values into storage so that they may be re-used,
3144 /// without recalculation
3145 //=======================================================================
3146  void FiniteElement::set_integration_scheme(Integral* const &integral_pt)
3147  {
3148  //Assign the integration scheme
3149  Integral_pt = integral_pt;
3150  }
3151 
3152 //=========================================================================
3153 /// \short Return the shape function stored at the ipt-th integration
3154 /// point.
3155 //=========================================================================
3156  void FiniteElement::shape_at_knot(const unsigned &ipt, Shape &psi) const
3157  {
3158  //Find the dimension of the element
3159  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3160  //Storage for the local coordinates of the integration point
3161  Vector<double> s(el_dim);
3162  //Set the local coordinate
3163  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++) {s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);}
3164  //Get the shape function
3165  shape(s,psi);
3166  }
3167 
3168 //=========================================================================
3169 /// \short Return the shape function and its derivatives w.r.t. the local
3170 /// coordinates at the ipt-th integration point.
3171 //=========================================================================
3172  void FiniteElement::dshape_local_at_knot(const unsigned &ipt, Shape &psi,
3173  DShape &dpsids) const
3174  {
3175  //Find the dimension of the element
3176  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3177  //Storage for the local coordinates of the integration point
3178  Vector<double> s(el_dim);
3179  //Set the local coordinate
3180  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++) {s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);}
3181  //Get the shape function and derivatives
3182  dshape_local(s,psi,dpsids);
3183  }
3184 
3185 //=========================================================================
3186 /// Calculate the shape function and its first and second derivatives
3187 /// w.r.t. local coordinates at the ipt-th integration point.
3188 /// Numbering:
3189 /// \b 1D:
3190 /// d2psids(i,0) = \f$ d^2 \psi_j / d s^2 \f$
3191 /// \b 2D:
3192 /// d2psids(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial s_0^2 \f$
3193 /// d2psids(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial s_1^2 \f$
3194 /// d2psids(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial s_0 \partial s_1 \f$
3195 /// \b 3D:
3196 /// d2psids(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial s_0^2 \f$
3197 /// d2psids(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial s_1^2 \f$
3198 /// d2psids(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial s_2^2 \f$
3199 /// d2psids(i,3) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial s_0 \partial s_1 \f$
3200 /// d2psids(i,4) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial s_0 \partial s_2 \f$
3201 /// d2psids(i,5) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial s_1 \partial s_2 \f$
3202 //=========================================================================
3203  void FiniteElement::d2shape_local_at_knot(const unsigned &ipt, Shape &psi,
3204  DShape &dpsids, DShape &d2psids)
3205  const
3206  {
3207  //Find the dimension of the element
3208  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3209  //Storage for the local coordinates of the integration point
3210  Vector<double> s(el_dim);
3211  //Set the local coordinate
3212  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++) {s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);}
3213  //Get the shape function and first and second derivatives
3214  d2shape_local(s,psi,dpsids,d2psids);
3215  }
3216 
3217 //=========================================================================
3218 /// \short Compute the geometric shape functions and also
3219 /// first derivatives w.r.t. global coordinates at local coordinate s;
3220 /// Returns Jacobian of mapping from global to local coordinates.
3221 /// Most general form of the function, but may be over-loaded, if desired
3222 //=========================================================================
3223  double FiniteElement::dshape_eulerian(const Vector<double> &s,
3224  Shape &psi,
3225  DShape &dpsi) const
3226  {
3227  //Find the element dimension
3228  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3229 
3230  //Get the values of the shape functions and their local derivatives
3231  //Temporarily stored in dpsi
3232  dshape_local(s,psi,dpsi);
3233 
3234  //Allocate memory for the inverse jacobian
3235  DenseMatrix<double> inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
3236  //Now calculate the inverse jacobian
3237  const double det = local_to_eulerian_mapping(dpsi,inverse_jacobian);
3238 
3239  //Now set the values of the derivatives to be dpsidx
3240  transform_derivatives(inverse_jacobian,dpsi);
3241  //Return the determinant of the jacobian
3242  return det;
3243  }
3244 
3245 //========================================================================
3246 /// \short Compute the geometric shape functions and also first
3247 /// derivatives w.r.t. global coordinates at integration point ipt.
3248 /// Most general form of function, but may be over-loaded if desired
3249 //========================================================================
3250  double FiniteElement::dshape_eulerian_at_knot(const unsigned &ipt,
3251  Shape &psi,
3252  DShape &dpsi) const
3253  {
3254  //Find the element dimension
3255  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3256 
3257  //Get the values of the shape function and local derivatives
3258  //Temporarily store it in dpsi
3259  dshape_local_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsi);
3260 
3261  //Allocate memory for the inverse jacobian
3262  DenseMatrix<double> inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
3263  //Now calculate the inverse jacobian
3264  const double det = local_to_eulerian_mapping(dpsi,inverse_jacobian);
3265 
3266  //Now set the values of the derivatives to dpsidx
3267  transform_derivatives(inverse_jacobian,dpsi);
3268  //Return the determinant of the jacobian
3269  return det;
3270  }
3271 
3272 
3273 //========================================================================
3274 /// \short Compute the geometric shape functions (psi) at integration point
3275 /// ipt. Return the determinant of the jacobian of the mapping (detJ).
3276 /// Additionally calculate the derivatives of "detJ" w.r.t. the
3277 /// nodal coordinates.
3278 //========================================================================
3279  double FiniteElement::dJ_eulerian_at_knot(
3280  const unsigned &ipt,
3281  Shape &psi,
3282  DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX) const
3283  {
3284  // Find the element dimension
3285  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3286 
3287  // Get the values of the shape function and local derivatives
3288  unsigned nnod=nnode();
3289  DShape dpsi(nnod,el_dim);
3290  dshape_local_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsi);
3291 
3292  // Allocate memory for the jacobian and the inverse of the jacobian
3293  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian(el_dim), inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
3294 
3295  // Now calculate the inverse jacobian
3296  const double det = local_to_eulerian_mapping(dpsi,jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
3297 
3298  // Calculate the derivative of the jacobian w.r.t. nodal coordinates
3299  // Note: must call this before "transform_derivatives(...)" since this
3300  // function requires dpsids rather than dpsidx
3301  dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates(jacobian,dpsi,djacobian_dX);
3302 
3303  // Return the determinant of the jacobian
3304  return det;
3305  }
3306 
3307 
3308 //========================================================================
3309 /// \short Compute the geometric shape functions (psi) and first
3310 /// derivatives w.r.t. global coordinates (dpsidx) at integration point
3311 /// ipt. Return the determinant of the jacobian of the mapping (detJ).
3312 /// Additionally calculate the derivatives of both "detJ" and "dpsidx"
3313 /// w.r.t. the nodal coordinates.
3314 /// Most general form of function, but may be over-loaded if desired.
3315 //========================================================================
3316  double FiniteElement::dshape_eulerian_at_knot(
3317  const unsigned &ipt,
3318  Shape &psi,
3319  DShape &dpsi,
3320  DenseMatrix<double> &djacobian_dX,
3321  RankFourTensor<double> &d_dpsidx_dX) const
3322  {
3323  // Find the element dimension
3324  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3325 
3326  // Get the values of the shape function and local derivatives
3327  // Temporarily store in dpsi
3328  dshape_local_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsi);
3329 
3330  // Allocate memory for the jacobian and the inverse of the jacobian
3331  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian(el_dim), inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
3332 
3333  // Now calculate the inverse jacobian
3334  const double det = local_to_eulerian_mapping(dpsi,jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
3335 
3336  // Calculate the derivative of the jacobian w.r.t. nodal coordinates
3337  // Note: must call this before "transform_derivatives(...)" since this
3338  // function requires dpsids rather than dpsidx
3339  dJ_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates(jacobian,dpsi,djacobian_dX);
3340 
3341  // Calculate the derivative of dpsidx w.r.t. nodal coordinates
3342  // Note: this function also requires dpsids rather than dpsidx
3343  d_dshape_eulerian_dnodal_coordinates(det,jacobian,djacobian_dX,
3344  inverse_jacobian,dpsi,d_dpsidx_dX);
3345 
3346  // Now set the values of the derivatives to dpsidx
3347  transform_derivatives(inverse_jacobian,dpsi);
3348 
3349  // Return the determinant of the jacobian
3350  return det;
3351  }
3352 
3353 
3354 
3355 //===========================================================================
3356 /// \short Compute the geometric shape functions and also first
3357 /// and second derivatives w.r.t. global coordinates at local coordinate s;
3358 /// Also returns Jacobian of mapping from global to local coordinates.
3359 /// Numbering:
3360 ///\b 1D:
3361 /// d2psidx(i,0) = \f$ d^2 \psi_j / d x^2 \f$
3362 /// \b 2D:
3363 /// d2psidx(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0^2 \f$
3364 /// d2psidx(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_1^2 \f$
3365 /// d2psidx(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0 \partial x_1 \f$
3366 /// \b 3D:
3367 /// d2psidx(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0^2 \f$
3368 /// d2psidx(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_1^2 \f$
3369 /// d2psidx(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_2^2 \f$
3370 /// d2psidx(i,3) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0 \partial x_1 \f$
3371 /// d2psidx(i,4) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0 \partial x_2 \f$
3372 /// d2psidx(i,5) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_1 \partial x_2 \f$
3373 //===========================================================================
3374  double FiniteElement::d2shape_eulerian(const Vector<double> &s,
3375  Shape &psi,
3376  DShape &dpsi,
3377  DShape &d2psi) const
3378  {
3379  //Find the values of the indices of the shape functions
3380  //Locally cached.
3381  //Find the element dimension
3382  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3383  //Find the number of second derivatives required
3384  const unsigned n_deriv = N2deriv[el_dim];
3385 
3386  //Get the values of the shape function and local derivatives
3387  d2shape_local(s,psi,dpsi,d2psi);
3388 
3389  //Allocate memory for the jacobian and inverse jacobian
3390  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian(el_dim), inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
3391  //Calculate the jacobian and inverse jacobian
3392  const double det =
3393  local_to_eulerian_mapping(dpsi,jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
3394 
3395  //Allocate memory for the jacobian of second derivatives
3396  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian2(n_deriv,el_dim);
3397  //Assemble the jacobian of second derivatives
3398  assemble_local_to_eulerian_jacobian2(d2psi,jacobian2);
3399 
3400  //Now set the value of the derivatives
3401  transform_second_derivatives(jacobian,inverse_jacobian,
3402  jacobian2,dpsi,d2psi);
3403  //Return the determinant of the mapping
3404  return det;
3405  }
3406 
3407 //===========================================================================
3408 /// \short Compute the geometric shape functions and also first
3409 /// and second derivatives w.r.t. global coordinates at ipt-th integration
3410 /// point
3411 /// Returns Jacobian of mapping from global to local coordinates.
3412 /// This is the most general version, may be overloaded, if desired.
3413 /// Numbering:
3414 /// \b 1D:
3415 /// d2psidx(i,0) = \f$ d^2 \psi_j / d x^2 \f$
3416 /// \b 2D:
3417 /// d2psidx(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0^2 \f$
3418 /// d2psidx(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_1^2 \f$
3419 /// d2psidx(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0 \partial x_1 \f$
3420 /// \b 3D:
3421 /// d2psidx(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0^2 \f$
3422 /// d2psidx(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_1^2 \f$
3423 /// d2psidx(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_2^2 \f$
3424 /// d2psidx(i,3) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0 \partial x_1 \f$
3425 /// d2psidx(i,4) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_0 \partial x_2 \f$
3426 /// d2psidx(i,5) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial x_1 \partial x_2 \f$
3427 //==========================================================================
3428  double FiniteElement::d2shape_eulerian_at_knot(const unsigned &ipt,
3429  Shape &psi,
3430  DShape &dpsi,
3431  DShape &d2psi) const
3432  {
3433  //Find the values of the indices of the shape functions
3434  //Locally cached
3435  //Find the element dimension
3436  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
3437  //Find the number of second derivatives required
3438  const unsigned n_deriv = N2deriv[el_dim];
3439 
3440  //Get the values of the shape function and local derivatives
3441  d2shape_local_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsi,d2psi);
3442 
3443  //Allocate memory for the jacobian and inverse jacobian
3444  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian(el_dim), inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
3445  //Calculate the jacobian and inverse jacobian
3446  const double det =
3447  local_to_eulerian_mapping(dpsi,jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
3448 
3449  //Allocate memory for the jacobian of second derivatives
3450  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian2(n_deriv,el_dim);
3451  //Assemble the jacobian of second derivatives
3452  assemble_local_to_eulerian_jacobian2(d2psi,jacobian2);
3453 
3454  //Now set the value of the derivatives
3455  transform_second_derivatives(jacobian,inverse_jacobian,
3456  jacobian2,dpsi,d2psi);
3457  //Return the determinant of the mapping
3458  return det;
3459  }
3460 
3461 
3462 
3463 //==========================================================================
3464 /// This function loops over the nodal data of the element, adds the
3465 /// GLOBAL equation numbers to the local-to-global look-up scheme and
3466 /// fills in the Nodal_local_eqn look-up scheme for the local equation
3467 /// numbers
3468 /// If the boolean argument is true then pointers to the dofs will be
3469 /// stored in Dof_pt
3470 //==========================================================================
3471  void FiniteElement::assign_nodal_local_eqn_numbers(
3472  const bool &store_local_dof_pt)
3473  {
3474  //Find the number of nodes
3475  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
3476  //If there are nodes
3477  if(n_node > 0)
3478  {
3479  //Find the number of local equations assigned so far
3480  unsigned local_eqn_number = ndof();
3481 
3482  //We need to find the total number of values stored at the node
3483  //Initialise to the number of values stored at the first node
3484  unsigned n_total_values = node_pt(0)->nvalue();
3485  //Loop over the other nodes and add the values stored
3486  for(unsigned n=1;n<n_node;n++)
3487  {n_total_values += node_pt(n)->nvalue();}
3488 
3489  //If allocated delete the old storage
3490  if(Nodal_local_eqn)
3491  {
3492  delete[] Nodal_local_eqn[0];
3493  delete[] Nodal_local_eqn;
3494  }
3495 
3496  //If there are no values, we are done, null out the storage and
3497  //return
3498  if(n_total_values==0) {Nodal_local_eqn=0; return;}
3499 
3500  //Resize the storage for the nodal local equation numbers
3501  //Firstly allocate pointers to rows for each node
3502  Nodal_local_eqn = new int*[n_node];
3503  //Now allocate storage for the equation numbers
3504  Nodal_local_eqn[0] = new int[n_total_values];
3505  //initially all local equations are unclassified
3506  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_total_values;i++)
3507  {Nodal_local_eqn[0][i] = Data::Is_unclassified;}
3508 
3509  //Loop over the remaining rows and set their pointers
3510  for(unsigned n=1;n<n_node;++n)
3511  {
3512  //Initially set the pointer to the i-th row to the pointer
3513  //to the i-1th row
3514  Nodal_local_eqn[n] = Nodal_local_eqn[n-1];
3515  //Now increase the row pointer by the number of values
3516  //stored at the i-1th node
3517  Nodal_local_eqn[n] += Node_pt[n-1]->nvalue();
3518  }
3519 
3520 
3521  //A local queue to store the global equation numbers
3522  std::deque<unsigned long> global_eqn_number_queue;
3523 
3524  //Now loop over the nodes again and assign local equation numbers
3525  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
3526  {
3527  //Pointer to node
3528  Node* const nod_pt = node_pt(n);
3529 
3530  //Find the number of values stored at the node
3531  unsigned n_value = nod_pt->nvalue();
3532 
3533  //Loop over the number of values
3534  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_value;j++)
3535  {
3536  //Get the GLOBAL equation number
3537  long eqn_number = nod_pt->eqn_number(j);
3538  //If the GLOBAL equation number is positive (a free variable)
3539  if(eqn_number >= 0)
3540  {
3541  //Add the GLOBAL equation number to the queue
3542  global_eqn_number_queue.push_back(eqn_number);
3543  //Add pointer to the dof to the queue if required
3544  if(store_local_dof_pt)
3545  {
3546  GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque.push_back(
3547  nod_pt->value_pt(j));
3548  }
3549  //Add the local equation number to the local scheme
3550  Nodal_local_eqn[n][j] = local_eqn_number;
3551  //Increase the local number
3552  local_eqn_number++;
3553  }
3554  else
3555  {
3556  //Set the local scheme to be pinned
3557  Nodal_local_eqn[n][j] = Data::Is_pinned;
3558  }
3559  }
3560  }
3561 
3562  //Now add our global equations numbers to the internal element storage
3563  add_global_eqn_numbers(global_eqn_number_queue,
3564  GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque);
3565  //Clear the memory used in the deque
3566  if(store_local_dof_pt)
3567  {std::deque<double*>().swap(GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque);}
3568  }
3569  }
3570 
3571 
3572 //============================================================================
3573 /// This function calculates the entries of Jacobian matrix, used in
3574 /// the Newton method, associated with the nodal degrees of freedom.
3575 /// It does this using finite differences,
3576 /// rather than an analytical formulation, so can be done in total generality.
3577 //==========================================================================
3578  void FiniteElement::
3579  fill_in_jacobian_from_nodal_by_fd(Vector<double> &residuals,
3580  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian)
3581  {
3582  //Find the number of nodes
3583  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
3584  //If there aren't any nodes, then return straight awayy
3585  if(n_node == 0) {return;}
3586 
3587  //Call the update function to ensure that the element is in
3588  //a consistent state before finite differencing starts
3589  update_before_nodal_fd();
3590 
3591  //Find the number of dofs in the element
3592  const unsigned n_dof = ndof();
3593  //Create newres vector
3594  Vector<double> newres(n_dof);
3595 
3596  //Integer storage for local unknown
3597  int local_unknown=0;
3598 
3599  //Use the default finite difference step
3600  const double fd_step = Default_fd_jacobian_step;
3601 
3602  //Loop over the nodes
3603  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
3604  {
3605  //Get the number of values stored at the node
3606  const unsigned n_value = node_pt(n)->nvalue();
3607 
3608  //Loop over the number of values
3609  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_value;i++)
3610  {
3611  //Get the local equation number
3612  local_unknown = nodal_local_eqn(n,i);
3613  //If it's not pinned
3614  if(local_unknown >= 0)
3615  {
3616  //Store a pointer to the nodal data value
3617  double* const value_pt = node_pt(n)->value_pt(i);
3618 
3619  //Save the old value of the Nodal data
3620  const double old_var = *value_pt;
3621 
3622  //Increment the value of the Nodal data
3623  *value_pt += fd_step;
3624 
3625  //Now update any dependent variables
3626  update_in_nodal_fd(i);
3627 
3628  //Calculate the new residuals
3629  get_residuals(newres);
3630 
3631  //Do finite differences
3632  for(unsigned m=0;m<n_dof;m++)
3633  {
3634  double sum = (newres[m] - residuals[m])/fd_step;
3635  //Stick the entry into the Jacobian matrix
3636  jacobian(m,local_unknown) = sum;
3637  }
3638 
3639  //Reset the Nodal data
3640  *value_pt = old_var;
3641 
3642  //Reset any dependent variables
3643  reset_in_nodal_fd(i);
3644  }
3645  }
3646  }
3647 
3648  //End of finite difference loop
3649  //Final reset of any dependent data
3650  reset_after_nodal_fd();
3651  }
3652 
3653 
3654 
3655 
3656 //=======================================================================
3657 /// Compute derivatives of elemental residual vector with respect
3658 /// to nodal coordinates. Default implementation by FD can be overwritten
3659 /// for specific elements.
3660 /// dresidual_dnodal_coordinates(l,i,j) = d res(l) / dX_{ij}
3661 ////=======================================================================
3662 void FiniteElement::get_dresidual_dnodal_coordinates(
3663  RankThreeTensor<double>& dresidual_dnodal_coordinates)
3664 {
3665  // Number of nodes
3666  unsigned n_nod=nnode();
3667 
3668  // If the element has no nodes (why??!!) return straightaway
3669  if (n_nod==0) return;
3670 
3671  // Get dimension from first node
3672  unsigned dim_nod=node_pt(0)->ndim();
3673 
3674  // Number of dofs
3675  unsigned n_dof=ndof();
3676 
3677  // Get reference residual
3678  Vector<double> res(n_dof);
3679  Vector<double> res_pls(n_dof);
3680  get_residuals(res);
3681 
3682  // FD step
3683  double eps_fd=GeneralisedElement::Default_fd_jacobian_step;
3684 
3685  // Do FD loop
3686  for (unsigned j=0;j<n_nod;j++)
3687  {
3688  // Get node
3689  Node* nod_pt=node_pt(j);
3690 
3691  // Loop over coordinate directions
3692  for (unsigned i=0;i<dim_nod;i++)
3693  {
3694  // Make backup
3695  double backup=nod_pt->x(i);
3696 
3697  // Do FD step. No node update required as we're
3698  // attacking the coordinate directly...
3699  nod_pt->x(i)+=eps_fd;
3700 
3701  // Perform auxiliary node update function
3702  nod_pt->perform_auxiliary_node_update_fct();
3703 
3704  // Get advanced residual
3705  get_residuals(res_pls);
3706 
3707  // Fill in FD entries [Loop order is "wrong" here as l is the
3708  // slow index but this is in a function that's costly anyway
3709  // and gives us the fastest loop outside where these tensor
3710  // is actually used.]
3711  for (unsigned l=0;l<n_dof;l++)
3712  {
3713  dresidual_dnodal_coordinates(l,i,j)=(res_pls[l]-res[l])/eps_fd;
3714  }
3715 
3716  // Reset coordinate. No node update required as we're
3717  // attacking the coordinate directly...
3718  nod_pt->x(i)=backup;
3719 
3720  // Perform auxiliary node update function
3721  nod_pt->perform_auxiliary_node_update_fct();
3722 
3723  }
3724  }
3725 
3726  }
3727 
3728 
3729 //===============================================================
3730 /// Return the number of the node located at *node_pt
3731 /// if this node is in the element, else return \f$ -1 \f$
3732 //===============================================================
3733  int FiniteElement::get_node_number(Node* const &global_node_pt) const
3734  {
3735  //Initialise the number to -1
3736  int number = -1;
3737  //Find the number of nodes
3738  unsigned n_node = nnode();
3739 #ifdef PARANOID
3740  {
3741  //Error check that node does not appear in element more than once
3742  unsigned count=0;
3743  //Storage for the local node numbers of the element
3744  std::vector<int> local_node_number;
3745  //Loop over the nodes
3746  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_node;i++)
3747  {
3748  //If the node is present increase the counter
3749  //and store the local node number
3750  if(node_pt(i)==global_node_pt)
3751  {
3752  ++count;
3753  local_node_number.push_back(i);
3754  }
3755  }
3756 
3757  //If the node appears more than once, complain
3758  if(count > 1)
3759  {
3760  std::ostringstream error_stream;
3761  error_stream << "Node " << global_node_pt << " appears "
3762  << count << " times in an element." << std::endl
3763  << "In positions: ";
3764  for(std::vector<int>::iterator it=local_node_number.begin();
3765  it!=local_node_number.end();++it)
3766  {
3767  error_stream << *it << " ";
3768  }
3769  error_stream << std::endl
3770  << "That seems very odd." << std::endl;
3771 
3772  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
3773  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
3774  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
3775  }
3776  }
3777 #endif
3778 
3779  //Loop over the nodes
3780  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_node;i++)
3781  {
3782  //If the passed node pointer is present in the element
3783  //set number to be its local node number
3784  if(node_pt(i)==global_node_pt)
3785  {
3786  number=i;
3787  break;
3788  }
3789  }
3790 
3791  //Return the node number
3792  return number;
3793  }
3794 
3795 
3796  //==========================================================================
3797  /// \short If there is a node at the local coordinate, s, return the pointer
3798  /// to the node. If not return 0. Note that this is a default, brute
3799  /// force implementation, can almost certainly be made more efficient for
3800  /// specific elements.
3801  //==========================================================================
3802  Node* FiniteElement::get_node_at_local_coordinate(const Vector<double> &s) const
3803  {
3804  //Locally cache the tolerance
3805  const double tol = Node_location_tolerance;
3806  Vector<double> s_node;
3807  //Locally cache the member data
3808  const unsigned el_dim = Elemental_dimension;
3809  const unsigned n_node = Nnode;
3810  //Loop over the nodes
3811  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
3812  {
3813  bool Match = true;
3814  //Find the local coordinate of the node
3815  local_coordinate_of_node(n,s_node);
3816  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++)
3817  {
3818  //Calculate the difference between coordinates
3819  //and if it's bigger than our tolerance
3820  //break out of the (inner)loop
3821  if(std::fabs(s[i] - s_node[i]) > tol)
3822  {
3823  Match = false;
3824  break;
3825  }
3826  }
3827  //If we haven't complained then we have a match
3828  if(Match) {return node_pt(n);}
3829  }
3830  //If we get here, we have no match
3831  return 0;
3832  }
3833 
3834 //======================================================================
3835 /// Compute centre of gravity of all nodes and radius of node that
3836 /// is furthest from it. Used to assess approximately if a point
3837 /// is likely to be contained with an element in locate_zeta-like
3838 /// operations. NOTE: All computed in terms of zeta!
3839 //======================================================================
3840  void FiniteElement::get_centre_of_gravity_and_max_radius_in_terms_of_zeta(
3841  Vector<double>& cog, double& max_radius) const
3842  {
3843  // Initialise
3844  cog.resize(Elemental_dimension);
3845  max_radius=0.0;
3846 
3847  // Get cog
3848  unsigned nnod=nnode();
3849  for (unsigned j=0;j<nnod;j++)
3850  {
3851  for (unsigned i=0;i<Elemental_dimension;i++)
3852  {
3853  cog[i]+=zeta_nodal(j,0,i);
3854  }
3855  }
3856  for (unsigned i=0;i<Elemental_dimension;i++)
3857  {
3858  cog[i]/=double(nnod);
3859  }
3860 
3861  // Get max distance
3862  for (unsigned j=0;j<nnod;j++)
3863  {
3864  double dist_squared=0.0;
3865  for (unsigned i=0;i<Elemental_dimension;i++)
3866  {
3867  dist_squared+=(cog[i]-zeta_nodal(j,0,i))*(cog[i]-zeta_nodal(j,0,i));
3868  }
3869  if (dist_squared>max_radius) max_radius=dist_squared;
3870  }
3871  max_radius=sqrt(max_radius);
3872  }
3873 
3874 //======================================================================
3875 /// Return FE interpolated coordinate x[i] at local coordinate s
3876 //======================================================================
3877  double FiniteElement::interpolated_x(const Vector<double> &s,
3878  const unsigned &i) const
3879  {
3880  //Find the number of nodes
3881  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
3882  //Find the number of positional types
3883  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
3884  //Assign storage for the local shape function
3885  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
3886  //Find the values of shape function
3887  shape(s,psi);
3888 
3889  //Initialise value of x
3890  double interpolated_x = 0.0;
3891  //Loop over the local nodes
3892  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
3893  {
3894  //Loop over the number of dofs
3895  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
3896  {
3897  interpolated_x += nodal_position_gen(l,k,i)*psi(l,k);
3898  }
3899  }
3900 
3901  return(interpolated_x);
3902  }
3903 
3904 //=========================================================================
3905 /// Return FE interpolated coordinate x[i] at local coordinate s
3906 /// at previous timestep t (t=0: present; t>0: previous timestep)
3907 //========================================================================
3908  double FiniteElement::interpolated_x(const unsigned &t,
3909  const Vector<double> &s,
3910  const unsigned &i) const
3911  {
3912  //Find the number of nodes
3913  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
3914  //Find the number of positional types
3915  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
3916 
3917  //Assign storage for the local shape function
3918  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
3919  //Find the values of shape function
3920  shape(s,psi);
3921 
3922  //Initialise value of x
3923  double interpolated_x = 0.0;
3924  //Loop over the local nodes
3925  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
3926  {
3927  //Loop over the number of dofs
3928  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
3929  {
3930  interpolated_x += nodal_position_gen(t,l,k,i)*psi(l,k);
3931  }
3932  }
3933 
3934  return(interpolated_x);
3935  }
3936 
3937 //=======================================================================
3938 /// Return FE interpolated position x[] at local coordinate s as Vector
3939 //=======================================================================
3940  void FiniteElement::interpolated_x(const Vector<double> &s, Vector<double> &x)
3941  const
3942  {
3943  //Find the number of nodes
3944  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
3945  //Find the number of positional types
3946  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
3947  //Find the dimension stored in the node
3948  const unsigned nodal_dim = nodal_dimension();
3949 
3950  //Assign storage for the local shape function
3951  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
3952  //Find the values of shape function
3953  shape(s,psi);
3954 
3955  //Loop over the dimensions
3956  for(unsigned i=0;i<nodal_dim;i++)
3957  {
3958  //Initilialise value of x[i] to zero
3959  x[i] = 0.0;
3960  //Loop over the local nodes
3961  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
3962  {
3963  //Loop over the number of dofs
3964  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
3965  {
3966  x[i] += nodal_position_gen(l,k,i)*psi(l,k);
3967  }
3968  }
3969  }
3970  }
3971 
3972 //==========================================================================
3973 /// Return FE interpolated position x[] at local coordinate s
3974 /// at previous timestep t as Vector (t=0: present; t>0: previous timestep)
3975 //==========================================================================
3976  void FiniteElement::interpolated_x(const unsigned &t,
3977  const Vector<double> &s,
3978  Vector<double>& x) const
3979  {
3980  //Find the number of nodes
3981  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
3982  //Find the number of positional types
3983  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
3984  //Find the dimensions of the nodes
3985  const unsigned nodal_dim = nodal_dimension();
3986 
3987  //Assign storage for the local shape function
3988  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
3989  //Find the values of shape function
3990  shape(s,psi);
3991 
3992  //Loop over the dimensions
3993  for(unsigned i=0;i<nodal_dim;i++)
3994  {
3995  //Initilialise value of x[i] to zero
3996  x[i] = 0.0;
3997  //Loop over the local nodes
3998  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
3999  {
4000  //Loop over the number of dofs
4001  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
4002  {
4003  x[i] += nodal_position_gen(t,l,k,i)*psi(l,k);
4004  }
4005  }
4006  }
4007  }
4008 
4009 //========================================================================
4010 /// \short Calculate the determinant of the
4011 /// Jacobian of the mapping between local and global
4012 /// coordinates at the position. Works directly from the base vectors
4013 /// without assuming that coordinates match spatial dimension. Will
4014 /// be overloaded in FaceElements, in which the elemental dimension does
4015 /// not match the spatial dimension. WARNING: this is always positive
4016 /// and cannot be used to check if the element is inverted, say!
4017 //========================================================================
4018  double FiniteElement::J_eulerian(const Vector<double> &s) const
4019  {
4020  //Find the number of nodes and position types
4021  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
4022  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
4023  //Find the dimension of the node and element
4024  const unsigned n_dim_node = nodal_dimension();
4025  const unsigned n_dim_element = dim();
4026 
4027  //Set up dummy memory for the shape functions
4028  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
4029  DShape dpsids(n_node,n_position_type,n_dim_element);
4030  //Get the shape functions and local derivatives
4031  dshape_local(s,psi,dpsids);
4032 
4033  //Right calculate the base vectors
4034  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_G(n_dim_element,n_dim_node);
4035  assemble_eulerian_base_vectors(dpsids,interpolated_G);
4036 
4037  //Calculate the metric tensor of the element
4038  DenseMatrix<double> G(n_dim_element,n_dim_element,0.0);
4039  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_element;i++)
4040  {
4041  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim_element;j++)
4042  {
4043  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_dim_node;k++)
4044  {
4045  G(i,j) += interpolated_G(i,k)*interpolated_G(j,k);
4046  }
4047  }
4048  }
4049 
4050  //Calculate the determinant of the metric tensor
4051  double det = 0.0;
4052  switch(n_dim_element)
4053  {
4054  case 0:
4055  throw OomphLibError("Cannot calculate J_eulerian() for point element\n",
4056  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4057  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4058  break;
4059  case 1:
4060  det = G(0,0);
4061  break;
4062  case 2:
4063  det = G(0,0)*G(1,1) - G(0,1)*G(1,0);
4064  break;
4065  case 3:
4066  det = G(0,0)*G(1,1)*G(2,2) + G(0,1)*G(1,2)*G(2,0) + G(0,2)*G(1,0)*G(2,1)
4067  - G(0,0)*G(1,2)*G(2,1) - G(0,1)*G(1,0)*G(2,2) - G(0,2)*G(1,1)*G(2,0);
4068  break;
4069  default:
4070  oomph_info << "More than 3 dimensions in J_eulerian()" << std::endl;
4071  break;
4072  }
4073 
4074  //Return the Jacobian (square-root of the determinant of the metric tensor)
4075  return sqrt(det);
4076  }
4077 
4078 //========================================================================
4079 /// \short Compute the Jacobian of the mapping between the local and global
4080 /// coordinates at the ipt-th integration point
4081 //========================================================================
4082  double FiniteElement::J_eulerian_at_knot(const unsigned &ipt)
4083  const
4084  {
4085  //Find the number of nodes
4086  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
4087  //Find the number of position types
4088  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
4089  //Find the dimension of the node and element
4090  const unsigned n_dim_node = nodal_dimension();
4091  const unsigned n_dim_element = dim();
4092 
4093  //Set up dummy memory for the shape functions
4094  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
4095  DShape dpsids(n_node,n_position_type,n_dim_element);
4096  //Get the shape functions and local derivatives at the knot
4097  //This call may use the stored versions, which is why this entire
4098  //function doesn't just call J_eulerian(s), after reading out s from
4099  //the knots.
4100  dshape_local_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsids);
4101 
4102  //Right calculate the base vectors
4103  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_G(n_dim_element,n_dim_node);
4104  assemble_eulerian_base_vectors(dpsids,interpolated_G);
4105 
4106  //Calculate the metric tensor of the element
4107  DenseMatrix<double> G(n_dim_element,n_dim_element,0.0);
4108  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_element;i++)
4109  {
4110  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim_element;j++)
4111  {
4112  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_dim_node;k++)
4113  {
4114  G(i,j) += interpolated_G(i,k)*interpolated_G(j,k);
4115  }
4116  }
4117  }
4118 
4119  //Calculate the determinant of the metric tensor
4120  double det = 0.0;
4121  switch(n_dim_element)
4122  {
4123  case 0:
4124  throw OomphLibError("Cannot calculate J_eulerian() for point element\n",
4125  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4126  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4127  break;
4128  case 1:
4129  det = G(0,0);
4130  break;
4131  case 2:
4132  det = G(0,0)*G(1,1) - G(0,1)*G(1,0);
4133  break;
4134  case 3:
4135  det = G(0,0)*G(1,1)*G(2,2) + G(0,1)*G(1,2)*G(2,0) + G(0,2)*G(1,0)*G(2,1)
4136  - G(0,0)*G(1,2)*G(2,1) - G(0,1)*G(1,0)*G(2,2) - G(0,2)*G(1,1)*G(2,0);
4137  break;
4138  default:
4139  oomph_info << "More than 3 dimensions in J_eulerian()" << std::endl;
4140  break;
4141  }
4142 
4143  //Return the Jacobian (square-root of the determinant of the metric tensor)
4144  return sqrt(det);
4145  }
4146 
4147 //========================================================================
4148 /// \short Check that Jacobian of mapping between local and Eulerian
4149 /// coordinates at all integration points is positive.
4150 //========================================================================
4151 void FiniteElement::check_J_eulerian_at_knots(bool& passed) const
4152  {
4153 
4154  // Bypass check deep down in the guts...
4155  bool backup=FiniteElement::Accept_negative_jacobian;
4156  FiniteElement::Accept_negative_jacobian=true;
4157 
4158  // Let's be optimistic...
4159  passed=true;
4160 
4161  //Find the number of nodes
4162  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
4163 
4164  //Find the number of position types
4165  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
4166 
4167  // DRAIG: Unused variable
4168  //const unsigned n_dim_node = nodal_dimension();
4169 
4170  //Find the dimension of the node and element
4171  const unsigned n_dim_element = dim();
4172 
4173  //Set up dummy memory for the shape functions
4174  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
4175  DShape dpsi(n_node,n_dim_element);
4176 
4177  unsigned nintpt=integral_pt()->nweight();
4178  for (unsigned ipt=0;ipt<nintpt;ipt++)
4179  {
4180  double jac=dshape_eulerian_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsi);
4181 
4182  // Are we dead yet?
4183  if (jac<=0.0)
4184  {
4185  passed=false;
4186 
4187  // Reset
4188  FiniteElement::Accept_negative_jacobian=backup;
4189 
4190  return;
4191  }
4192  }
4193 
4194  // Reset
4195  FiniteElement::Accept_negative_jacobian=backup;
4196 
4197  }
4198 
4199 //====================================================================
4200 /// Calculate the size of the element (in Eulerian computational
4201 /// coordinates. Use suitably overloaded compute_physical_size()
4202 /// function to compute the actual size (taking into account
4203 /// factors such as 2pi or radii the integrand). Such function
4204 /// can only be implemented on an equation-by-equation basis.
4205 //====================================================================
4206  double FiniteElement::size() const
4207  {
4208  //Initialise the sum to zero
4209  double sum = 0.0;
4210 
4211  //Loop over the integration points
4212  const unsigned n_intpt = integral_pt()->nweight();
4213  for(unsigned ipt=0;ipt<n_intpt;ipt++)
4214  {
4215  //Get the integral weight
4216  double w = integral_pt()->weight(ipt);
4217  //Get the value of the Jacobian of the mapping to global coordinates
4218  double J = J_eulerian_at_knot(ipt);
4219 
4220  //Add the product to the sum
4221  sum += w*J;
4222  }
4223 
4224  //Return the answer
4225  return(sum);
4226  }
4227 
4228 //==================================================================
4229 /// Integrate Vector-valued time-dep function over element
4230 //==================================================================
4231  void FiniteElement::
4232  integrate_fct(FiniteElement::UnsteadyExactSolutionFctPt integrand_fct_pt,
4233  const double& time,
4234  Vector<double>& integral)
4235  {
4236  //Initialise all components of integral Vector and setup integrand vector
