4237  const unsigned ncomponents=integral.size();
4238  Vector<double> integrand(ncomponents);
4239  for (unsigned i=0;i<ncomponents;i++) {integral[i]=0.0;}
4240 
4241  // Figure out the global (Eulerian) spatial dimension of the
4242  // element
4243  const unsigned n_dim_eulerian = nodal_dimension();
4244 
4245  // Allocate Vector of global Eulerian coordinates
4246  Vector<double> x(n_dim_eulerian);
4247 
4248  // Set the value of n_intpt
4249  const unsigned n_intpt = integral_pt()->nweight();
4250 
4251  // Vector of local coordinates
4252  const unsigned n_dim = dim();
4253  Vector<double> s(n_dim);
4254 
4255  //Loop over the integration points
4256  for(unsigned ipt=0;ipt<n_intpt;ipt++)
4257  {
4258  //Assign the values of s
4259  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim;i++) {s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);}
4260 
4261  //Assign the values of the global Eulerian coordinates
4262  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_eulerian;i++) {x[i] = interpolated_x(s,i);}
4263 
4264  //Get the integral weight
4265  double w = integral_pt()->weight(ipt);
4266 
4267  //Get Jacobian of mapping
4268  double J = J_eulerian(s);
4269 
4270  // Evaluate the integrand at the knot points
4271  integrand_fct_pt(time,x,integrand);
4272 
4273  //Add to components of integral Vector
4274  for (unsigned i=0;i<ncomponents;i++) {integral[i]+=integrand[i]*w*J;}
4275  }
4276  }
4277 
4278 //==================================================================
4279 /// Integrate Vector-valued function over element
4280 //==================================================================
4281  void FiniteElement::
4282  integrate_fct(FiniteElement::SteadyExactSolutionFctPt integrand_fct_pt,
4283  Vector<double>& integral)
4284  {
4285  //Initialise all components of integral Vector
4286  const unsigned ncomponents=integral.size();
4287  Vector<double> integrand(ncomponents);
4288  for (unsigned i=0;i<ncomponents;i++) {integral[i]=0.0;}
4289 
4290  // Figure out the global (Eulerian) spatial dimension of the
4291  // element by checking the Eulerian dimension of the nodes
4292  const unsigned n_dim_eulerian = nodal_dimension();
4293 
4294  // Allocate Vector of global Eulerian coordinates
4295  Vector<double> x(n_dim_eulerian);
4296 
4297  // Set the value of n_intpt
4298  const unsigned n_intpt = integral_pt()->nweight();
4299 
4300  // Vector of local coordinates
4301  const unsigned n_dim = dim();
4302  Vector<double> s(n_dim);
4303 
4304  //Loop over the integration points
4305  for(unsigned ipt=0;ipt<n_intpt;ipt++)
4306  {
4307  //Assign the values of s
4308  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim;i++) {s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);}
4309 
4310  //Assign the values of the global Eulerian coordinates
4311  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_eulerian;i++) {x[i] = interpolated_x(s,i);}
4312 
4313  //Get the integral weight
4314  double w = integral_pt()->weight(ipt);
4315 
4316  //Get Jacobian of mapping
4317  double J = J_eulerian(s);
4318 
4319  // Evaluate the integrand at the knot points
4320  integrand_fct_pt(x,integrand);
4321 
4322  //Add to components of integral Vector
4323  for (unsigned i=0;i<ncomponents;i++) {integral[i]+=integrand[i]*w*J;}
4324  }
4325  }
4326 
4327 //==========================================================================
4328 /// Self-test: Have all internal values been classified as
4329 /// pinned/unpinned? Has pointer to spatial integration scheme
4330 /// been set? Return 0 if OK.
4331 //==========================================================================
4332  unsigned FiniteElement::self_test()
4333  {
4334  // Initialise
4335  bool passed=true;
4336 
4337  if(GeneralisedElement::self_test()!=0) {passed=false;}
4338 
4339  // Check that pointer to spatial integration scheme has been set
4340  if(integral_pt()==0)
4341  {
4342  passed=false;
4343 
4344  OomphLibWarning(
4345  "Pointer to spatial integration scheme has not been set.",
4346  "FiniteElement::self_test()",
4347  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4348  }
4349 
4350  //If the dimension of the element is zero (point element), there
4351  //is not jacobian
4352  const unsigned dim_el = dim();
4353 
4354  if(dim_el> 0)
4355  {
4356  // Loop over integration points to check sign of Jacobian
4357  //-------------------------------------------------------
4358 
4359  //Set the value of n_intpt
4360  const unsigned n_intpt = integral_pt()->nweight();
4361 
4362  //Set the Vector to hold local coordinates
4363  Vector<double> s(dim_el);
4364 
4365  //Find the number of local nodes
4366  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
4367  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
4368  //Set up memory for the shape and test functions
4369  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
4370  DShape dpsidx(n_node,dim_el);
4371 
4372  // Jacobian
4373  double jacobian;
4374 
4375 
4376  // Two ways of testing for negative Jacobian for non-FaceElements
4377  unsigned ntest=1;
4378 
4379  // For FaceElements checking the Jacobian via dpsidx doesn't
4380  // make sense
4381  FiniteElement* tmp_pt=const_cast<FiniteElement*>(this);
4382  FaceElement* face_el_pt=dynamic_cast<FaceElement*>(tmp_pt);
4383  if (face_el_pt==0)
4384  {
4385  ntest=2;
4386  }
4387 
4388  // For now overwrite -- the stuff above fails for Bretherton.
4389  // Not sure why.
4390  ntest=1;
4391 
4392  //Loop over the integration points
4393  for(unsigned ipt=0;ipt<n_intpt;ipt++)
4394  {
4395  //Assign values of s
4396  for(unsigned i=0;i<dim_el;i++)
4397  {
4398  s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);
4399  }
4400 
4401 
4402  // Do tests
4403  for (unsigned test=0;test<ntest;test++)
4404  {
4405 
4406  switch (test)
4407  {
4408 
4409  case 0:
4410 
4411  // Get the jacobian from the mapping between local and Eulerian
4412  // coordinates
4413  jacobian = J_eulerian(s);
4414 
4415  break;
4416 
4417  case 1:
4418 
4419  //Call the geometrical shape functions and derivatives
4420  //This also computes the Jacobian by a slightly different
4421  //method
4422  jacobian = dshape_eulerian_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsidx);
4423 
4424  break;
4425 
4426  default:
4427 
4428  throw OomphLibError("Never get here",
4429  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4430  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4431  }
4432 
4433 
4434  //Check for a singular jacobian
4435  if(std::fabs(jacobian) < 1.0e-16)
4436  {
4437  std::ostringstream warning_stream;
4438  warning_stream << "Determinant of Jacobian matrix is zero at ipt "
4439  << ipt << std::endl;
4440  OomphLibWarning(warning_stream.str(),
4441  "FiniteElement::self_test()",
4442  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4443  passed = false;
4444  //Skip the next test
4445  continue;
4446  }
4447 
4448  //Check sign of Jacobian
4449  if ((Accept_negative_jacobian==false) && (jacobian < 0.0))
4450  {
4451  std::ostringstream warning_stream;
4452  warning_stream << "Jacobian negative at integration point ipt="
4453  << ipt << std::endl;
4454  warning_stream
4455  << "If you think that this is what you want you may: " << std::endl
4456  << "set the (static) flag "
4457  << "FiniteElement::Accept_negative_jacobian to be true" << std::endl;
4458 
4459  OomphLibWarning(warning_stream.str(),
4460  "FiniteElement::self_test()",
4461  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4462  passed=false;
4463  }
4464 
4465  } // end of loop over two tests
4466 
4467  }
4468  } //End of non-zero dimension check
4469 
4470  // Return verdict
4471  if (passed) {return 0;}
4472  else {return 1;}
4473  }
4474 
4475 
4476 
4477 
4478 //=======================================================================
4479 /// Return the t-th time-derivative of the
4480 /// i-th FE-interpolated Eulerian coordinate at
4481 /// local coordinate s.
4482 //=======================================================================
4483  double FiniteElement::interpolated_dxdt(const Vector<double> &s,
4484  const unsigned &i,
4485  const unsigned &t_deriv)
4486  {
4487  //Find the number of nodes and positions (locally cached)
4488  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
4489  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
4490  // Get shape functions: specify # of nodes, # of positional dofs
4491  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
4492  shape(s,psi);
4493 
4494  // Initialise
4495  double drdt=0.0;
4496 
4497  // Assemble time derivative
4498  //Loop over nodes
4499  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
4500  {
4501  //Loop over types of dof
4502  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
4503  {
4504  drdt+=dnodal_position_gen_dt(t_deriv,l,k,i)*psi(l,k);
4505  }
4506  }
4507  return drdt;
4508  }
4509 
4510 
4511 
4512 //=======================================================================
4513 /// Compute t-th time-derivative of the
4514 /// FE-interpolated Eulerian coordinate vector at
4515 /// local coordinate s.
4516 //=======================================================================
4517  void FiniteElement::interpolated_dxdt(const Vector<double> &s,
4518  const unsigned &t_deriv,
4519  Vector<double>& dxdt)
4520  {
4521  //Find the number of nodes and positions (locally cached)
4522  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
4523  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
4524  const unsigned nodal_dim = nodal_dimension();
4525 
4526  // Get shape functions: specify # of nodes, # of positional dofs
4527  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
4528  shape(s,psi);
4529 
4530  // Loop over directions
4531  for (unsigned i=0;i<nodal_dim;i++)
4532  {
4533  // Initialise
4534  dxdt[i]=0.0;
4535 
4536  // Assemble time derivative
4537  //Loop over nodes
4538  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
4539  {
4540  //Loop over types of dof
4541  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
4542  {
4543  dxdt[i]+=dnodal_position_gen_dt(t_deriv,l,k,i)*psi(l,k);
4544  }
4545  }
4546  }
4547  }
4548 
4549 //============================================================================
4550 /// Calculate the interpolated value of zeta, the intrinsic coordinate
4551 /// of the element when viewed as a compound geometric object within a Mesh
4552 /// as a function of the local coordinate of the element, s.
4553 /// The default
4554 /// assumption is the zeta is interpolated using the shape functions of
4555 /// the element with the values given by zeta_nodal().
4556 /// A MacroElement representation of the intrinsic coordinate parametrised
4557 /// by the local coordinate s is used if available.
4558 /// Choosing the MacroElement representation of zeta (Eulerian x by default)
4559 /// allows a correspondence to be established between elements on different
4560 /// Meshes covering the same curvilinear domain in cases where one element
4561 /// is much coarser than the other.
4562 //==========================================================================
4563  void FiniteElement::interpolated_zeta(const Vector<double> &s,
4564  Vector<double> &zeta) const
4565 {
4566  //If there is a macro element use it
4567  if(Macro_elem_pt!=0) {this->get_x_from_macro_element(s,zeta);}
4568  //Otherwise interpolate zeta_nodal using the shape functions
4569  else
4570  {
4571  //Find the number of nodes
4572  const unsigned n_node = this->nnode();
4573  //Find the number of positional types
4574  const unsigned n_position_type = this->nnodal_position_type();
4575  //Storage for the shape functions
4576  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
4577  //Get the values of the shape functions at the local coordinate s
4578  this->shape(s,psi);
4579 
4580  //Find the number of coordinates
4581  const unsigned ncoord = this->dim();
4582  //Initialise the value of zeta to zero
4583  for(unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++) {zeta[i] = 0.0;}
4584 
4585  //Add the contributions from each nodal dof to the interpolated value
4586  //of zeta.
4587  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
4588  {
4589  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
4590  {
4591  //Locally cache the value of the shape function
4592  const double psi_ = psi(l,k);
4593  for(unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++)
4594  {
4595  zeta[i] += this->zeta_nodal(l,k,i)*psi_;
4596  }
4597  }
4598  }
4599  }
4600 }
4601 
4602 //==========================================================================
4603 /// For a given value of zeta, the "global" intrinsic coordinate of
4604 /// a mesh of FiniteElements represented as a compound geometric object,
4605 /// find the local coordinate in this element that corresponds to the
4606 /// requested value of zeta.
4607 /// This is achieved in generality by using Newton's method to find the value
4608 /// of the local coordinate, s, such that
4609 /// interpolated_zeta(s) is equal to the requested value of zeta.
4610 /// If zeta cannot be located in this element, geom_object_pt is set
4611 /// to NULL. If zeta is located in this element, we return its "this"
4612 /// pointer.
4613 /// Setting the optional bool argument to true means that the coordinate
4614 /// argument "s" is used as the initial guess. (Default is false).
4615 //=========================================================================
4616 void FiniteElement::locate_zeta(const Vector<double> &zeta,
4617  GeomObject*& geom_object_pt, Vector<double> &s,
4618  const bool& use_coordinate_as_initial_guess)
4619 {
4620 
4621  //Find the number of coordinates, the dimension of the element
4622  //This must be the same for the local and intrinsic global coordinate
4623  unsigned ncoord = this->dim();
4624 
4625  // Fast return based on centre of gravity and max. radius of any nodal
4626  // point
4627  if (Locate_zeta_helpers::Radius_multiplier_for_fast_exit_from_locate_zeta>0.0)
4628  {
4629  Vector<double> cog(ncoord);
4630  double max_radius=0.0;
4631  get_centre_of_gravity_and_max_radius_in_terms_of_zeta(cog,max_radius);
4632 
4633  // Get radius
4634  double radius=0.0;
4635  for (unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++)
4636  {
4637  radius+=(cog[i]-zeta[i])*(cog[i]-zeta[i]);
4638  }
4639  radius=sqrt(radius);
4640  if (radius>
4641  Locate_zeta_helpers::Radius_multiplier_for_fast_exit_from_locate_zeta*
4642  max_radius)
4643  {
4644  geom_object_pt=0;
4645  return;
4646  }
4647  }
4648 
4649  //Assign storage for the vector and matrix used in Newton's method
4650  Vector<double> dx(ncoord,0.0);
4651  DenseDoubleMatrix jacobian(ncoord,ncoord,0.0);
4652 
4653  // // Make a list of (equally-spaced) local coordinates inside the element
4654  // unsigned n_list=Locate_zeta_helpers::N_local_points;
4655 
4656  // double list_space=(1.0/(double(n_list)-1.0))*(s_max()-s_min());
4657 
4658  // Possible initial guesses for Newton's method
4659  Vector<Vector<double> > s_list;
4660 
4661  // If the boolean argument use_coordinate_as_initial_guess was set
4662  // to true then we don't need to initialise s
4663  if (!use_coordinate_as_initial_guess)
4664  {
4665  //Vector of local coordinates
4666  Vector<double> s_c(ncoord);
4667 
4668  // Loop over plot points
4669  unsigned num_plot_points=nplot_points(Locate_zeta_helpers::N_local_points);
4670  for (unsigned iplot=0;iplot<num_plot_points;iplot++)
4671  {
4672  // Get local coordinates of plot point
4673  get_s_plot(iplot,Locate_zeta_helpers::N_local_points,s_c);
4674  s_list.push_back(s_c);
4675  }
4676  }
4677 
4678  //Counter for the number of Newton steps
4679  unsigned count=0;
4680 
4681  //Control flag for the Newton loop
4682  bool keep_going=true;
4683 
4684  //Storage for the interpolated value of x
4685  Vector<double> inter_x(ncoord);
4686 
4687  // Ifwe have specified the coordinate already
4688  if (use_coordinate_as_initial_guess)
4689  {
4690  //Get the value of x at the initial guess
4691  this->interpolated_zeta(s,inter_x);
4692 
4693  //Set up the residuals
4694  for(unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++) {dx[i] = zeta[i] - inter_x[i];}
4695  }
4696  else
4697  {
4698  // Find the smallest residual from the list of coordinates made earlier
4699  double my_min_resid=DBL_MAX;
4700  Vector<double> s_local(ncoord);
4701  Vector<double> work_x(ncoord);
4702  Vector<double> work_dx(ncoord);
4703 
4704  unsigned n_list_coord=s_list.size();
4705 
4706  for (unsigned i_coord=0; i_coord<n_list_coord; i_coord++)
4707  {
4708  for (unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++)
4709  {
4710  s_local[i]=s_list[i_coord][i];
4711  }
4712  // get_x for this coordinate
4713  this->interpolated_zeta(s_local,work_x);
4714 
4715  // calculate residuals
4716  for(unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++)
4717  {
4718  work_dx[i] = zeta[i] - work_x[i];
4719  }
4720 
4721  double maxres =
4722  std::fabs(*std::max_element(work_dx.begin(),work_dx.end(),
4723  AbsCmp<double>()));
4724 
4725  // test against previous residuals
4726  if (maxres<my_min_resid)
4727  {
4728  my_min_resid=maxres;
4729  dx=work_dx;
4730  inter_x=work_x;
4731  s=s_local;
4732  }
4733 
4734  }
4735  }
4736 
4737  //Main Newton Loop
4738  do // start of do while loop
4739  {
4740  //Increase loop counter
4741  count++;
4742 
4743  //Bail out if necessary (without an error for now...)
4744  if(count > Locate_zeta_helpers::Max_newton_iterations)
4745  {
4746  keep_going=false;
4747  continue;
4748  }
4749 
4750  //If it's the first time round the loop, check the initial residuals
4751  if(count==1)
4752  {
4753  double maxres =
4754  std::fabs(*std::max_element(dx.begin(),dx.end(),AbsCmp<double>()));
4755 
4756  //If it's small enough exit
4757  if(maxres < Locate_zeta_helpers::Newton_tolerance)
4758  {
4759  keep_going=false;
4760  continue;
4761  }
4762  }
4763 
4764  //Is there a macro element? If so, assemble the Jacobian by FD-ing
4765  if (macro_elem_pt()!=0)
4766  {
4767  // Assemble jacobian on the fly by finite differencing
4768  Vector<double> work_s=s;
4769  Vector<double> r=inter_x; // i.e. the result of previous call to get_x
4770 
4771  // Finite difference step
4772  double fd_step=GeneralisedElement::Default_fd_jacobian_step;
4773 
4774  // Storage for calculated r from incremented s
4775  Vector<double> work_r(ncoord,0.0);
4776 
4777  // Loop over s coordinates
4778  for (unsigned i=0; i<ncoord; i++)
4779  {
4780  // Increment work_s by a small amount
4781  work_s[i]+=fd_step;
4782 
4783  // Calculate work_r from macro element
4784  this->interpolated_zeta(work_s,work_r);
4785 
4786  // Loop over r to fill Jacobian
4787  for (unsigned j=0; j<ncoord; j++)
4788  {
4789  jacobian(j,i)=-(work_r[j]-r[j])/fd_step;
4790  }
4791 
4792  // Reset work_s
4793  work_s[i]=s[i];
4794 
4795  }
4796 
4797  }
4798  else // no macro element, so compute Jacobian with shape functions etc.
4799  {
4800  //Compute the entries of the Jacobian matrix
4801  unsigned n_node = this->nnode();
4802  unsigned n_position_type = this->nnodal_position_type();
4803  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
4804  DShape dpsids(n_node,n_position_type,ncoord);
4805 
4806  //Get the local shape functions and their derivatives
4807  dshape_local(s,psi,dpsids);
4808 
4809  //Calculate the values of dxds
4810  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_dxds(ncoord,ncoord,0.0);
4811 
4812 // MH: No longer needed
4813 // //This implementation will only work for n_position_type=1
4814 // //since the function nodal_position_gen does not yet exist
4815 // #ifdef PARANOID
4816 // if (n_position_type!=1)
4817 // {
4818 // std::ostringstream error_stream;
4819 // error_stream << "This implementation does not exist yet;\n"
4820 // << "it currently uses raw_nodal_position_gen\n"
4821 // << "which does not take hangingness into account\n"
4822 // << "It will work if n_position_type=1\n";
4823 // throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
4824 // OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
4825 // OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
4826 // }
4827 // #endif
4828 
4829  // Loop over the nodes
4830  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
4831  {
4832  // Loop over position type even though it should be 1; the
4833  // functionality for n_position_type>1 will exist in the future
4834  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
4835  {
4836  // Add the contribution from the nodal coordinates to the matrix
4837  for(unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++)
4838  {
4839  for(unsigned j=0;j<ncoord;j++)
4840  {
4841  interpolated_dxds(i,j) +=
4842  this->zeta_nodal(l,k,i)*dpsids(l,k,j);
4843  }
4844  }
4845  }
4846  }
4847 
4848  //The entries of the Jacobian matrix are merely dresiduals/ds
4849  //i.e. \f$ -dx/ds \f$
4850  for(unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++)
4851  {
4852  for(unsigned j=0;j<ncoord;j++)
4853  {
4854  jacobian(i,j) = - interpolated_dxds(i,j);
4855  }
4856  }
4857 
4858  }
4859 
4860  //Now solve the damn thing
4861  try
4862  {
4863  jacobian.solve(dx);
4864  }
4865  catch(OomphLibError &error)
4866  {
4867  // I've caught the error so shut up!
4868  error.disable_error_message();
4869 #ifdef PARANOID
4870  oomph_info << "Error in linear solve for "
4871  << "FiniteElement::locate_zeta()"
4872  << std::endl;
4873  oomph_info << "Should not affect the result!" << std::endl;
4874 #endif
4875  }
4876 
4877  //Add the correction to the local coordinates
4878  for(unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++) {s[i] -= dx[i];}
4879 
4880  //Get the new residuals
4881  this->interpolated_zeta(s,inter_x);
4882  for(unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++) {dx[i] = zeta[i] - inter_x[i];}
4883 
4884  //Get the maximum residuals
4885  double maxres =
4886  std::fabs(*std::max_element(dx.begin(),dx.end(),AbsCmp<double>()));
4887 
4888  //If we have converged jump straight to the test at the end of the loop
4889  if(maxres < Locate_zeta_helpers::Newton_tolerance)
4890  {
4891  keep_going=false;
4892  continue;
4893  }
4894  }
4895  while(keep_going);
4896 
4897  //Test whether the local coordinates are valid or not
4898  bool valid=local_coord_is_valid(s);
4899 
4900  // If not valid, experimentally push back into element
4901  // and see if the result is still valid (within the Newton tolerance)
4902  if (!valid)
4903  {
4904  move_local_coord_back_into_element(s);
4905 
4906  // Check residuals again
4907  this->interpolated_zeta(s,inter_x);
4908  for(unsigned i=0;i<ncoord;i++) {dx[i] = zeta[i] - inter_x[i];}
4909 
4910  //Get the maximum residuals
4911  double maxres =
4912  std::fabs(*std::max_element(dx.begin(),dx.end(),AbsCmp<double>()));
4913 
4914  // Are we still OK?
4915  if(maxres > Locate_zeta_helpers::Newton_tolerance)
4916  {
4917  // oomph_info
4918  // << "Pushing back inside has violated the Newton tolerance: max_res = "
4919  // << maxres << std::endl;
4920  geom_object_pt=0;
4921  return;
4922  }
4923  }
4924 
4925  // It is also possible now that it may not have converged "correctly",
4926  // i.e. count is greater than Max_newton_iterations
4927  if (count > Locate_zeta_helpers::Max_newton_iterations)
4928  {
4929  // Don't trust the current answer, return null
4930  geom_object_pt=0;
4931  return;
4932  }
4933 
4934  //Otherwise the required point is located in "this" element:
4935  geom_object_pt = this;
4936 }
4937 
4938 
4939 
4940 //=======================================================================
4941 /// Loop over all nodes in the element and update their positions
4942 /// using each node's (algebraic) update function
4943 //=======================================================================
4944  void FiniteElement::node_update()
4945  {
4946  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
4947  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++) {node_pt(n)->node_update();}
4948  }
4949 
4950 //======================================================================
4951 /// The purpose of this function is to identify all possible
4952 /// Data that can affect the fields interpolated by the FiniteElement.
4953 /// The information will typically be used in interaction problems in
4954 /// which the FiniteElement provides a forcing term for an
4955 /// ElementWithExternalElement. The Data must be provided as
4956 /// \c paired_load data containing (a) the pointer to a Data object
4957 /// and (b) the index of the value in that Data object.
4958 /// The generic implementation (should be overloaded in more specific
4959 /// applications) is to include all nodal and internal Data stored in
4960 /// the FiniteElement. Note that the geometric data,
4961 /// which includes the positions
4962 /// of SolidNodes, is treated separately by the function
4963 /// \c identify_geometric_data()
4964 //======================================================================
4965 void FiniteElement::identify_field_data_for_interactions(
4966  std::set<std::pair<Data*,unsigned> > &paired_field_data)
4967 {
4968  //Loop over all internal data
4969  const unsigned n_internal = this->ninternal_data();
4970  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_internal;n++)
4971  {
4972  //Cache the data pointer
4973  Data* const dat_pt = this->internal_data_pt(n);
4974  //Find the number of data values stored in the data object
4975  const unsigned n_value = dat_pt->nvalue();
4976  //Add the index of each data value and the pointer to the set
4977  //of pairs
4978  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_value;i++)
4979  {
4980  paired_field_data.insert(std::make_pair(dat_pt,i));
4981  }
4982  }
4983 
4984  //Loop over all the nodes
4985  const unsigned n_node = this->nnode();
4986  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
4987  {
4988  //Cache the node pointer
4989  Node* const nod_pt = this->node_pt(n);
4990  //Find the number of values stored at the node
4991  const unsigned n_value = nod_pt->nvalue();
4992  //Add the index of each data value and the pointer to the set
4993  //of pairs
4994  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_value;i++)
4995  {
4996  paired_field_data.insert(std::make_pair(nod_pt,i));
4997  }
4998  }
4999 }
5000 
5001 void FiniteElement::build_face_element(const int &face_index,
5002  FaceElement* face_element_pt)
5003 {
5004  //Set the nodal dimension
5005  face_element_pt->set_nodal_dimension(nodal_dimension());
5006 
5007  //Set the pointer to the orginal "bulk" element
5008  face_element_pt->bulk_element_pt()=this;
5009 
5010 #ifdef OOMPH_HAS_MPI
5011  // Pass on non-halo proc ID
5012  face_element_pt->set_halo(Non_halo_proc_ID);
5013 #endif
5014 
5015  // Set the face index
5016  face_element_pt->face_index() = face_index;
5017 
5018  // Get number of bulk nodes on a face of this element
5019  const unsigned nnode_face = nnode_on_face();
5020 
5021  // Set the function pointer for face coordinate to bulk coordinate
5022  // mapping
5023  face_element_pt->face_to_bulk_coordinate_fct_pt() =
5024  face_to_bulk_coordinate_fct_pt(face_index);
5025 
5026  // Set the function pointer for the derivative of the face coordinate to
5027  // bulk coordinate mapping
5028  face_element_pt->bulk_coordinate_derivatives_fct_pt() =
5029  bulk_coordinate_derivatives_fct_pt(face_index);
5030 
5031  // Resize storage for the number of values originally stored each of the
5032  // face element's nodes.
5033  face_element_pt->nbulk_value_resize(nnode_face);
5034 
5035  // Resize storage for the bulk node numbers corresponding to the face
5036  // element's nodes.
5037  face_element_pt->bulk_node_number_resize(nnode_face);
5038 
5039  // Copy bulk_node_numbers and nbulk_values
5040  for(unsigned i=0; i<nnode_face; i++)
5041  {
5042  // Find the corresponding bulk node's number
5043  unsigned bulk_number = get_bulk_node_number(face_index, i);
5044 
5045  // Assign the pointer and number into the face element
5046  face_element_pt->node_pt(i) = node_pt(bulk_number);
5047  face_element_pt->bulk_node_number(i) = bulk_number;
5048 
5049  // Set the number of values originally stored at this node
5050  face_element_pt->nbulk_value(i) = required_nvalue(bulk_number);
5051  }
5052 
5053  // Set the outer unit normal sign
5054  face_element_pt->normal_sign() = face_outer_unit_normal_sign(face_index);
5055 
5056 }
5057 
5058 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5059 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5060 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5061 
5062 // Initialise the static variable.
5063 // Do not ignore warning for discontinuous tangent vectors.
5064 bool FaceElement::Ignore_discontinuous_tangent_warning = false;
5065 
5066 
5067 //========================================================================
5068 /// Output boundary coordinate zeta
5069 //========================================================================
5070 void FaceElement::output_zeta(std::ostream &outfile, const unsigned& nplot)
5071 {
5072  //Vector of local coordinates
5073  unsigned n_dim=dim();
5074  Vector<double> s(n_dim);
5075 
5076  // Tecplot header info
5077  outfile << tecplot_zone_string(nplot);
5078 
5079  // Loop over plot points
5080  unsigned num_plot_points=nplot_points(nplot);
5081  for (unsigned iplot=0;iplot<num_plot_points;iplot++)
5082  {
5083  // Get local coordinates of plot point
5084  get_s_plot(iplot,nplot,s);
5085 
5086  // Spatial coordinates are one higher
5087  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim+1;i++)
5088  {
5089  outfile << interpolated_x(s,i) << " ";
5090  }
5091 
5092  // Boundary coordinate
5093  Vector<double> zeta(n_dim);
5094  interpolated_zeta(s,zeta);
5095  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim;i++)
5096  {
5097  outfile << zeta[i] << " ";
5098  }
5099  outfile << std::endl;
5100  }
5101 
5102  // Write tecplot footer (e.g. FE connectivity lists)
5103  write_tecplot_zone_footer(outfile,nplot);
5104 }
5105 
5106 
5107 //========================================================================
5108 /// \short Calculate the determinant of the
5109 /// Jacobian of the mapping between local and global
5110 /// coordinates at the position s. Overloaded from FiniteElement.
5111 //========================================================================
5112  double FaceElement::J_eulerian(const Vector<double> &s) const
5113  {
5114 
5115  //Find out the sptial dimension of the element
5116  unsigned n_dim_el = this->dim();
5117 
5118  // Bail out if we're in a point element -- not sure what
5119  // J_eulerian actually is, but this is harmless
5120  if (n_dim_el==0) return 1.0;
5121 
5122  //Find out how many nodes there are
5123  unsigned n_node = nnode();
5124 
5125  //Find out how many positional dofs there are
5126  unsigned n_position_type = this->nnodal_position_type();
5127 
5128  //Find out the dimension of the node
5129  unsigned n_dim = this->nodal_dimension();
5130 
5131  //Set up memory for the shape functions
5132  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
5133  DShape dpsids(n_node,n_position_type,n_dim_el);
5134 
5135  //Only need to call the local derivatives
5136  dshape_local(s,psi,dpsids);
5137 
5138  //Also calculate the surface Vectors (derivatives wrt local coordinates)
5139  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_A(n_dim_el,n_dim,0.0);
5140 
5141  //Calculate positions and derivatives
5142  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
5143  {
5144  //Loop over positional dofs
5145  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
5146  {
5147  //Loop over coordinates
5148  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim;i++)
5149  {
5150  //Loop over LOCAL derivative directions, to calculate the tangent(s)
5151  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim_el;j++)
5152  {
5153  interpolated_A(j,i) +=
5154  nodal_position_gen(l,bulk_position_type(k),i)*dpsids(l,k,j);
5155  }
5156  }
5157  }
5158  }
5159  //Now find the local deformed metric tensor from the tangent Vectors
5160  DenseMatrix<double> A(n_dim_el,n_dim_el,0.0);
5161  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_el;i++)
5162  {
5163  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim_el;j++)
5164  {
5165  //Take the dot product
5166  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_dim;k++)
5167  {
5168  A(i,j) += interpolated_A(i,k)*interpolated_A(j,k);
5169  }
5170  }
5171  }
5172 
5173  //Find the determinant of the metric tensor
5174  double Adet =0.0;
5175  switch(n_dim_el)
5176  {
5177  case 1:
5178  Adet = A(0,0);
5179  break;
5180  case 2:
5181  Adet = A(0,0)*A(1,1) - A(0,1)*A(1,0);
5182  break;
5183  default:
5184  throw
5185  OomphLibError("Wrong dimension in FaceElement",
5186  "FaceElement::J_eulerian()",
5187  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5188  }
5189 
5190  // Return
5191  return sqrt(Adet);
5192  }
5193 
5194 
5195 //========================================================================
5196 /// \short Compute the Jacobian of the mapping between the local and global
5197 /// coordinates at the ipt-th integration point. Overloaded from
5198 /// FiniteElement.
5199 //========================================================================
5200  double FaceElement::J_eulerian_at_knot(const unsigned &ipt)
5201  const
5202  {
5203  //Find the number of nodes
5204  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
5205 
5206  //Find the number of position types
5207  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
5208 
5209  //Find the dimension of the node and element
5210  const unsigned n_dim = nodal_dimension();
5211  const unsigned n_dim_el = dim();
5212 
5213  //Set up dummy memory for the shape functions
5214  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
5215  DShape dpsids(n_node,n_position_type,n_dim_el);
5216 
5217  //Get the shape functions and local derivatives at the knot
5218  //This call may use the stored versions, which is why this entire
5219  //function doesn't just call J_eulerian(s), after reading out s from
5220  //the knots.
5221  dshape_local_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsids);
5222 
5223  //Also calculate the surface Vectors (derivatives wrt local coordinates)
5224  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_A(n_dim_el,n_dim,0.0);
5225 
5226  //Calculate positions and derivatives
5227  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
5228  {
5229  //Loop over positional dofs
5230  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
5231  {
5232  //Loop over coordinates
5233  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim;i++)
5234  {
5235  //Loop over LOCAL derivative directions, to calculate the tangent(s)
5236  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim_el;j++)
5237  {
5238  interpolated_A(j,i) +=
5239  nodal_position_gen(l,bulk_position_type(k),i)*dpsids(l,k,j);
5240  }
5241  }
5242  }
5243  }
5244 
5245  //Now find the local deformed metric tensor from the tangent Vectors
5246  DenseMatrix<double> A(n_dim_el,n_dim_el,0.0);
5247  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_el;i++)
5248  {
5249  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim_el;j++)
5250  {
5251  //Take the dot product
5252  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_dim;k++)
5253  {
5254  A(i,j) += interpolated_A(i,k)*interpolated_A(j,k);
5255  }
5256  }
5257  }
5258 
5259  //Find the determinant of the metric tensor
5260  double Adet =0.0;
5261  switch(n_dim_el)
5262  {
5263  case 1:
5264  Adet = A(0,0);
5265  break;
5266  case 2:
5267  Adet = A(0,0)*A(1,1) - A(0,1)*A(1,0);
5268  break;
5269  default:
5270  throw
5271  OomphLibError("Wrong dimension in FaceElement",
5272  "FaceElement::J_eulerian_at_knot()",
5273  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5274  }
5275 
5276  // Return
5277  return sqrt(Adet);
5278  }
5279 
5280 //========================================================================
5281 /// \short Check that Jacobian of mapping between local and Eulerian
5282 /// coordinates at all integration points is positive.
5283 //========================================================================
5284  void FaceElement::check_J_eulerian_at_knots(bool& passed) const
5285  {
5286  // Let's be optimistic...
5287  passed=true;
5288 
5289  //Find the number of nodes
5290  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
5291 
5292  //Find the number of position types
5293  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
5294 
5295  //Find the dimension of the node and element
5296  const unsigned n_dim = nodal_dimension();
5297  const unsigned n_dim_el = dim();
5298 
5299  //Set up dummy memory for the shape functions
5300  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
5301  DShape dpsids(n_node,n_position_type,n_dim_el);
5302 
5303 
5304  unsigned nintpt=integral_pt()->nweight();
5305  for (unsigned ipt=0;ipt<nintpt;ipt++)
5306  {
5307 
5308  //Get the shape functions and local derivatives at the knot
5309  //This call may use the stored versions, which is why this entire
5310  //function doesn't just call J_eulerian(s), after reading out s from
5311  //the knots.
5312  dshape_local_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsids);
5313 
5314  //Also calculate the surface Vectors (derivatives wrt local coordinates)
5315  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_A(n_dim_el,n_dim,0.0);
5316 
5317  //Calculate positions and derivatives
5318  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
5319  {
5320  //Loop over positional dofs
5321  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
5322  {
5323  //Loop over coordinates
5324  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim;i++)
5325  {
5326  //Loop over LOCAL derivative directions, to calculate the tangent(s)
5327  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim_el;j++)
5328  {
5329  interpolated_A(j,i) +=
5330  nodal_position_gen(l,bulk_position_type(k),i)*dpsids(l,k,j);
5331  }
5332  }
5333  }
5334  }
5335 
5336  //Now find the local deformed metric tensor from the tangent Vectors
5337  DenseMatrix<double> A(n_dim_el,n_dim_el,0.0);
5338  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim_el;i++)
5339  {
5340  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_dim_el;j++)
5341  {
5342  //Take the dot product
5343  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_dim;k++)
5344  {
5345  A(i,j) += interpolated_A(i,k)*interpolated_A(j,k);
5346  }
5347  }
5348  }
5349 
5350  //Find the determinant of the metric tensor
5351  double Adet =0.0;
5352  switch(n_dim_el)
5353  {
5354  case 1:
5355  Adet = A(0,0);
5356  break;
5357  case 2:
5358  Adet = A(0,0)*A(1,1) - A(0,1)*A(1,0);
5359  break;
5360  default:
5361  throw
5362  OomphLibError("Wrong dimension in FaceElement",
5363  "FaceElement::J_eulerian_at_knot()",
5364  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5365  }
5366 
5367 
5368  // Are we dead yet?
5369  if (Adet<=0.0)
5370  {
5371  passed=false;
5372  return;
5373  }
5374  }
5375 
5376  }
5377 
5378 //=======================================================================
5379 /// \short Compute the tangent vector(s) and the outer unit normal
5380 /// vector at the specified local coordinate.
5381 /// In two spatial dimensions, a "tangent direction" is not required.
5382 /// In three spatial dimensions, a tangent direction is required
5383 /// (set via set_tangent_direction(...)), and we project the tanent direction
5384 /// on to the surface. The second tangent vector is taken to be the cross
5385 /// product of the projection and the unit normal.
5386 //=======================================================================
5387 void FaceElement::continuous_tangent_and_outer_unit_normal
5388 (const Vector<double> &s, Vector<Vector<double> > &tang_vec,
5389  Vector<double> &unit_normal) const
5390 {
5391  //Find the spatial dimension of the FaceElement
5392  const unsigned element_dim = dim();
5393 
5394  //Find the overall dimension of the problem
5395  //(assume that it's the same for all nodes)
5396  const unsigned spatial_dim = nodal_dimension();
5397 
5398 #ifdef PARANOID
5399  //Check the number of local coordinates passed
5400  if(s.size()!=element_dim)
5401  {
5402  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5403  error_stream
5404  << "Local coordinate s passed to outer_unit_normal() has dimension "
5405  << s.size() << std::endl
5406  << "but element dimension is " << element_dim << std::endl;
5407 
5408  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5409  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5410  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5411  }
5412 
5413  // Check that if the Tangent_direction_pt is set, then
5414  // it is the same length as the spatial dimension.
5415  if(Tangent_direction_pt != 0 && Tangent_direction_pt->size()!=spatial_dim)
5416  {
5417  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5418  error_stream
5419  << "Tangent direction vector has dimension "
5420  << Tangent_direction_pt->size() << std::endl
5421  << "but spatial dimension is " << spatial_dim << std::endl;
5422 
5423  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5424  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5425  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5426  }
5427 
5428  //Check the dimension of the normal vector
5429  if(unit_normal.size()!=spatial_dim)
5430  {
5431  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5432  error_stream
5433  << "Unit normal passed to outer_unit_normal() has dimension "
5434  << unit_normal.size() << std::endl
5435  << "but spatial dimension is " << spatial_dim << std::endl;
5436 
5437  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5438  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5439  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5440  }
5441 
5442 
5443  // The number of tangent vectors.
5444  unsigned ntangent_vec = tang_vec.size();
5445 
5446  // For the tangent vector,
5447  // if element_dim = 2, tang_vec is a 2D Vector of length 3.
5448  // if element_dim = 1, tang_vec is a 1D Vector of length 2.
5449  // if element_dim = 0, tang_vec is a 1D Vector of length 1.
5450  switch(element_dim)
5451  {
5452  //Point element, derived from a 1D element.
5453  case 0:
5454  {
5455  // Check that tang_vec is a 1D vector.
5456  if(ntangent_vec != 1)
5457  {
5458  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5459  error_stream
5460  << "This is a 0D FaceElement, we need one tangent vector.\n"
5461  << "You have given me " << tang_vec.size() << " vector(s).\n";
5462  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5463  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5464  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5465  }
5466  }
5467  break;
5468 
5469  //Line element, derived from a 2D element.
5470  case 1:
5471  {
5472  // Check that tang_vec is a 1D vector.
5473  if(ntangent_vec != 1)
5474  {
5475  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5476  error_stream
5477  << "This is a 1D FaceElement, we need one tangent vector.\n"
5478  << "You have given me " << tang_vec.size() << " vector(s).\n";
5479  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5480  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5481  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5482  }
5483  }
5484  break;
5485 
5486  //Plane element, derived from 3D element.
5487  case 2:
5488  {
5489  // Check that tang_vec is a 2D vector.
5490  if(ntangent_vec != 2)
5491  {
5492  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5493  error_stream
5494  << "This is a 2D FaceElement, we need two tangent vectors.\n"
5495  << "You have given me " << tang_vec.size() << " vector(s).\n";
5496  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5497  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5498  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5499  }
5500  }
5501  break;
5502  // There are no other elements!
5503  default:
5504 
5505  throw OomphLibError(
5506  "Cannot have a FaceElement with dimension higher than 2",
5507  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5508  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5509  break;
5510  }
5511 
5512  // Check the lengths of each sub vectors.
5513  for(unsigned vec_i = 0; vec_i < ntangent_vec; vec_i++)
5514  {
5515  if(tang_vec[vec_i].size() != spatial_dim)
5516  {
5517  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5518  error_stream
5519  << "This problem has " << spatial_dim << " spatial dimensions.\n"
5520  << "But the " << vec_i << " tangent vector has size "
5521  << tang_vec[vec_i].size() << std::endl;
5522  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5523  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5524  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5525  }
5526  }
5527 
5528 #endif
5529 
5530 
5531  //Now let's consider the different element dimensions
5532  switch(element_dim)
5533  {
5534 
5535  //Point element, derived from a 1D element.
5536  case 0:
5537  {
5538  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5539  error_stream
5540  << "It is unclear how to calculate a tangent and normal vectors for "
5541  << "a point element.\n";
5542  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5543  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5544  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5545  }
5546  break;
5547 
5548  //Line element, derived from a 2D element, in this case
5549  //the normal is a mess of cross products
5550  //We need an interior direction, so we must find the local
5551  //derivatives in the BULK element
5552  case 1:
5553  {
5554  //Find the number of nodes in the bulk element
5555  const unsigned n_node_bulk = Bulk_element_pt->nnode();
5556  //Find the number of position types in the bulk element
5557  const unsigned n_position_type_bulk =
5558  Bulk_element_pt->nnodal_position_type();
5559 
5560  //Construct the local coordinate in the bulk element
5561  Vector<double> s_bulk(2);
5562  //Get the local coordinates in the bulk element
5563  get_local_coordinate_in_bulk(s,s_bulk);
5564 
5565  //Allocate storage for the shape functions and their derivatives wrt
5566  //local coordinates
5567  Shape psi(n_node_bulk,n_position_type_bulk);
5568  DShape dpsids(n_node_bulk,n_position_type_bulk,2);
5569  //Get the value of the shape functions at the given local coordinate
5570  Bulk_element_pt->dshape_local(s_bulk,psi,dpsids);
5571 
5572  //Calculate all derivatives of the spatial coordinates
5573  //wrt local coordinates
5574  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_dxds(2,spatial_dim,0.0);
5575 
5576  //Loop over all parent nodes
5577  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node_bulk;l++)
5578  {
5579  //Loop over all position types in the bulk
5580  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type_bulk;k++)
5581  {
5582  //Loop over derivative direction
5583  for(unsigned j=0;j<2;j++)
5584  {
5585  //Loop over coordinate directions
5586  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
5587  {
5588  //Compute the spatial derivative
5589  interpolated_dxds(j,i) +=
5590  Bulk_element_pt->nodal_position_gen(l,k,i)*dpsids(l,k,j);
5591  }
5592  }
5593  }
5594  }
5595 
5596  //Initialise the tangent, interior tangent and normal vectors to zero
5597  //The idea is that even if the element is in a two-dimensional space,
5598  //the normal cannot be calculated without embedding the element in three
5599  //dimensions, in which case, the tangent and interior tangent will have
5600  //zero z-components.
5601  Vector<double> tangent(3,0.0), interior_tangent(3,0.0), normal(3,0.0);
5602 
5603  //We must get the relationship between the coordinate along the face
5604  //and the local coordinates in the bulk element
5605  //We must also find an interior direction
5606  DenseMatrix<double> dsbulk_dsface(2,1,0.0);
5607  unsigned interior_direction=0;
5608  get_ds_bulk_ds_face(s,dsbulk_dsface,interior_direction);
5609  //Load in the values for the tangents
5610  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
5611  {
5612  //Tangent to the face is the derivative wrt to the face coordinate
5613  //which is calculated using dsbulk_dsface and the chain rule
5614  tangent[i] = interpolated_dxds(0,i)*dsbulk_dsface(0,0)
5615  + interpolated_dxds(1,i)*dsbulk_dsface(1,0);
5616  //Interior tangent to the face is the derivative in the interior
5617  //direction
5618  interior_tangent[i] = interpolated_dxds(interior_direction,i);
5619  }
5620 
5621  //Now the (3D) normal to the element is the interior tangent
5622  //crossed with the tangent
5623  VectorHelpers::cross(interior_tangent,tangent,normal);
5624 
5625  //We find the line normal by crossing the element normal with the tangent
5626  Vector<double> full_normal(3);
5627  VectorHelpers::cross(normal,tangent,full_normal);
5628 
5629  //Copy the appropriate entries into the unit normal
5630  //Two or Three depending upon the spatial dimension of the system
5631  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++) {unit_normal[i] = full_normal[i];}
5632 
5633  //Finally normalise unit normal and multiply by the Normal_sign
5634  double length = VectorHelpers::magnitude(unit_normal);
5635  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
5636  {unit_normal[i] *= Normal_sign/length;}
5637 
5638  // Create the tangent vector
5639  tang_vec[0][0]=-unit_normal[1];
5640  tang_vec[0][1]=unit_normal[0];
5641  }
5642  break;
5643 
5644  //Plane element, derived from 3D element, in this case the normal
5645  //is just the cross product of the two surface tangents
5646  //We assume, therefore, that we have three spatial coordinates
5647  //and two surface coordinates
5648  //Then we need only to get the derivatives wrt the local coordinates
5649  //in this face element
5650  case 2:
5651  {
5652 #ifdef PARANOID
5653  //Check that we actually have three spatial dimensions
5654  if(spatial_dim != 3)
5655  {
5656  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5657  error_stream << "There are only " << spatial_dim
5658  << "coordinates at the nodes of this 2D FaceElement,\n"
5659  << "which must have come from a 3D Bulk element\n";
5660  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5661  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5662  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5663  }
5664 #endif
5665 
5666  //Find the number of nodes in the element
5667  const unsigned n_node = this->nnode();
5668  //Find the number of position types
5669  const unsigned n_position_type = this->nnodal_position_type();
5670 
5671  //Allocate storage for the shape functions and their derivatives wrt
5672  //local coordinates
5673  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
5674  DShape dpsids(n_node,n_position_type,2);
5675  //Get the value of the shape functions at the given local coordinate
5676  this->dshape_local(s,psi,dpsids);
5677 
5678  //Calculate all derivatives of the spatial coordinates
5679  //wrt local coordinates
5680  Vector<Vector<double> > interpolated_dxds(2,Vector<double>(3,0));
5681 
5682  //Loop over all nodes
5683  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
5684  {
5685  //Loop over all position types
5686  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
5687  {
5688  //Loop over derivative directions
5689  for(unsigned j=0;j<2;j++)
5690  {
5691  //Loop over coordinate directions
5692  for(unsigned i=0;i<3;i++)
5693  {
5694  //Compute the spatial derivative
5695  //Remember that we need to translate the position type
5696  //to its location in the bulk node
5697  interpolated_dxds[j][i] +=
5698  this->nodal_position_gen(l,bulk_position_type(k),i)*dpsids(l,k,j);
5699  }
5700  }
5701  }
5702  }
5703 
5704  // We now take the cross product of the two normal vectors
5705  VectorHelpers::cross(interpolated_dxds[0],interpolated_dxds[1],
5706  unit_normal);
5707 
5708  // Finally normalise unit normal
5709  double normal_length = VectorHelpers::magnitude(unit_normal);
5710 
5711  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
5712  {unit_normal[i] *= Normal_sign/normal_length;}
5713 
5714  // Next we create the continuous tangent vectors!
5715  if(Tangent_direction_pt != 0)
5716  // There is a general direction that the first tangent vector should follow.
5717  {
5718 
5719  // Project the Tangent direction vector onto the surface.
5720  // Project Tangent_direction_pt D onto the plane P defined by
5721  // T1 and T2:
5722  // proj_P(D) = proj_T1(D) + proj_T2(D), where D is Tangent_direction_pt,
5723  // recall that proj_u(v) = (u.v)/(u.u) * u
5724 
5725  // Get the direction vector. The vector is NOT copied! :)
5726  Vector<double> &direction_vector = *Tangent_direction_pt;
5727 
5728 #ifdef PARANOID
5729  // Check that the angle between the direction vector and the normal
5730  // is not less than 10 degrees
5731  if(VectorHelpers::angle(direction_vector,unit_normal) <
5732  (10.0 * MathematicalConstants::Pi/180.0))
5733  {
5734  std::ostringstream err_stream;
5735  err_stream << "The angle between the unit normal and the \n"
5736  << "direction vector is less than 10 degrees.";
5737  throw OomphLibError(err_stream.str(),
5738  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5739  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5740  }
5741 #endif
5742 
5743  // Calculate the two scalings, (u.v) / (u.u)
5744  double t1_scaling
5745  = VectorHelpers::dot(interpolated_dxds[0],direction_vector) /
5746  VectorHelpers::dot(interpolated_dxds[0],interpolated_dxds[0]);
5747 
5748  double t2_scaling
5749  = VectorHelpers::dot(interpolated_dxds[1],direction_vector) /
5750  VectorHelpers::dot(interpolated_dxds[1],interpolated_dxds[1]);
5751 
5752  // Finish off the projection.
5753  tang_vec[0][0] = t1_scaling*interpolated_dxds[0][0]
5754  + t2_scaling*interpolated_dxds[1][0];
5755  tang_vec[0][1] = t1_scaling*interpolated_dxds[0][1]
5756  + t2_scaling*interpolated_dxds[1][1];
5757  tang_vec[0][2] = t1_scaling*interpolated_dxds[0][2]
5758  + t2_scaling*interpolated_dxds[1][2];
5759 
5760  // The second tangent vector is the cross product of
5761  // tang_vec[0] and the normal vector N.
5762  VectorHelpers::cross(tang_vec[0],unit_normal,tang_vec[1]);
5763 
5764  // Normalise the tangent vectors
5765  for(unsigned vec_i=0; vec_i<2; vec_i++)
5766  {
5767  // Get the length...
5768  double tang_length = VectorHelpers::magnitude(tang_vec[vec_i]);
5769 
5770  for(unsigned dim_i=0;dim_i<spatial_dim;dim_i++)
5771  {tang_vec[vec_i][dim_i] /= tang_length;}
5772  }
5773  }
5774  else
5775  // A direction for the first tangent vector is not supplied, we do our best
5776  // to keep it continuous. But if the normal vector is aligned with the
5777  // z axis, then the tangent vector may "flip", even within elements.
5778  // This is because we check this by comparing doubles.
5779  // The code is copied from impose_parallel_outflow_element.h,
5780  // NO modification is done except for a few variable name changes.
5781  {
5782  double a,b,c;
5783  a=unit_normal[0];
5784  b=unit_normal[1];
5785  c=unit_normal[2];
5786 
5787  if(a!=0.0 || b!=0.0)
5788  {
5789  double a_sq=a*a;
5790  double b_sq=b*b;
5791  double c_sq=c*c;
5792 
5793  tang_vec[0][0]=-b/sqrt(a_sq+b_sq);
5794  tang_vec[0][1]= a/sqrt(a_sq+b_sq);
5795  tang_vec[0][2]=0;
5796 
5797  double z=(a_sq +b_sq)
5798  /sqrt(a_sq*c_sq +b_sq*c_sq +(a_sq +b_sq)*(a_sq +b_sq)) ;
5799 
5800  tang_vec[1][0]=-(a*c*z)/(a_sq + b_sq) ;
5801  tang_vec[1][1]= -(b*c*z)/(a_sq + b_sq);
5802  tang_vec[1][2]= z;
5803  // NB : we didn't use the fact that N is normalized,
5804  // that's why we have these unsimplified formulas
5805  }
5806  else if (c!=0.0)
5807  {
5808  if(!FaceElement::Ignore_discontinuous_tangent_warning)
5809  {
5810  std::ostringstream warn_stream;
5811  warn_stream << "I have detected that your normal vector is [0,0,1].\n"
5812  << "Since this function compares against 0.0, you may\n"
5813  << "get discontinuous tangent vectors.";
5814  OomphLibWarning(warn_stream.str(),
5815  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5816  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5817  }
5818 
5819  tang_vec[0][0]= 1.0;
5820  tang_vec[0][1]= 0.0;
5821  tang_vec[0][2]= 0.0;
5822 
5823  tang_vec[1][0]=0.0;
5824  tang_vec[1][1]= 1.0;
5825  tang_vec[1][2]= 0.0;
5826  }
5827  else
5828  {
5829  throw
5830  OomphLibError("You have a zero normal vector!! ",
5831  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5832  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5833  }
5834  }
5835 
5836  }
5837  break;
5838 
5839  default:
5840 
5841  throw OomphLibError(
5842  "Cannot have a FaceElement with dimension higher than 2",
5843  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5844  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5845  break;
5846  }
5847 
5848 }
5849 
5850 //=======================================================================
5851 /// \short Compute the tangent vector(s) and the outer unit normal
5852 /// vector at the ipt-th integration point. This is a wrapper around
5853 /// continuous_tangent_and_outer_unit_normal(...) with the integration points
5854 /// converted into local coordinates.
5855 //=======================================================================
5856 void FaceElement::continuous_tangent_and_outer_unit_normal
5857 (const unsigned &ipt, Vector<Vector<double> > &tang_vec,
5858  Vector<double> &unit_normal) const
5859 {
5860  //Find the dimension of the element
5861  const unsigned element_dim = dim();
5862  //Find the local coordinates of the ipt-th integration point
5863  Vector<double> s(element_dim);
5864  for(unsigned i=0;i<element_dim;i++) {s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);}
5865  //Call the outer unit normal function
5866  continuous_tangent_and_outer_unit_normal(s, tang_vec,unit_normal);
5867 }
5868 
5869 //=======================================================================
5870 /// Compute the outer unit normal at the specified local coordinate
5871 //=======================================================================
5872  void FaceElement::outer_unit_normal(const Vector<double> &s,
5873  Vector<double> &unit_normal) const
5874  {
5875  //Find the spatial dimension of the FaceElement
5876  const unsigned element_dim = dim();
5877 
5878  //Find the overall dimension of the problem
5879  //(assume that it's the same for all nodes)
5880  const unsigned spatial_dim = nodal_dimension();
5881 
5882 #ifdef PARANOID
5883  //Check the number of local coordinates passed
5884  if(s.size()!=element_dim)
5885  {
5886  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5887  error_stream
5888  << "Local coordinate s passed to outer_unit_normal() has dimension "
5889  << s.size() << std::endl
5890  << "but element dimension is " << element_dim << std::endl;
5891 
5892  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5893  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5894  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5895  }
5896 
5897  //Check the dimension of the normal vector
5898  if(unit_normal.size()!=spatial_dim)
5899  {
5900  std::ostringstream error_stream;
5901  error_stream
5902  << "Unit normal passed to outer_unit_normal() has dimension "
5903  << unit_normal.size() << std::endl
5904  << "but spatial dimension is " << spatial_dim << std::endl;
5905 
5906  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
5907  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
5908  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
5909  }
5910 #endif
5911 
5912 /* //The spatial dimension of the bulk element will be element_dim+1
5913  const unsigned bulk_dim = element_dim + 1;
5914 
5915  //Find the number of nodes in the bulk element
5916  const unsigned n_node_bulk = Bulk_element_pt->nnode();
5917  //Find the number of position types in the bulk element
5918  const unsigned n_position_type_bulk =
5919  Bulk_element_pt->nnodal_position_type();
5920 
5921  //Construct the local coordinate in the bulk element
5922  Vector<double> s_bulk(bulk_dim);
5923  //Set the value of the bulk coordinate that is fixed on the face
5924  //s_bulk[s_fixed_index()] = s_fixed_value();
5925 
5926  //Set the other bulk coordinates
5927  //for(unsigned i=0;i<element_dim;i++) {s_bulk[bulk_s_index(i)] = s[i];}
5928 
5929  get_local_coordinate_in_bulk(s,s_bulk);
5930 
5931  //Allocate storage for the shape functions and their derivatives wrt
5932  //local coordinates
5933  Shape psi(n_node_bulk,n_position_type_bulk);
5934  DShape dpsids(n_node_bulk,n_position_type_bulk,bulk_dim);
5935  //Get the value of the shape functions at the given local coordinate
5936  Bulk_element_pt->dshape_local(s_bulk,psi,dpsids);
5937 
5938  //Calculate all derivatives of the spatial coordinates wrt local coordinates
5939  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_dxds(bulk_dim,spatial_dim);
5940  //Initialise to zero
5941  for(unsigned j=0;j<bulk_dim;j++)
5942  {for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++) {interpolated_dxds(j,i) = 0.0;}}
5943 
5944  //Loop over all parent nodes
5945  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node_bulk;l++)
5946  {
5947  //Loop over all position types in the bulk
5948  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type_bulk;k++)
5949  {
5950  //Loop over derivative direction
5951  for(unsigned j=0;j<bulk_dim;j++)
5952  {
5953  //Loop over coordinate directions
5954  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
5955  {
5956  //Compute the spatial derivative
5957  interpolated_dxds(j,i) +=
5958  Bulk_element_pt->nodal_position_gen(l,k,i)*dpsids(l,k,j);
5959  }
5960  }
5961  }
5962  }*/
5963 
5964  //Now let's consider the different element dimensions
5965  switch(element_dim)
5966  {
5967  //Point element, derived from a 1D element, in this case
5968  //the normal is merely the tangent to the bulk element
5969  //and there is only one free coordinate in the bulk element
5970  //Hence we will need to calculate the derivatives wrt the
5971  //local coordinates in the BULK element.
5972  case 0:
5973  {
5974  //Find the number of nodes in the bulk element
5975  const unsigned n_node_bulk = Bulk_element_pt->nnode();
5976  //Find the number of position types in the bulk element
5977  const unsigned n_position_type_bulk =
5978  Bulk_element_pt->nnodal_position_type();
5979 
5980  //Construct the local coordinate in the bulk element
5981  Vector<double> s_bulk(1);
5982 
5983  //Get the local coordinates in the bulk element
5984  get_local_coordinate_in_bulk(s,s_bulk);
5985 
5986  //Allocate storage for the shape functions and their derivatives wrt
5987  //local coordinates
5988  Shape psi(n_node_bulk,n_position_type_bulk);
5989  DShape dpsids(n_node_bulk,n_position_type_bulk,1);
5990  //Get the value of the shape functions at the given local coordinate
5991  Bulk_element_pt->dshape_local(s_bulk,psi,dpsids);
5992 
5993  //Calculate all derivatives of the spatial coordinates wrt
5994  //local coordinates
5995  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_dxds(1,spatial_dim,0.0);
5996 
5997  //Loop over all parent nodes
5998  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node_bulk;l++)
5999  {
6000  //Loop over all position types in the bulk
6001  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type_bulk;k++)
6002  {
6003  //Loop over coordinate directions
6004  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
6005  {
6006  //Compute the spatial derivative
6007  interpolated_dxds(0,i) +=
6008  Bulk_element_pt->nodal_position_gen(l,k,i)*dpsids(l,k,0);
6009  }
6010  }
6011  }
6012 
6013  //Now the unit normal is just the derivative of the position vector
6014  //with respect to the single coordinate
6015  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
6016  {unit_normal[i] = interpolated_dxds(0,i);}
6017  }
6018  break;
6019 
6020  //Line element, derived from a 2D element, in this case
6021  //the normal is a mess of cross products
6022  //We need an interior direction, so we must find the local
6023  //derivatives in the BULK element
6024  case 1:
6025  {
6026  //Find the number of nodes in the bulk element
6027  const unsigned n_node_bulk = Bulk_element_pt->nnode();
6028  //Find the number of position types in the bulk element
6029  const unsigned n_position_type_bulk =
6030  Bulk_element_pt->nnodal_position_type();
6031 
6032  //Construct the local coordinate in the bulk element
6033  Vector<double> s_bulk(2);
6034  //Get the local coordinates in the bulk element
6035  get_local_coordinate_in_bulk(s,s_bulk);
6036 
6037  //Allocate storage for the shape functions and their derivatives wrt
6038  //local coordinates
6039  Shape psi(n_node_bulk,n_position_type_bulk);
6040  DShape dpsids(n_node_bulk,n_position_type_bulk,2);
6041  //Get the value of the shape functions at the given local coordinate
6042  Bulk_element_pt->dshape_local(s_bulk,psi,dpsids);
6043 
6044  //Calculate all derivatives of the spatial coordinates
6045  //wrt local coordinates
6046  DenseMatrix<double> interpolated_dxds(2,spatial_dim,0.0);
6047 
6048  //Loop over all parent nodes
6049  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node_bulk;l++)
6050  {
6051  //Loop over all position types in the bulk
6052  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type_bulk;k++)
6053  {
6054  //Loop over derivative direction
6055  for(unsigned j=0;j<2;j++)
6056  {
6057  //Loop over coordinate directions
6058  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
6059  {
6060  //Compute the spatial derivative
6061  interpolated_dxds(j,i) +=
6062  Bulk_element_pt->nodal_position_gen(l,k,i)*dpsids(l,k,j);
6063  }
6064  }
6065  }
6066  }
6067 
6068  //Initialise the tangent, interior tangent and normal vectors to zero
6069  //The idea is that even if the element is in a two-dimensional space,
6070  //the normal cannot be calculated without embedding the element in three
6071  //dimensions, in which case, the tangent and interior tangent will have
6072  //zero z-components.
6073  Vector<double> tangent(3,0.0), interior_tangent(3,0.0), normal(3,0.0);
6074 
6075  //We must get the relationship between the coordinate along the face
6076  //and the local coordinates in the bulk element
6077  //We must also find an interior direction
6078  DenseMatrix<double> dsbulk_dsface(2,1,0.0);
6079  unsigned interior_direction=0;
6080  get_ds_bulk_ds_face(s,dsbulk_dsface,interior_direction);
6081  //Load in the values for the tangents
6082  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
6083  {
6084  //Tangent to the face is the derivative wrt to the face coordinate
6085  //which is calculated using dsbulk_dsface and the chain rule
6086  tangent[i] = interpolated_dxds(0,i)*dsbulk_dsface(0,0)
6087  + interpolated_dxds(1,i)*dsbulk_dsface(1,0);
6088  //Interior tangent to the face is the derivative in the interior
6089  //direction
6090  interior_tangent[i] = interpolated_dxds(interior_direction,i);
6091  }
6092 
6093  //Now the (3D) normal to the element is the interior tangent
6094  //crossed with the tangent
6095  VectorHelpers::cross(interior_tangent,tangent,normal);
6096 
6097  //We find the line normal by crossing the element normal with the tangent
6098  Vector<double> full_normal(3);
6099  VectorHelpers::cross(normal,tangent,full_normal);
6100 
6101  //Copy the appropriate entries into the unit normal
6102  //Two or Three depending upon the spatial dimension of the system
6103  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++) {unit_normal[i] = full_normal[i];}
6104  }
6105  break;
6106 
6107  //Plane element, derived from 3D element, in this case the normal
6108  //is just the cross product of the two surface tangents
6109  //We assume, therefore, that we have three spatial coordinates
6110  //and two surface coordinates
6111  //Then we need only to get the derivatives wrt the local coordinates
6112  //in this face element
6113  case 2:
6114  {
6115 #ifdef PARANOID
6116  //Check that we actually have three spatial dimensions
6117  if(spatial_dim != 3)
6118  {
6119  std::ostringstream error_stream;
6120  error_stream << "There are only " << spatial_dim
6121  << "coordinates at the nodes of this 2D FaceElement,\n"
6122  << "which must have come from a 3D Bulk element\n";
6123  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
6124  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
6125  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
6126  }
6127 #endif
6128 
6129  //Find the number of nodes in the element
6130  const unsigned n_node = this->nnode();
6131  //Find the number of position types
6132  const unsigned n_position_type = this->nnodal_position_type();
6133 
6134  //Allocate storage for the shape functions and their derivatives wrt
6135  //local coordinates
6136  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
6137  DShape dpsids(n_node,n_position_type,2);
6138  //Get the value of the shape functions at the given local coordinate
6139  this->dshape_local(s,psi,dpsids);
6140 
6141  //Calculate all derivatives of the spatial coordinates
6142  //wrt local coordinates
6143  Vector<Vector<double> > interpolated_dxds(2,Vector<double>(3,0));
6144 
6145  //Loop over all nodes
6146  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
6147  {
6148  //Loop over all position types
6149  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
6150  {
6151  //Loop over derivative directions
6152  for(unsigned j=0;j<2;j++)
6153  {
6154  //Loop over coordinate directions
6155  for(unsigned i=0;i<3;i++)
6156  {
6157  //Compute the spatial derivative
6158  //Remember that we need to translate the position type
6159  //to its location in the bulk node
6160  interpolated_dxds[j][i] +=
6161  this->nodal_position_gen(l,bulk_position_type(k),i)*dpsids(l,k,j);
6162  }
6163  }
6164  }
6165  }
6166 
6167  //We now take the cross product of the two normal vectors
6168  VectorHelpers::cross(interpolated_dxds[0],interpolated_dxds[1],
6169  unit_normal);
6170  }
6171  break;
6172 
6173  default:
6174 
6175  throw OomphLibError(
6176  "Cannot have a FaceElement with dimension higher than 2",
6177  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
6178  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
6179  break;
6180  }
6181 
6182  //Finally normalise unit normal
6183  double length = VectorHelpers::magnitude(unit_normal);
6184  for(unsigned i=0;i<spatial_dim;i++)
6185  {unit_normal[i] *= Normal_sign/length;}
6186  }
6187 
6188 //=======================================================================
6189 /// Compute the outer unit normal at the ipt-th integration point
6190 //=======================================================================
6191  void FaceElement::outer_unit_normal(const unsigned &ipt,
6192  Vector<double> &unit_normal) const
6193  {
6194  //Find the dimension of the element
6195  const unsigned element_dim = dim();
6196  //Find the local coordiantes of the ipt-th integration point
6197  Vector<double> s(element_dim);
6198  for(unsigned i=0;i<element_dim;i++) {s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);}
6199  //Call the outer unit normal function
6200  outer_unit_normal(s,unit_normal);
6201  }
6202 
6203 
6204 
6205 //=======================================================================
6206 /// Return vector of local coordinates in bulk element,
6207 /// given the local coordinates in this FaceElement
6208 //=======================================================================
6209 Vector<double> FaceElement::local_coordinate_in_bulk(
6210  const Vector<double>& s) const
6211  {
6212  //Find the dimension of the bulk element
6213  unsigned dim_bulk = Bulk_element_pt->dim();
6214 
6215  // Vector of local coordinates in bulk element
6216  Vector<double> s_bulk(dim_bulk);
6217 
6218  //Use the function pointer if it is set
6219  if(Face_to_bulk_coordinate_fct_pt)
6220  {
6221  //Call the translation function
6222  (*Face_to_bulk_coordinate_fct_pt)(s,s_bulk);
6223  }
6224  else
6225  {
6226  throw OomphLibError("Face_to_bulk_coordinate mapping not set",
6227  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
6228  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
6229  }
6230 
6231  // Return it
6232  return s_bulk;
6233  }
6234 
6235 
6236 
6237 //=======================================================================
6238 /// Calculate the vector of local coordinates in bulk element,
6239 /// given the local coordinates in this FaceElement
6240 //=======================================================================
6241 void FaceElement::get_local_coordinate_in_bulk(
6242  const Vector<double>& s, Vector<double> &s_bulk) const
6243  {
6244  //Use the function pointer if it is set
6245  if(Face_to_bulk_coordinate_fct_pt)
6246  {
6247  //Call the translation function
6248  (*Face_to_bulk_coordinate_fct_pt)(s,s_bulk);
6249  }
6250  //Otherwise use the existing (not general) interface
6251  else
6252  {
6253  throw OomphLibError("Face_to_bulk_coordinate mapping not set",
6254  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
6255  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
6256  }
6257  }
6258 
6259 
6260 //=======================================================================
6261 /// Calculate the derivatives of the local coordinates in the
6262 /// bulk element with respect to the local coordinates in this FaceElement.
6263 /// In addition return the index of a bulk local coordinate that varies away
6264 /// from the face.
6265 //=======================================================================
6266  void FaceElement::get_ds_bulk_ds_face(const Vector<double> &s,
6267  DenseMatrix<double> &dsbulk_dsface,
6268  unsigned &interior_direction) const
6269  {
6270  //Use the function pointer if it is set
6271  if(Bulk_coordinate_derivatives_fct_pt)
6272  {
6273  //Call the translation function
6274  (*Bulk_coordinate_derivatives_fct_pt)(s,dsbulk_dsface,interior_direction);
6275  }
6276  //Otherwise throw an error
6277  else
6278  {
6279  throw OomphLibError(
6280  "No function for derivatives of bulk coords wrt face coords set",
6281  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
6282  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
6283  }
6284  }
6285 
6286 
6287 
6288 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
6289 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
6290 // Functions for elastic general elements
6291 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
6292 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
6293 
6294 
6295 
6296 //==================================================================
6297 /// Calculate the L2 norm of the displacement u=R-r to overload the
6298 /// compute_norm function in the GeneralisedElement base class
6299 //==================================================================
6300  void SolidFiniteElement::compute_norm(double& el_norm)
6301  {
6302  // Initialise el_norm to 0.0
6303  el_norm=0.0;
6304 
6305  unsigned n_dim=dim();
6306 
6307  // Vector of local coordinates
6308  Vector<double> s(n_dim);
6309 
6310  // Displacement vector, Lagrangian coordinate vector and Eulerian
6311  // coordinate vector respectively
6312  Vector<double> disp(n_dim,0.0);
6313  Vector<double> xi(n_dim,0.0);
6314  Vector<double> x(n_dim,0.0);
6315 
6316  // Find out how many nodes there are in the element
6317  unsigned n_node=this->nnode();
6318 
6319  // Construct a shape function
6320  Shape psi(n_node);
6321 
6322  // Get the number of integration points
6323  unsigned n_intpt=this->integral_pt()->nweight();
6324 
6325  // Loop over the integration points
6326  for(unsigned ipt=0;ipt<n_intpt;ipt++)
6327  {
6328  // Assign values of s
6329  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_dim;i++)
6330  {
6331  s[i]=this->integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);
6332  }
6333 
6334  // Get the integral weight
6335  double w=this->integral_pt()->weight(ipt);
6336 
6337  // Get jacobian of mapping
6338  double J=this->J_eulerian(s);
6339 
6340  // Premultiply the weights and the Jacobian
6341  double W=w*J;
6342 
6343  // Get the Lagrangian and Eulerian coordinate at this point, respectively
6344  this->interpolated_xi(s,xi);
6345  this->interpolated_x(s,x);
6346 
6347  // Calculate the displacement vector, u=R-r=x-xi
6348  for (unsigned idim=0;idim<n_dim;idim++)
6349  {
6350  disp[idim]=x[idim]-xi[idim];
6351  }
6352 
6353  // Add to norm
6354  for (unsigned ii=0;ii<n_dim;ii++)
6355  {
6356  el_norm+=(disp[ii]*disp[ii])*W;
6357  }
6358  }
6359  } // End of compute_norm(...)
6360 
6361 
6362 
6363 //=========================================================================
6364 /// \short Function to describe the local dofs of the element. The ostream
6365 /// specifies the output stream to which the description
6366 /// is written; the string stores the currently
6367 /// assembled output that is ultimately written to the
6368 /// output stream by Data::describe_dofs(...); it is typically
6369 /// built up incrementally as we descend through the
6370 /// call hierarchy of this function when called from
6371 /// Problem::describe_dofs(...)
6372 //=========================================================================
6373 void SolidFiniteElement::
6374 describe_local_dofs(std::ostream& out,const std::string& current_string) const
6375 {
6376  // Call the standard finite element description.
6377  FiniteElement::describe_local_dofs(out,current_string);
6378  describe_solid_local_dofs(out,current_string);
6379 }
6380 
6381 
6382 //=========================================================================
6383 /// Internal function that is used to assemble the jacobian of the mapping
6384 /// from local coordinates (s) to the lagrangian coordinates (xi), given the
6385 /// derivatives of the shape functions.
6386 //=========================================================================
6387  void SolidFiniteElement::
6388  assemble_local_to_lagrangian_jacobian(const DShape &dpsids,
6389  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian) const
6390  {
6391  //Find the the dimension of the element
6392  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
6393  //Find the number of shape functions and shape functions types
6394  //We shall ASSUME (ENFORCE) that Lagrangian coordinates must
6395  //be interpolated through the nodes
6396  const unsigned n_shape = nnode();
6397  const unsigned n_shape_type = nnodal_lagrangian_type();
6398 
6399 #ifdef PARANOID
6400  //Check for dimensional compatibility
6401  if(el_dim != Lagrangian_dimension)
6402  {
6403  std::ostringstream error_message;
6404  error_message << "Dimension mismatch" << std::endl;
6405  error_message << "The elemental dimension: " << el_dim
6406  << " must equal the nodal Lagrangian dimension: "
6407  << Lagrangian_dimension
6408  << " for the jacobian of the mapping to be well-defined"
6409  << std::endl;
6410  throw OomphLibError(error_message.str(),
6411  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
6412  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
6413  }
6414 #endif
6415 
6416  //Loop over the rows of the jacobian
6417  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++)
6418  {
6419  //Loop over the columns of the jacobian
6420  for(unsigned j=0;j<el_dim;j++)
6421  {
6422  //Zero the entry
6423  jacobian(i,j) = 0.0;
6424  //Loop over the shape functions
6425  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_shape;l++)
6426  {
6427  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_shape_type;k++)
6428  {
6429  //Jacobian is dx_j/ds_i, which is represented by the sum
6430  //over the dpsi/ds_i of the nodal points X j
6431  //Call the Non-hanging version of positions
6432  //This is overloaded in refineable elements
6433  jacobian(i,j) += raw_lagrangian_position_gen(l,k,j)*dpsids(l,k,i);
6434  }
6435  }
6436  }
6437  }
6438  }
6439 
6440 //=========================================================================
6441 /// Internal function that is used to assemble the jacobian of second
6442 /// derivatives of the the mapping from local coordinates (s) to the
6443 /// lagrangian coordinates (xi), given the second derivatives of the
6444 /// shape functions.
6445 //=========================================================================
6446  void SolidFiniteElement::
6447  assemble_local_to_lagrangian_jacobian2(const DShape &d2psids,
6448  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian2) const
6449  {
6450  //Find the the dimension of the element
6451  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
6452  //Find the number of shape functions and shape functions types
6453  //We ENFORCE that Lagrangian coordinates must be interpolated through
6454  //the nodes
6455  const unsigned n_shape = nnode();
6456  const unsigned n_shape_type = nnodal_lagrangian_type();
6457  //Find the number of second derivatives
6458  const unsigned n_row = N2deriv[el_dim];
6459 
6460  //Assemble the "jacobian" (d^2 x_j/ds_i^2) for second derivatives of
6461  //shape functions
6462  //Loop over the rows (number of second derivatives)
6463  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_row;i++)
6464  {
6465  //Loop over the columns (element dimension
6466  for(unsigned j=0;j<el_dim;j++)
6467  {
6468  //Zero the entry
6469  jacobian2(i,j) = 0.0;
6470  //Loop over the shape functions
6471  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_shape;l++)
6472  {
6473  //Loop over the shape function types
6474  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_shape_type;k++)
6475  {
6476  //Add the terms to the jacobian entry
6477  //Call the Non-hanging version of positions
6478  //This is overloaded in refineable elements
6479  jacobian2(i,j) += raw_lagrangian_position_gen(l,k,j)*d2psids(l,k,i);
6480  }
6481  }
6482  }
6483  }
6484  }
6485 
6486 //============================================================================
6487 /// \short Destructor for SolidFiniteElement:
6488 //============================================================================
6489  SolidFiniteElement:: ~SolidFiniteElement()
6490  {
6491  //Delete the storage allocated for the positional local equations
6492  delete[] Position_local_eqn;
6493  }
6494 
6495 
6496 //==========================================================================
6497 /// Calculate the mapping from local to lagrangian coordinates
6498 /// assuming that the coordinates are aligned in the direction of the local
6499 /// coordinates, i.e. there are no cross terms and the jacobian is diagonal.
6500 /// The local derivatives are passed as dpsids and the jacobian and
6501 /// inverse jacobian are returned.
6502 //==========================================================================
6503  double SolidFiniteElement::
6504  local_to_lagrangian_mapping_diagonal(const DShape &dpsids,
6505  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
6506  DenseMatrix<double> &inverse_jacobian)
6507  const
6508  {
6509  //Find the dimension of the element
6510  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
6511  //Find the number of shape functions and shape functions types
6512  //We shall ASSUME (ENFORCE) that Lagrangian coordinates must
6513  //be interpolated through the nodes
6514  const unsigned n_shape = nnode();
6515  const unsigned n_shape_type = nnodal_lagrangian_type();
6516 
6517  //In this case we assume that there are no cross terms, that is
6518  //global coordinate 0 is always in the direction of local coordinate 0
6519 
6520  //Loop over the coordinates
6521  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++)
6522  {
6523  //Zero the jacobian and inverse jacobian entries
6524  for(unsigned j=0;j<el_dim;j++)
6525  {jacobian(i,j) = 0.0; inverse_jacobian(i,j) = 0.0;}
6526 
6527  //Loop over the shape functions
6528  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_shape;l++)
6529  {
6530  //Loop over the types of dof
6531  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_shape_type;k++)
6532  {
6533  //Derivatives are always dx_{i}/ds_{i}
6534  jacobian(i,i) += raw_lagrangian_position_gen(l,k,i)*dpsids(l,k,i);
6535  }
6536  }
6537  }
6538 
6539  //Now calculate the determinant of the matrix
6540  double det = 1.0;
6541  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++) {det *= jacobian(i,i);}
6542
