6543 //Report if Matrix is singular, or negative
6544 #ifdef PARANOID
6545  check_jacobian(det);
6546 #endif
6547 
6548  //Calculate the inverse mapping (trivial in this case)
6549  for(unsigned i=0;i<el_dim;i++)
6550  {inverse_jacobian(i,i) = 1.0/jacobian(i,i);}
6551 
6552  //Return the value of the Jacobian
6553  return(det);
6554  }
6555 
6556 //========================================================================
6557 /// Calculate shape functions and derivatives w.r.t. Lagrangian
6558 /// coordinates at local coordinate s. Returns the Jacobian of the mapping
6559 /// from Lagrangian to local coordinates.
6560 /// General case, may be overloaded
6561 //========================================================================
6562  double SolidFiniteElement::
6563  dshape_lagrangian(const Vector<double> &s, Shape &psi, DShape &dpsi) const
6564  {
6565  //Find the element dimension
6566  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
6567 
6568  //Get the values of the shape function and local derivatives
6569  //Temporarily stored in dpsi
6570  dshape_local(s,psi,dpsi);
6571 
6572  //Allocate memory for the inverse jacobian
6573  DenseMatrix<double> inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
6574  //Now calculate the inverse jacobian
6575  const double det = local_to_lagrangian_mapping(dpsi,inverse_jacobian);
6576 
6577  //Now set the values of the derivatives to be dpsidxi
6578  transform_derivatives(inverse_jacobian,dpsi);
6579  //Return the determinant of the jacobian
6580  return det;
6581  }
6582 
6583 //=========================================================================
6584 /// Compute the geometric shape functions and also first
6585 /// derivatives w.r.t. Lagrangian coordinates at integration point ipt.
6586 /// Most general form of function, but may be over-loaded if desired
6587 //========================================================================
6588  double SolidFiniteElement::dshape_lagrangian_at_knot(const unsigned &ipt,
6589  Shape &psi,
6590  DShape &dpsi) const
6591  {
6592  //Find the element dimension
6593  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
6594 
6595  //Shape function for the local derivatives
6596  //Again we ASSUME (insist) that the lagrangian coordinates
6597  //are interpolated through the nodes
6598  //Get the values of the shape function and local derivatives
6599  dshape_local_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsi);
6600 
6601  //Allocate memory for the inverse jacobian
6602  DenseMatrix<double> inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
6603  //Now calculate the inverse jacobian
6604  const double det = local_to_lagrangian_mapping(dpsi,inverse_jacobian);
6605 
6606  //Now set the values of the derivatives
6607  transform_derivatives(inverse_jacobian,dpsi);
6608  //Return the determinant of the jacobian
6609  return det;
6610  }
6611 
6612 //========================================================================
6613 /// \short Compute the geometric shape functions and also first
6614 /// and second derivatives w.r.t. Lagrangian coordinates at
6615 /// local coordinate s;
6616 /// Returns Jacobian of mapping from Lagrangian to local coordinates.
6617 /// Numbering:
6618 /// \b 1D:
6619 /// d2pidxi(i,0) = \f$ d^2 \psi_j / d \xi^2 \f$
6620 /// \b 2D:
6621 /// d2psidxi(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_0^2 \f$
6622 /// d2psidxi(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_1^2 \f$
6623 /// d2psidxi(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_0 \partial \xi_1 \f$
6624 /// \b 3D:
6625 /// d2psidxi(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_0^2 \f$
6626 /// d2psidxi(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_1^2 \f$
6627 /// d2psidxi(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_2^2 \f$
6628 /// d2psidxi(i,3) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j/\partial \xi_0 \partial \xi_1 \f$
6629 /// d2psidxi(i,4) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j/\partial \xi_0 \partial \xi_2 \f$
6630 /// d2psidxi(i,5) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j/\partial \xi_1 \partial \xi_2 \f$
6631 //========================================================================
6632  double SolidFiniteElement::
6633  d2shape_lagrangian(const Vector<double> &s, Shape &psi,
6634  DShape &dpsi, DShape &d2psi) const
6635  {
6636  //Find the element dimension
6637  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
6638  //Find the number of second derivatives required
6639  const unsigned n_deriv = N2deriv[el_dim];
6640 
6641  //Get the values of the shape function and local derivatives
6642  d2shape_local(s,psi,dpsi,d2psi);
6643 
6644  //Allocate memory for the jacobian and inverse jacobian
6645  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian(el_dim), inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
6646  //Calculate the jacobian and inverse jacobian
6647  const double det =
6648  local_to_lagrangian_mapping(dpsi,jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
6649 
6650  //Allocate memory for the jacobian of second derivatives
6651  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian2(n_deriv,el_dim);
6652  //Assemble the jacobian of second derivatives
6653  assemble_local_to_lagrangian_jacobian2(d2psi,jacobian2);
6654 
6655  //Now set the value of the derivatives
6656  transform_second_derivatives(jacobian,inverse_jacobian,
6657  jacobian2,dpsi,d2psi);
6658  //Return the determinant of the mapping
6659  return det;
6660  }
6661 
6662 //==========================================================================
6663 /// \short Compute the geometric shape functions and also first
6664 /// and second derivatives w.r.t. Lagrangian coordinates at
6665 /// the ipt-th integration point
6666 /// Returns Jacobian of mapping from Lagrangian to local coordinates.
6667 /// Numbering:
6668 /// \b 1D:
6669 /// d2pidxi(i,0) = \f$ d^2 \psi_j / d \xi^2 \f$
6670 /// \b 2D:
6671 /// d2psidxi(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_0^2 \f$
6672 /// d2psidxi(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_1^2 \f$
6673 /// d2psidxi(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j/\partial \xi_0 \partial \xi_1 \f$
6674 /// \b 3D:
6675 /// d2psidxi(i,0) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_0^2 \f$
6676 /// d2psidxi(i,1) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_1^2 \f$
6677 /// d2psidxi(i,2) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j / \partial \xi_2^2 \f$
6678 /// d2psidxi(i,3) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j/\partial \xi_0 \partial \xi_1 \f$
6679 /// d2psidxi(i,4) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j/\partial \xi_0 \partial \xi_2 \f$
6680 /// d2psidxi(i,5) = \f$ \partial^2 \psi_j/\partial \xi_1 \partial \xi_2 \f$
6681 //========================================================================
6682  double SolidFiniteElement::d2shape_lagrangian_at_knot(const unsigned &ipt,
6683  Shape &psi,
6684  DShape &dpsi,
6685  DShape &d2psi) const
6686  {
6687  //Find the values of the indices of the shape functions
6688  //Find the element dimension
6689  const unsigned el_dim = dim();
6690  //Find the number of second derivatives required
6691  const unsigned n_deriv = N2deriv[el_dim];
6692 
6693  //Get the values of the shape function and local derivatives
6694  d2shape_local_at_knot(ipt,psi,dpsi,d2psi);
6695 
6696  //Allocate memory for the jacobian and inverse jacobian
6697  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian(el_dim), inverse_jacobian(el_dim);
6698  //Calculate the jacobian and inverse jacobian
6699  const double det =
6700  local_to_lagrangian_mapping(dpsi,jacobian,inverse_jacobian);
6701 
6702  //Allocate memory for the jacobian of second derivatives
6703  DenseMatrix<double> jacobian2(n_deriv,el_dim);
6704  //Assemble the jacobian of second derivatives
6705  assemble_local_to_lagrangian_jacobian2(d2psi,jacobian2);
6706 
6707  //Now set the value of the derivatives
6708  transform_second_derivatives(jacobian,inverse_jacobian,
6709  jacobian2,dpsi,d2psi);
6710  //Return the determinant of the mapping
6711  return det;
6712  }
6713 
6714 //============================================================================
6715 /// \short Function to describe the local dofs of the element. The ostream
6716 /// specifies the output stream to which the description
6717 /// is written; the string stores the currently
6718 /// assembled output that is ultimately written to the
6719 /// output stream by Data::describe_dofs(...); it is typically
6720 /// built up incrementally as we descend through the
6721 /// call hierarchy of this function when called from
6722 /// Problem::describe_dofs(...)
6723 //============================================================================
6724 void SolidFiniteElement::
6725 describe_solid_local_dofs(std::ostream& out,
6726  const std::string& current_string) const
6727 {
6728  //Find the number of nodes
6729  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
6730  //Loop over the nodes
6731  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
6732  {
6733  //Cast to a solid node
6734  SolidNode* cast_node_pt = static_cast<SolidNode*>(node_pt(n));
6735  std::stringstream conversion;
6736  conversion<<" of Solid Node "<<n<<current_string;
6737  std::string in(conversion.str());
6738  cast_node_pt->describe_dofs(out,in);
6739  }
6740 }
6741 
6742 //============================================================================
6743 /// Assign local equation numbers for the solid equations in the element.
6744 // This can be done at a high level assuming, as I am, that the equations will
6745 // always be formulated in terms of nodal positions.
6746 /// If the boolean argument is true then pointers to the dofs will be
6747 /// stored in Dof_pt.
6748 //============================================================================
6749  void SolidFiniteElement::assign_solid_local_eqn_numbers(
6750  const bool &store_local_dof_pt)
6751  {
6752  //Find the number of nodes
6753  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
6754 
6755  //Check there are nodes!
6756  if(n_node > 0)
6757  {
6758  //Find the number of position types and dimensions of the nodes
6759  //Local caching
6760  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
6761  const unsigned nodal_dim = nodal_dimension();
6762 
6763  //Delete the existing storage
6764  delete[] Position_local_eqn;
6765  //Resize the storage for the positional equation numbers
6766  Position_local_eqn = new int[n_node*n_position_type*nodal_dim];
6767 
6768  //A local queue to store the global equation numbers
6769  std::deque<unsigned long> global_eqn_number_queue;
6770 
6771  //Get the number of dofs so far, this must be outside both loops
6772  //so that both can use it
6773  unsigned local_eqn_number = ndof();
6774 
6775  //Loop over the nodes
6776  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
6777  {
6778  //Cast to a solid node
6779  SolidNode* cast_node_pt = static_cast<SolidNode*>(node_pt(n));
6780 
6781  //Loop over the number of position dofs
6782  for(unsigned j=0;j<n_position_type;j++)
6783  {
6784  //Loop over the dimension of each node
6785  for(unsigned k=0;k<nodal_dim;k++)
6786  {
6787  //Get equation number
6788  //Note eqn_number is long !
6789  long eqn_number = cast_node_pt->position_eqn_number(j,k);
6790  //If equation_number positive add to array
6791  if(eqn_number >= 0)
6792  {
6793  //Add to global array
6794  global_eqn_number_queue.push_back(eqn_number);
6795  //Add pointer to the dof to the queue if required
6796  if(store_local_dof_pt)
6797  {
6798  GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque.push_back(
6799  &(cast_node_pt->x_gen(j,k)));
6800  }
6801 
6802  //Add to look-up scheme
6803  Position_local_eqn[(n*n_position_type + j)*nodal_dim + k] =
6804  local_eqn_number;
6805  //Increment the local equation number
6806  local_eqn_number++;
6807  }
6808  else
6809  {
6810  Position_local_eqn[(n*n_position_type + j)*nodal_dim + k] =
6811  Data::Is_pinned;
6812  }
6813  }
6814  }
6815  } //End of loop over nodes
6816 
6817  //Now add our global equations numbers to the internal element storage
6818  add_global_eqn_numbers(global_eqn_number_queue,
6819  GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque);
6820  //Clear the memory used in the deque
6821  if(store_local_dof_pt)
6822  {std::deque<double*>().swap(GeneralisedElement::Dof_pt_deque);}
6823 
6824  } //End of the case when there are nodes
6825  }
6826 
6827 
6828 //============================================================================
6829 /// This function calculates the entries of Jacobian matrix, used in
6830 /// the Newton method, associated with the elastic problem in which the
6831 /// nodal position is a variable. It does this using finite differences,
6832 /// rather than an analytical formulation, so can be done in total generality.
6833 //==========================================================================
6834  void SolidFiniteElement::
6835  fill_in_jacobian_from_solid_position_by_fd(Vector<double> &residuals,
6836  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian)
6837  {
6838 
6839  // Flag to indicate if we use first or second order FD
6840  // bool use_first_order_fd=false;
6841 
6842  //Find the number of nodes
6843  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
6844 
6845  //If there aren't any nodes, then return straight away
6846  if(n_node == 0) {return;}
6847 
6848  //Call the update function to ensure that the element is in
6849  //a consistent state before finite differencing starts
6850  update_before_solid_position_fd();
6851 
6852  //Get the number of position dofs and dimensions at the node
6853  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
6854  const unsigned nodal_dim = nodal_dimension();
6855 
6856  //Find the number of dofs in the element
6857  const unsigned n_dof = this->ndof();
6858 
6859  //Create newres vectors
6860  Vector<double> newres(n_dof);
6861  // Vector<double> newres_minus(n_dof);
6862 
6863  //Integer storage for local unknown
6864  int local_unknown=0;
6865 
6866  //Should probably give this a more global scope
6867  const double fd_step = Default_fd_jacobian_step;
6868 
6869  //Loop over the nodes
6870  for(unsigned n=0;n<n_node;n++)
6871  {
6872  //Loop over position dofs
6873  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
6874  {
6875  //Loop over dimension
6876  for(unsigned i=0;i<nodal_dim;i++)
6877  {
6878  //If the variable is free
6879  local_unknown = position_local_eqn(n,k,i);
6880  if(local_unknown >= 0)
6881  {
6882  //Store a pointer to the (generalised) Eulerian nodal position
6883  double* const value_pt = &(node_pt(n)->x_gen(k,i));
6884 
6885  //Save the old value of the (generalised) Eulerian nodal position
6886  const double old_var = *value_pt;
6887 
6888  //Increment the (generalised) Eulerian nodal position
6889  *value_pt += fd_step;
6890 
6891  // Perform any auxialiary node updates
6892  node_pt(n)->perform_auxiliary_node_update_fct();
6893 
6894  // Update any other dependent variables
6895  update_in_solid_position_fd(n);
6896 
6897  //Calculate the new residuals
6898  get_residuals(newres);
6899 
6900 // if (use_first_order_fd)
6901  {
6902  //Do forward finite differences
6903  for(unsigned m=0;m<n_dof;m++)
6904  {
6905  //Stick the entry into the Jacobian matrix
6906  jacobian(m,local_unknown) = (newres[m] - residuals[m])/fd_step;
6907  }
6908  }
6909 // else
6910 // {
6911 // //Take backwards step for the (generalised) Eulerian nodal
6912 // // position
6913 // node_pt(n)->x_gen(k,i) = old_var-fd_step;
6914 
6915 // //Calculate the new residuals at backward position
6916 // get_residuals(newres_minus);
6917 
6918 // //Do central finite differences
6919 // for(unsigned m=0;m<n_dof;m++)
6920 // {
6921 // //Stick the entry into the Jacobian matrix
6922 // jacobian(m,local_unknown) =
6923 // (newres[m] - newres_minus[m])/(2.0*fd_step);
6924 // }
6925 // }
6926 
6927  //Reset the (generalised) Eulerian nodal position
6928  *value_pt = old_var;
6929 
6930 
6931  // Perform any auxialiary node updates
6932  node_pt(n)->perform_auxiliary_node_update_fct();
6933 
6934  // Reset any other dependent variables
6935  reset_in_solid_position_fd(n);
6936  }
6937  }
6938  }
6939  }
6940 
6941  //End of finite difference loop
6942  //Final reset of any dependent data
6943  reset_after_solid_position_fd();
6944  }
6945 
6946 //============================================================================
6947 /// Return i-th FE-interpolated Lagrangian coordinate at
6948 /// local coordinate s.
6949 //============================================================================
6950  double SolidFiniteElement::interpolated_xi(const Vector<double> &s,
6951  const unsigned &i) const
6952  {
6953  //Find the number of nodes
6954  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
6955 
6956  //Find the number of lagrangian types from the first node
6957  const unsigned n_lagrangian_type = nnodal_lagrangian_type();
6958 
6959  //Assign storage for the local shape function
6960  Shape psi(n_node,n_lagrangian_type);
6961 
6962  //Find the values of shape function
6963  shape(s,psi);
6964 
6965  //Initialise value of xi
6966  double interpolated_xi = 0.0;
6967 
6968  //Loop over the local nodes
6969  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
6970  {
6971  //Loop over the number of dofs
6972  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_lagrangian_type;k++)
6973  {
6974  interpolated_xi += lagrangian_position_gen(l,k,i)*psi(l,k);
6975  }
6976  }
6977 
6978  return(interpolated_xi);
6979  }
6980 
6981 //============================================================================
6982 /// Compute FE-interpolated Lagrangian coordinate vector xi[] at
6983 /// local coordinate s.
6984 //============================================================================
6985  void SolidFiniteElement::interpolated_xi(const Vector<double> &s,
6986  Vector<double> &xi) const
6987  {
6988  //Find the number of nodes
6989  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
6990 
6991  //Find the number of lagrangian types from the first node
6992  const unsigned n_lagrangian_type = nnodal_lagrangian_type();
6993 
6994  //Assign storage for the local shape function
6995  Shape psi(n_node,n_lagrangian_type);
6996 
6997  //Find the values of shape function
6998  shape(s,psi);
6999 
7000  //Read out the number of lagrangian coordinates from the node
7001  const unsigned n_lagrangian = lagrangian_dimension();
7002 
7003  //Loop over the number of lagrangian coordinates
7004  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_lagrangian;i++)
7005  {
7006  //Initialise component to zero
7007  xi[i] = 0.0;
7008 
7009  //Loop over the local nodes
7010  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
7011  {
7012  //Loop over the number of dofs
7013  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_lagrangian_type;k++)
7014  {
7015  xi[i] += lagrangian_position_gen(l,k,i)*psi(l,k);
7016  }
7017  }
7018  }
7019  }
7020 
7021 
7022 
7023 
7024 
7025 //============================================================================
7026 /// Compute derivatives of FE-interpolated Lagrangian coordinates xi
7027 /// with respect to local coordinates: dxids[i][j]=dxi_i/ds_j
7028 //============================================================================
7029 void SolidFiniteElement::interpolated_dxids(const Vector<double> &s,
7030  DenseMatrix<double> &dxids) const
7031 {
7032  //Find the number of nodes
7033  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
7034 
7035  //Find the number of lagrangian types from the first node
7036  const unsigned n_lagrangian_type = nnodal_lagrangian_type();
7037 
7038  // Dimension of the element = number of local coordinates
7039  unsigned el_dim=dim();
7040 
7041  //Assign storage for the local shape function
7042  Shape psi(n_node,n_lagrangian_type);
7043  DShape dpsi(n_node,n_lagrangian_type,el_dim);
7044 
7045  //Find the values of shape function and its derivs w.r.t. to local coords
7046  dshape_local(s,psi,dpsi);
7047 
7048  //Read out the number of lagrangian coordinates from the node
7049  const unsigned n_lagrangian = lagrangian_dimension();
7050 
7051  //Loop over the number of lagrangian and local coordinates
7052  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_lagrangian;i++)
7053  {
7054  for(unsigned j=0;j<el_dim;j++)
7055  {
7056  //Initialise component to zero
7057  dxids(i,j) = 0.0;
7058 
7059  //Loop over the local nodes
7060  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
7061  {
7062  //Loop over the number of dofs
7063  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_lagrangian_type;k++)
7064  {
7065  dxids(i,j) += lagrangian_position_gen(l,k,i)*dpsi(l,k,j);
7066  }
7067  }
7068  }
7069  }
7070 }
7071 
7072 //=======================================================================
7073 /// Add jacobian and residuals for consistent assignment of
7074 /// initial "accelerations" in Newmark scheme. Jacobian is the mass matrix.
7075 //=======================================================================
7076 void SolidFiniteElement::
7077 fill_in_jacobian_for_newmark_accel(DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian)
7078 {
7079 
7080 #ifdef PARANOID
7081  // Check that we're computing the real residuals, not the
7082  // ones corresponding to the assignement of a prescribed displacement
7083  if ((Solid_ic_pt!=0)||(!Solve_for_consistent_newmark_accel_flag))
7084  {
7085  std::ostringstream error_stream;
7086  error_stream << "Can only call fill_in_jacobian_for_newmark_accel()\n"
7087  << "With Solve_for_consistent_newmark_accel_flag:"
7088  << Solve_for_consistent_newmark_accel_flag << std::endl;
7089  error_stream << "Solid_ic_pt: " << Solid_ic_pt << std::endl;
7090 
7091  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
7092  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
7093  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
7094  }
7095 #endif
7096 
7097  //Find the number of nodes
7098  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
7099  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
7100  const unsigned nodal_dim = nodal_dimension();
7101 
7102  //Set the number of Lagrangian coordinates
7103  const unsigned n_lagrangian = dim();
7104 
7105  //Integer storage for local equation and unknown
7106  int local_eqn=0, local_unknown=0;
7107 
7108  // Set up memory for the shape functions:
7109  // # of nodes, # of positional dofs
7110  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
7111 
7112  // # of nodes, # of positional dofs, # of lagrangian coords (for deriv)
7113  // Not needed but they come for free when compute the Jacobian.
7114  DShape dpsidxi(n_node,n_position_type,n_lagrangian);
7115 
7116  //Set # of integration points
7117  const unsigned n_intpt = integral_pt()->nweight();
7118 
7119  //Set the Vector to hold local coordinates
7120  Vector<double> s(n_lagrangian);
7121 
7122  // Get positional timestepper from first nodal point
7123  TimeStepper* timestepper_pt= node_pt(0)->position_time_stepper_pt();
7124 
7125 #ifdef PARANOID
7126  // Of course all this only works if we're actually using a
7127  // Newmark timestepper!
7128  if (timestepper_pt->type()!="Newmark")
7129  {
7130  std::ostringstream error_stream;
7131  error_stream
7132  << "Assignment of Newmark accelerations obviously only works\n"
7133  << "for Newmark timesteppers. You've called me with "
7134  << timestepper_pt->type() << std::endl;
7135 
7136  throw OomphLibError(error_stream.str(),
7137  OOMPH_CURRENT_FUNCTION,
7138  OOMPH_EXCEPTION_LOCATION);
7139  }
7140 #endif
7141 
7142  // "Acceleration" is the last history value:
7143  const unsigned ntstorage=timestepper_pt->ntstorage();
7144  const double accel_weight=timestepper_pt->weight(2,ntstorage-1);
7145 
7146  //Loop over the integration points
7147  for(unsigned ipt=0;ipt<n_intpt;ipt++)
7148  {
7149 
7150  //Assign values of s
7151  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_lagrangian;i++) {s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);}
7152 
7153  //Get the integral weight
7154  double w = integral_pt()->weight(ipt);
7155 
7156  // Jacobian of mapping between local and Lagrangian coords and shape
7157  // functions
7158  double J = dshape_lagrangian(s,psi,dpsidxi);
7159 
7160  // Get Lagrangian coordinate
7161  Vector<double> xi(n_lagrangian);
7162  interpolated_xi(s,xi);
7163 
7164  // Get multiplier for inertia terms
7165  double factor=multiplier(xi);
7166 
7167  //Premultiply the weights and the Jacobian
7168  double W = w*J;
7169 
7170  //Loop over the nodes
7171  for(unsigned l0=0;l0<n_node;l0++)
7172  {
7173  //Loop over the positional dofs: 'Type': 0: displacement; 1: deriv
7174  for(unsigned k0=0;k0<n_position_type;k0++)
7175  {
7176  // Loop over Eulerian directions
7177  for(unsigned i0=0;i0<nodal_dim;i0++)
7178  {
7179  local_eqn = position_local_eqn(l0,k0,i0);
7180  //If it's a degree of freedom, add contribution
7181  if(local_eqn >= 0)
7182  {
7183  //Loop over the nodes
7184  for(unsigned l1=0;l1<n_node;l1++)
7185  {
7186  //Loop over the positional dofs: 'Type': 0: displacement;
7187  //1: deriv
7188  for(unsigned k1=0;k1<n_position_type;k1++)
7189  {
7190  // Loop over Eulerian directions
7191  unsigned i1=i0;
7192  {
7193  local_unknown = position_local_eqn(l1,k1,i1);
7194  //If it's a degree of freedom, add contribution
7195  if(local_unknown >= 0)
7196  {
7197  // Add contribution: Mass matrix, multiplied by
7198  // weight for "acceleration" in Newmark scheme
7199  // and general multiplier
7200  jacobian(local_eqn,local_unknown) +=
7201  factor*accel_weight*psi(l0,k0)*psi(l1,k1)*W;
7202  }
7203  }
7204  }
7205  }
7206  }
7207  }
7208  }
7209  }
7210 
7211  } //End of loop over the integration points
7212 
7213 }
7214 
7215 
7216 
7217 
7218 
7219 //=======================================================================
7220 /// Helper function to fill in the residuals and (if flag==1) the Jacobian
7221 /// for the setup of an initial condition. The global equations are:
7222 /// \f[
7223 /// 0 = \int \left( \sum_{j=1}^N \sum_{k=1}^K X_{ijk} \psi_{jk}(\xi_n)
7224 /// - \frac{\partial^D R^{(IC)}_i(\xi_n)}{\partial t^D}
7225 /// \right) \psi_{lm}(\xi_n) \ dv
7226 /// \mbox{ \ \ \ \ for \ \ \ $l=1,...,N, \ \ m=1,...,K$}
7227 /// \f]
7228 /// where \f$ N \f$ is the number of nodes in the mesh and \f$ K \f$
7229 /// the number of generalised nodal coordinates. The initial shape
7230 /// of the solid body, \f$ {\bf R}^{(IC)},\f$ and its time-derivatives
7231 /// are specified via the \c GeomObject that is stored in the
7232 /// \c SolidFiniteElement::SolidInitialCondition object. The latter also
7233 /// stores the order of the time-derivative \f$ D \f$ to be assigned.
7234 //=======================================================================
7235 void SolidFiniteElement::fill_in_generic_jacobian_for_solid_ic(
7236  Vector<double> &residuals,
7237  DenseMatrix<double> &jacobian,
7238  const unsigned& flag)
7239 {
7240  //Find the number of nodes and position types
7241  const unsigned n_node = nnode();
7242  const unsigned n_position_type = nnodal_position_type();
7243 
7244  //Set the dimension of the global coordinates
7245  const unsigned nodal_dim = nodal_dimension();
7246 
7247  //Find the number of lagragian types from the first node
7248  const unsigned n_lagrangian_type = nnodal_lagrangian_type();
7249 
7250  //Set the number of lagrangian coordinates
7251  const unsigned n_lagrangian = dim();
7252 
7253  //Integer storage for local equation number
7254  int local_eqn=0;
7255  int local_unknown=0;
7256 
7257  // # of nodes, # of positional dofs
7258  Shape psi(n_node,n_position_type);
7259 
7260  // # of nodes, # of positional dofs, # of lagrangian coords (for deriv)
7261  // not needed but they come for free when we compute the Jacobian
7262  //DShape dpsidxi(n_node,n_position_type,n_lagrangian);
7263 
7264  //Set # of integration points
7265  const unsigned n_intpt = integral_pt()->nweight();
7266 
7267  //Set the Vector to hold local coordinates
7268  Vector<double> s(n_lagrangian);
7269 
7270  //Loop over the integration points
7271  for(unsigned ipt=0;ipt<n_intpt;ipt++)
7272  {
7273 
7274  //Assign values of s
7275  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_lagrangian;i++)
7276  {s[i] = integral_pt()->knot(ipt,i);}
7277 
7278  //Get the integral weight
7279  double w = integral_pt()->weight(ipt);
7280 
7281  // Shape fcts
7282  shape(s,psi);
7283 
7284  // Get Lagrangian coordinate
7285  Vector<double> xi(n_lagrangian,0.0);
7286 
7287  //Loop over the number of lagrangian coordinates
7288  for(unsigned i=0;i<n_lagrangian;i++)
7289  {
7290  //Loop over the local nodes
7291  for(unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
7292  {
7293  //Loop over the number of dofs
7294  for(unsigned k=0;k<n_lagrangian_type;k++)
7295  {
7296  xi[i] += lagrangian_position_gen(l,k,i)*psi(l,k);
7297  }
7298  }
7299  }
7300 
7301  // Get initial condition
7302  Vector<double> drdt_ic(nodal_dim);
7303  Solid_ic_pt->geom_object_pt()->
7304  dposition_dt(xi,Solid_ic_pt->ic_time_deriv(),drdt_ic);
7305 
7306  // Weak form of assignment of initial guess
7307 
7308  //Loop over the number of node
7309  for (unsigned l=0;l<n_node;l++)
7310  {
7311  //Loop over the type of degree of freedom
7312  for (unsigned k=0;k<n_position_type;k++)
7313  {
7314  //Loop over the coordinate directions
7315  for (unsigned i=0;i<nodal_dim;i++)
7316  {
7317  local_eqn = position_local_eqn(l,k,i);
7318 
7319  //If it's not a boundary condition
7320  if(local_eqn >= 0)
7321  {
7322  // Note we're ignoring the mapping between local and
7323  // global Lagrangian coords -- doesn't matter here;
7324  // we're just enforcing a slightly different
7325  // weak form.
7326  residuals[local_eqn] += (interpolated_x(s,i)-drdt_ic[i])*
7327  psi(l,k)*w;
7328 
7329 
7330  // Do Jacobian too?
7331  if (flag==1)
7332  {
7333 
7334  //Loop over the number of node
7335  for (unsigned ll=0;ll<n_node;ll++)
7336  {
7337  //Loop over the type of degree of freedom
7338  for (unsigned kk=0;kk<n_position_type;kk++)
7339  {
7340 
7341  // Only diagonal term
7342  unsigned ii=i;
7343 
7344  local_unknown = position_local_eqn(ll,kk,ii);
7345 
7346  //If it's not a boundary condition
7347  if(local_unknown >= 0)
7348  {
7349  // Note we're ignoring the mapping between local and
7350  // global Lagrangian coords -- doesn't matter here;
7351  // we're just enforcing a slightly different
7352  // weak form.
7353  jacobian(local_eqn,local_unknown) +=
7354  psi(ll,kk)*psi(l,k)*w;
7355  }
7356  else
7357  {
7358  oomph_info
7359  << "WARNING: You should really free all Data"
7360  << std::endl
7361  << " before setup of initial guess"
7362  << std::endl
7363  << "ll, kk, ii " << ll << " " << kk << " " << ii
7364  << std::endl;
7365  }
7366  }
7367  }
7368 
7369  }
7370  }
7371  else
7372  {
7373  oomph_info
7374  << "WARNING: You should really free all Data" << std::endl
7375  << " before setup of initial guess" << std::endl
7376  << "l, k, i " << l << " " << k << " " << i << std::endl;
7377  }
7378  }
7379  }
7380  }
7381 
7382  } //End of loop over the integration points
7383 }
7384 
7385 
7386 //===============================================================
7387 /// Return the geometric shape function at the local coordinate s
7388 //===============================================================
7389  void PointElement::shape(const Vector<double> &s, Shape &psi) const
7390  {
7391  // Single shape function always has value 1
7392  psi[0]=1.0;
7393  }
7394 
7395 //=======================================================================
7396 /// Assign the static Default_integration_scheme
7397 //=======================================================================
7398 PointIntegral PointElement::Default_integration_scheme;
7399 
7400 
7401 }

Definition: elements.cc:4563

a
often abbreviated as dof b History b history values are but b not b the values at previous timesteps b Pinned c c c Mesh and c Problem subsection data Data The most elementary data structure in c oomph lib is c these values fall into two and those that must be determined as part of the solution c Data stores a value a double precision number the values of the unknowns are determined by the solution of a system of algebraic equations The solution of this system usually requires a(linear) numbering of the unknowns and associated equations.
